original: lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings la g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa gdengs can rnams kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur //
analyzed: lag pa dag gis rdo rje bcings la g-yo ba'i gdengs ka'i rnam pa gdengs can rnams kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur //
translated: The hands in vajra-clasp, with the fingers in the form of a moving hood, is the seal of the serpents.

original: mthe bong dag dang mthe'u chung sbyar ba padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs gung mo dag ni brkyang ba dang // mdzub mo gnyis ni zla ba phyed pa ming med 'og tu bskum pa rang gi lag mthil son gyur pa //
analyzed: mthe bong dag dang mthe'u chung sbyar ba padma'i 'dab ma dang mtshungs gung mo dag ni brkyang ba dang // mdzub mo gnyis ni zla ba phyed pa ming med 'og tu bskum pa rang gi lag mthil son gyur pa //
translated: The thumbs and little fingers joined like lotus petals, the middle fingers extended, the two forefingers in the form of a half-moon, the name-fingers bent under the thumbs, resting in the palm of the hand,

original: phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje can gyi rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te bstan par bya pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di ni rdo rje can gyi rdo rje rtse mo lnga par 'gyur te bstan par bya pa'o //
translated: this seal becomes the five-pointed vajra of the Vajra-holder, and should be displayed.

original: rtsibs kyi rnam pa sor mo rnams te lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil du mthe bong la sogs mtha' dag rnams //
analyzed: rtsibs kyi rnam pa sor mo rnams te lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil du mthe bong la sogs mtha' dag rnams //
translated: The fingers in the form of spokes, the thumbs and all the rest in the palms of both hands,

original: lag pa gnyis ni rdo rje bcings pa rdo rjer 'gyur te rdo rje khu tshur dag gis dril bu  ra bcas //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis ni rdo rje bcings pa rdo rjer 'gyur te rdo rje khu tshur dag gis dril bu  ra bcas //
translated: the hands in vajra-clasp, is the vajra, and with vajra-fists and bells attached,

original: khu tshur phyed pa mdzub mo dang ni gung mo mda' dang mtshungs pa dag kyang ral gri rnon por 'gyur //
analyzed: khu tshur phyed pa mdzub mo dang ni gung mo mda' dang mtshungs pa dag kyang ral gri rnon por 'gyur //
translated: the half-fist with the forefinger and middle finger like an arrow, is also a sharp sword.

original: mdzub mo la sogs rtse gsum slar yang bkram pa dag ste khu tshur phyed pa yis ni rtse gsum la //
analyzed: mdzub mo la sogs rtse gsum slar yang bkram pa dag ste khu tshur phyed pa yis ni rtse gsum la //
translated: The three points of the index finger, etc., are extended again, and with half-fist, [the hand] is the three points.

original: dpal ldan gri gug khu tshur bcings shing dpal ldan mthe chung zla ba phyed pa 'jigs pa byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: dpal ldan gri gug khu tshur bcings shing dpal ldan mthe chung zla ba phyed pa 'jigs pa byed par 'gyur //
translated: The glorious curved knife is formed by clenching the fist, and the glorious half-moon little finger is terrifying.

original: rna ba'i steng du khu tshur bcings shing mthe bong gung mo'i steng du 'gyur te mda' yi mchog la'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i steng du khu tshur bcings shing mthe bong gung mo'i steng du 'gyur te mda' yi mchog la'o //
translated: The fist is clenched above the ear, and the thumb and index finger are above, for the supreme arrow.

original: khu tshur bcings shing mdzub mo shin tu 'khyog por 'gyur ro mi bdag de bzhin nyid du lcags kyu la'o //
analyzed: khu tshur bcings shing mdzub mo shin tu 'khyog por 'gyur ro mi bdag de bzhin nyid du lcags kyu la'o //
translated: The fist is clenched, and the index finger is very bent, O King, just so for the iron hook.

original: rtsa bar mdzub mo ming @108a *//
analyzed: rtsa bar mdzub mo ming @108a *//
translated: The index finger is in the hollow of the root

original: med du 'gyur mda' dang mtshungs pa'i steng du gung mo yang ni mdung la ste //
analyzed: med du 'gyur mda' dang mtshungs pa'i steng du gung mo yang ni mdung la ste //
translated: and the middle finger is like an arrow above, and the spear.

original: thad kar khu tshur dbyug pa la 'o lag mthil shin tu mnyam la mthe bong brkyang ba dgra sta la //
analyzed: thad kar khu tshur dbyug pa la 'o lag mthil shin tu mnyam la mthe bong brkyang ba dgra sta la //
translated: The fist is straight for the club, and the palm is very level with the thumb extended for the axe.

original: steng du khu tshur gnyis ngang mdzub mor 'gyur te lha min bdag po glang chen bags pa dag la'o //
analyzed: steng du khu tshur gnyis ngang mdzub mor 'gyur te lha min bdag po glang chen bags pa dag la'o //
translated: Above, the two fists become the two fingers, and the lord of the demigods is in the elephant skin.

original: mche ba la ni lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil du khu tshur bcings shing mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa'o //üîΩkhe ta ka la dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang zhing lag pa'i mthil ni steng du son par 'gyur //
analyzed: mche ba la ni lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil du khu tshur bcings shing mthe'u chung zla ba phyed pa'o // khe ta ka la dpung pa g-yon pa rab tu brkyang zhing lag pa'i mthil ni steng du son par 'gyur //
translated: In the tusk, the two palms are clenched into fists, and the little fingers are half-moons.üîΩIn the ketu, the left arm is extended, and the palm of the hand reaches above.

original: kha t'am ga la khu tshur bug par 'gyur te nges pa nyid du phrag par mthe'u chung brkyang ba 'o //
analyzed: kha t'am ga la khu tshur bug par 'gyur te nges pa nyid du phrag par mthe'u chung brkyang ba 'o //
translated: In the khatvanga, the fist becomes the hole, and the little finger is extended to the shoulder.

original: sor mo bug pa med pa'i lag pa pad 'dab lta bu steng du byas ba dpal ldan thod pa la //
analyzed: sor mo bug pa med pa'i lag pa pad 'dab lta bu steng du byas ba dpal ldan thod pa la //
translated: The hand without a hole in the fingers, like a lotus leaf, is above in the glorious skull-cup.

original: gzhu la lag pa gan rkyal khu tshur du 'gyur nges par dpung ba g-yon pa rab tu brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhu la lag pa gan rkyal khu tshur du 'gyur nges par dpung ba g-yon pa rab tu brkyang ba'o //
translated: In the bow, the hand is supine and becomes a fist, and the left arm is extended.

original: gung mo dag ni mdzub mo 'khyog po kun tu brten par 'gyur te nges par rdo rje zhags pa la //
analyzed: gung mo dag ni mdzub mo 'khyog po kun tu brten par 'gyur te nges par rdo rje zhags pa la //
translated: The two middle fingers are bent and touch, and the vajra noose is extended.

original: rin chen la ni sbyar ba'i sor mor 'gyur te mi bdag de dag rnam par phye ba padma la; ;chu na rgyu ba la ni mdzub mo mthe bong sbyar bar 'gyur te mthe bo'i 'og tu khu tshur ro //üîΩme long la ni shin tu mnyam pa'i lag mthil sor mo bug med dang bcas mngon du phyogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rin chen la ni sbyar ba'i sor mor 'gyur te mi bdag de dag rnam par phye ba padma la; ;chu na rgyu ba la ni mdzub mo mthe bong sbyar bar 'gyur te mthe bo'i 'og tu khu tshur ro // me long la ni shin tu mnyam pa'i lag mthil sor mo bug med dang bcas mngon du phyogs par 'gyur //
translated: The water-born is formed by the thumb and forefinger joined together, with the fist closed around the thumb.üîΩThe mirror is formed by the two palms turned upward, with the fingers straight and not touching.

original: mthe bong la ni mdzub mo la sogs steng du 'khyog por mi par yongs su bkod pa lcags sgrog la'o //
analyzed: mthe bong la ni mdzub mo la sogs steng du 'khyog por mi par yongs su bkod pa lcags sgrog la'o //
translated: The chain is formed by the fingers of the two hands crossed over each other and turned upward.

original: mgo bo la ni mthe bong la sogs bzhi po gdong dang mtshungs shing 'og @108b tu mthe'u chung bskum pa'o //
analyzed: mgo bo la ni mthe bong la sogs bzhi po gdong dang mtshungs shing 'og @108b tu mthe'u chung bskum pa'o //
translated: The head is formed by the four fingers, beginning with the thumb, turned upward and bent, with the little finger bent downward.

original: cod pan la ni lag pa dag gis dung gis phyag rgya mdzub mo gnyis po sbyar ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: cod pan la ni lag pa dag gis dung gis phyag rgya mdzub mo gnyis po sbyar ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The crown is formed by the two hands turned upward, with the two forefingers joined together.

original: lag mthil dag gi rgyab tu sor mo lnga po rnams ni gcig tu sbyar  ba dag kyang rna rgyan la //
analyzed: lag mthil dag gi rgyab tu sor mo lnga po rnams ni gcig tu sbyar  ba dag kyang rna rgyan la //
translated: The earrings are formed by the five fingers of the two hands turned upward and joined together.

original: lag pa'i rgyab tu sor mo rnams ni rim par yongs su bkod cing bcings pa mgul ba'i rgyan la ste //
analyzed: lag pa'i rgyab tu sor mo rnams ni rim par yongs su bkod cing bcings pa mgul ba'i rgyan la ste //
translated: The fingers of the back of the hand are arranged in order and bound in the necklace.

original: lag pa gnyis ka'i sor mo gsum ni phan tshun sbyar cing thog mtha'i bskum pa dag ni ske rags la //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis ka'i sor mo gsum ni phan tshun sbyar cing thog mtha'i bskum pa dag ni ske rags la //
translated: The three fingers of both hands are joined together, and the first and last are bent in the girdle.

original: khu tshur bcings nas mthe bong dag dang gung mo gnyis po zlum skor lta bur byas pa rkang gdub la //
analyzed: khu tshur bcings nas mthe bong dag dang gung mo gnyis po zlum skor lta bur byas pa rkang gdub la //
translated: Having made a fist, the thumbs and middle fingers are made like a circle in the anklet.

original: de bzhin du ni dpung rgyan zung dang gdu bu la yang mdzub mo phan tshun sbyar ba dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni dpung rgyan zung dang gdu bu la yang mdzub mo phan tshun sbyar ba dag tu 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, the pair of armlets and the bracelets are made with the index fingers joined together.

original: mthe bong mkha' 'gro ma rnams dag gis mchog gi rigs su 'gyur te mdzub mo gsang ba pa rnams kyi //
analyzed: mthe bong mkha' 'gro ma rnams dag gis mchog gi rigs su 'gyur te mdzub mo gsang ba pa rnams kyi //
translated: The thumbs are the supreme family of the dakinis, and the index fingers are the secret ones.

original: dri za rnams dang gdengs can rnams kyi gung mo ming med dag ni rim par yongs su bkod pa'o //
analyzed: dri za rnams dang gdengs can rnams kyi gung mo ming med dag ni rim par yongs su bkod pa'o //
translated: The middle fingers and the little fingers are the Gandharvas and the Nagas, respectively, arranged in order.

original: 'byung po rnams kyi dpal ldan mthe'u chung rab mchog lag pa'i mthil ni srin po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams kyi dpal ldan mthe'u chung rab mchog lag pa'i mthil ni srin po rnams kyi rigs su 'gyur //
translated: The glorious little fingers are the supreme of the spirits, and the palm of the hand is the family of the rakshasas.

original: grub ba rnams kyi khu tshur bcings pa mchog gi rigs te tshigs kyi mtshams ni lha rnams dag gi 'o //
analyzed: grub ba rnams kyi khu tshur bcings pa mchog gi rigs te tshigs kyi mtshams ni lha rnams dag gi 'o //
translated: The clenched fist of the accomplished ones is the mudrƒÅ of the supreme family, and the joints are of the gods.

original: lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil du sor mo lnga po phyed 'khyog rigs kyi phyag rgya snger mo can rnams kyi //
analyzed: lag pa gnyis ka'i mthil du sor mo lnga po phyed 'khyog rigs kyi phyag rgya snger mo can rnams kyi //
translated: On the palms of both hands, the five fingers bent in half are the mudrƒÅ of the families of the two-armed ones.

original: khu tshur bcings las mdzub mo gnyis po phyed 'khyog nges par mgo bor son pa na can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: khu tshur bcings las mdzub mo gnyis po phyed 'khyog nges par mgo bor son pa na can rnams kyi'o //
translated: From the clenched fist, the two index fingers bent in half are definitely on the head of the four-armed ones.

original: mi mnyam lag ba'i mthil la mthe chung phan tshun bcings shing gshog pa spyar ba sgong skyes rnams kyi ste //
analyzed: mi mnyam lag ba'i mthil la mthe chung phan tshun bcings shing gshog pa spyar ba sgong skyes rnams kyi ste //
translated: On the palms of the uneven-armed ones, the little fingers are crossed with each other, and the wings are spread out for the egg-born ones.

original: sor mo lnga po rtse mo 'khyog pa @109a *//
analyzed: sor mo lnga po rtse mo 'khyog pa @109a *//
translated: The five fingers are bent at the tips.

original: gdengs can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //
analyzed: gdengs can rnams kyi rigs kyi phyag rgya khyad par 'phags par 'gyur //
translated: This is the special mudrƒÅ of the families of the nƒÅgas.

original: nyin zhag so so'i gtor ma la ni mdzub mo'i mtha' rnams rab brkyang gzhan pa'o 'og tu sbyar byas pa //
analyzed: nyin zhag so so'i gtor ma la ni mdzub mo'i mtha' rnams rab brkyang gzhan pa'o 'og tu sbyar byas pa //
translated: For the bali offering of each day, the tips of the index fingers are extended, and the others are joined below.

original: 'bar ba dag la mthe bong sbyar te mchog gi lag mthil dag gi mdzub mo brkyang ba gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba dag la mthe bong sbyar te mchog gi lag mthil dag gi mdzub mo brkyang ba gzhan pa'o //
translated: The thumb joined to the flame, the forefinger extended on the palm, is the other.

original: mdzub mo bstan ni legs par 'ongs sam dag kyang nges par brjod par 'gyur te rnal 'byor pa la yang //
analyzed: mdzub mo bstan ni legs par 'ongs sam dag kyang nges par brjod par 'gyur te rnal 'byor pa la yang //
translated: The forefinger displayed, one should say, Welcome! to the yogin.

original: gnyis kyis shin tu legs par 'ongs dang skal bzang dge ba mthe bong bcings pas rab tu brjod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyis kyis shin tu legs par 'ongs dang skal bzang dge ba mthe bong bcings pas rab tu brjod par 'gyur //
translated: With two, Very welcome! Fortunate! Virtuous! is expressed by the clenched fist.

original: sor mo'i se gol rdeb pa khyod ni 'di ru sngags pa mchog ces par ni brjod par 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: sor mo'i se gol rdeb pa khyod ni 'di ru sngags pa mchog ces par ni brjod par 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The snapping of the fingers, You are the best of magicians here! is said.

original: mthe bong dang ni ming med dag gis dam tshig bcas pa'i chang gis khyod ni tshim bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mthe bong dang ni ming med dag gis dam tshig bcas pa'i chang gis khyod ni tshim bar byed pa'o //
translated: The thumb and the little finger form the pledge, and you are satisfied with the wine.

original: sor mo thams cad rtse mo brkyang pas skal bzang legs par 'ongs pa brjod 'gyur rnal 'byor pa la yang //
analyzed: sor mo thams cad rtse mo brkyang pas skal bzang legs par 'ongs pa brjod 'gyur rnal 'byor pa la yang //
translated: All the fingers extended, Fortunate! Welcome! is said to the yogin.

original: g-yon gyi yan lag reg pas rtag tu khyod ni bdag gi gnyen gcig pu dag rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: g-yon gyi yan lag reg pas rtag tu khyod ni bdag gi gnyen gcig pu dag rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: The left limb touched, You are always my only friend! is clearly expressed.

original: skye gnas dag la reg pas gtso bo mchu dang nu ma zung dang gnes par sen mo 'debs pas kyang //
analyzed: skye gnas dag la reg pas gtso bo mchu dang nu ma zung dang gnes par sen mo 'debs pas kyang //
translated: The principal parts of the body are the lips and the two breasts, and the nails are used for scratching.üîΩWhen the fingers are crossed and the middle finger and the thumb are extended, this is the expression of the pledge.

original: sor mo sor mo phan tshun bcings shing gung mo dang ni mthe bong brkyang pas dam tshig brjod par byed pa yin; ;mchu dang smin ma mig dag yo zhing mgo la 'phrug par byed na shin tu rmongs pa rjod par byed //
analyzed: sor mo sor mo phan tshun bcings shing gung mo dang ni mthe bong brkyang pas dam tshig brjod par byed pa yin; ;mchu dang smin ma mig dag yo zhing mgo la 'phrug par byed na shin tu rmongs pa rjod par byed //
translated: When the lips, the eyebrows, and the eyes are crooked and the head is scratched, this expresses great confusion.

original: mche ba'i dbus su mthe chung dang ni snying ga kha ru mdzub mos 'jigs pa rab tu @109b gsal bar byed //
analyzed: mche ba'i dbus su mthe chung dang ni snying ga kha ru mdzub mos 'jigs pa rab tu @109b gsal bar byed //
translated: When the little finger is in the middle of the teeth and the index finger is at the heart, this clearly expresses fear.

original: mthe bong khu tshur bcings pa dang ni lag pa rkang ba sa la rdeb na da yis bza' bar bya //
analyzed: mthe bong khu tshur bcings pa dang ni lag pa rkang ba sa la rdeb na da yis bza' bar bya //
translated: When the fist is clenched with the thumb and the hand and foot are slapped, this means ‚Äúeat.‚Äù

original: lce la reg na zos pa dang ni lto dang so dang bsnun pa dag gis ma zos pa nyid do //
analyzed: lce la reg na zos pa dang ni lto dang so dang bsnun pa dag gis ma zos pa nyid do //
translated: When the tongue is touched, this means ‚ÄúI have eaten,‚Äù and the stomach, the teeth, and the lips mean ‚ÄúI have not eaten.‚Äù

original: lag pa'i rgyab kyis song zhig nges par rab tu brjod de mngon du phyogs pas 'dug cig 'dug cig go /
analyzed: lag pa'i rgyab kyis song zhig nges par rab tu brjod de mngon du phyogs pas 'dug cig 'dug cig go /
translated: When the back of the hand is shown, this clearly expresses ‚Äúgo,‚Äù and when it is turned toward the other person, this means ‚Äúsit down, sit down.‚Äù

original: byin pa bral la nyed na skal bzang khyod ni de ring kho na ngal bso des par rjod par byed //
analyzed: byin pa bral la nyed na skal bzang khyod ni de ring kho na ngal bso des par rjod par byed //
translated: If you are tired of giving, O fortunate one, today you are to be praised as a true ascetic.

original: rkang ba rab tu skyod bas gnyid dang pus mo zung dag skyong ba bdag la bdag la shin tu dga' ba gyis //
analyzed: rkang ba rab tu skyod bas gnyid dang pus mo zung dag skyong ba bdag la bdag la shin tu dga' ba gyis //
translated: With the feet well-placed, the knees protected, and the hands on the head, I love myself is said.

original: yan lag kun la reg par byed cing kha ru lag pa gnas pa bdag la 'dus pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag kun la reg par byed cing kha ru lag pa gnas pa bdag la 'dus pa med pa'o //
translated: Touching all the limbs, with the hands in the mouth, it is said to be without union.

original: phan tshun lag ba bcings pas bdag gi khyim du de ring 'khor lo 'dus pa dag ni rjod par byed //
analyzed: phan tshun lag ba bcings pas bdag gi khyim du de ring 'khor lo 'dus pa dag ni rjod par byed //
translated: With the hands crossed, Today the wheel has come to my house is said.

original: mthe bong ming med rtse mo dag gis rnam mang dam tshig rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya //
analyzed: mthe bong ming med rtse mo dag gis rnam mang dam tshig rnams kyis ji ltar 'dod par mchod par bya //
translated: With the tips of the thumb and ring finger, with many pledges, worship as desired.

original: rkang ba la ni 'phrug par byed na de bzhin du ni phyi rol 'dus pa dag la 'gro ba yang //
analyzed: rkang ba la ni 'phrug par byed na de bzhin du ni phyi rol 'dus pa dag la 'gro ba yang //
translated: If one scratches the feet, In the same way, go to the external assembly.

original: mdzub mo phan tshun bcings na rdo rje'i grogs po khyod ni de ring 'jigs pa 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdzub mo phan tshun bcings na rdo rje'i grogs po khyod ni de ring 'jigs pa 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: If the index fingers are crossed, O vajra friend, today you are to take away fear.

original: skra ni rang gi so yis gcod na mi yi phyugs khyod 'dir ni ltung bar bya brjod par byed //
analyzed: skra ni rang gi so yis gcod na mi yi phyugs khyod 'dir ni ltung bar bya brjod par byed //
translated: If you bite your lip with your teeth, you are saying, ‚ÄúI will fall down here.‚Äù

original: so ni phan tshun 'da' bar byed na khyod kyi sha ni 'di dag bdag gis de ring bza' bar bya //
analyzed: so ni phan tshun 'da' bar byed na khyod kyi sha ni 'di dag bdag gis de ring bza' bar bya //
translated: If you cross your teeth, you are saying, ‚ÄúToday I will eat your flesh.‚Äù

original: lce mchu g-yo bar byed na khyod kyi lus las khrag ni btung bar bya'o nges par brjod par byed //
analyzed: lce mchu g-yo bar byed na khyod kyi lus las khrag ni btung bar bya'o nges par brjod par byed //
translated: If you move your tongue and lips, you are saying, ‚ÄúI will drink your blood.‚Äù

original: mchu la so ni 'debs par byed na khyod kyi sgyu ma lto bar gnas 'di bdag gis bza' bar bya //üîΩsgeg pa'i sbyor ba yis ni sgeg par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bzhad pa'i @110a *//
analyzed: mchu la so ni 'debs par byed na khyod kyi sgyu ma lto bar gnas 'di bdag gis bza' bar bya // sgeg pa'i sbyor ba yis ni sgeg par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po bzhad pa'i @110a *//
translated: If you bite your lip with your teeth, you are saying, ‚ÄúI will eat your illusory belly.‚ÄùüîΩBy the application of flirtation, there is flirtation.

original: sbyor bas bzhad pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor bas bzhad pa'o //
translated: By the application of laughter, there is laughter.

original: gar gyi sbyor ba yis ni gar du 'gyur te rnam ba mang bo'i rol mo'i sbyor bas rol mo'o //
analyzed: gar gyi sbyor ba yis ni gar du 'gyur te rnam ba mang bo'i rol mo'i sbyor bas rol mo'o //
translated: By the application of dance, there is dance. By the application of many kinds of music, there is music.

original: klu yi sbyor ba mis ni glu ste mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dri yi sbyor ba dag gis dri //
analyzed: klu yi sbyor ba mis ni glu ste mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dri yi sbyor ba dag gis dri //
translated: By the application of song, there is song. By the application of many kinds of excellent qualities, there is smell.

original: phreng ba'i sbyor ba yis ni phreng bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis sbos kyi sbyor ba dag gis spos //
analyzed: phreng ba'i sbyor ba yis ni phreng bar 'gyur te yon tan dbang gis sbos kyi sbyor ba dag gis spos //
translated: By the application of the rosary, there is the rosary; by the application of the incense, there is the incense, by the power of the qualities.

original: mar me'i rnam pas mar me nges par mun pa bcom pa dang ni snod kyi phyag rgya bdud rtsir 'gyur //
analyzed: mar me'i rnam pas mar me nges par mun pa bcom pa dang ni snod kyi phyag rgya bdud rtsir 'gyur //
translated: By the form of the lamp, there is the lamp, which certainly conquers the darkness; by the application of the vessel, there is the nectar of the seal.

original: zhes pa de ltar phyag rgya thams cad slar yang de nas lnga yi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar phyag rgya thams cad slar yang de nas lnga yi dbye bas rnam par phye ba ste //
translated: Thus, all the seals are again divided by the division into five.

original: gzhan pa phyag rgya mtha' yas rnams kyang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
analyzed: gzhan pa phyag rgya mtha' yas rnams kyang mtha' dag lus la gnas pa rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
translated: The yogi should know that all the infinite seals reside in the body.

original: gang gang dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur sa yi steng du de yi rang bzhin dag kyang phyag rgya rnams //
analyzed: gang gang dngos po'i rang bzhin du 'gyur sa yi steng du de yi rang bzhin dag kyang phyag rgya rnams //
translated: Whatever is the nature of things on the surface of the earth, that nature is also the seals.

original: pho nya mo ni 'phreng la blta bas khyod ni gang zhig nas 'ongs skal pa bzang la rjod par byed //
analyzed: pho nya mo ni 'phreng la blta bas khyod ni gang zhig nas 'ongs skal pa bzang la rjod par byed //
translated: The messenger, looking at the rosary, says, From where have you come, O fortunate one?

original: mgo bor lag bzhag de yi phyogs su nges par bltas pa rnal 'byor pa yis lan ni smras par 'gyur //
analyzed: mgo bor lag bzhag de yi phyogs su nges par bltas pa rnal 'byor pa yis lan ni smras par 'gyur //
translated: Placing her hand on her head, she looks in that direction, and the yogi replies.

original: steng du blta bas khyod ni dge 'am sa yi steng du gnas pas khyod ni 'dug la ngal so cig /üîΩyon bor blta bas khyod song chags pa'i lta bas pho nya mo ni shin tu dga' brjod par byed //
analyzed: steng du blta bas khyod ni dge 'am sa yi steng du gnas pas khyod ni 'dug la ngal so cig / yon bor blta bas khyod song chags pa'i lta bas pho nya mo ni shin tu dga' brjod par byed //
translated: If you look above, you are virtuous, and if you are on the ground, you are standing, and so on.üîΩIf you look to the side, you are gone, and if you look with attachment, you are the messenger, and so on.

original: zhi ba'i lta bas bdag gi grog po khro gnyer khro bo'i lta bas 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: zhi ba'i lta bas bdag gi grog po khro gnyer khro bo'i lta bas 'jigs pa rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: If you look with a peaceful expression, you are my friend, and if you look with a frown, you are fearful, and so on.

original: skra la blta bas bdag ni ma rungs par brjod skal bzang la ni rang gi rang bzhin zur gyis so //üîΩmdzod spur blta bas bdag @110b mchog rnal 'byor ma ni snal blta bas yon tan rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: skra la blta bas bdag ni ma rungs par brjod skal bzang la ni rang gi rang bzhin zur gyis so // mdzod spur blta bas bdag @110b mchog rnal 'byor ma ni snal blta bas yon tan rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: If you look with your hair disheveled, you are wicked, and if you look with a good fortune, you are natural, and so on.üîΩIf you look with your eyebrows raised, you are supreme, and if you look with your nose, you are virtuous, and so on.

original: mchu la blta bas skal pa bzang ste nu ma zung la blta na bdag ni phyag rgya bzang mor brjod //
analyzed: mchu la blta bas skal pa bzang ste nu ma zung la blta na bdag ni phyag rgya bzang mor brjod //
translated: If you look with your lips, you are fortunate, and if you look with your breasts, you are the good seal, and so on.

original: snying gar blta bas bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid lag ba zung la blta na bdag ni rab tu gtum mor brjod //
analyzed: snying gar blta bas bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid lag ba zung la blta na bdag ni rab tu gtum mor brjod //
translated: If you look with your heart, you are the one who meditates, and if you look with your hands, you are very fierce, and so on.

original: phrag par blta bas bdag ni nus ma sen mo dang bcas lag pa'i mthil la blta na srin mo 'o //
analyzed: phrag par blta bas bdag ni nus ma sen mo dang bcas lag pa'i mthil la blta na srin mo 'o //
translated: Looking at the shoulders, I am the goddess of power, and looking at the palms of the hands, I am the demoness.

original: rgyab tu blta na lag 'gro ma ste lte bar blta bas mi yi dbang po bdag ni dam tshig can //
analyzed: rgyab tu blta na lag 'gro ma ste lte bar blta bas mi yi dbang po bdag ni dam tshig can //
translated: Looking at the back, I am the goddess of the serpents, and looking at the navel, I am the lord of men, and I am the one who is faithful.

original: gsang bar blta bas bdag ni dag pa brla la blta bas bdag ni shin tu dga' la gdul bar dka'//
analyzed: gsang bar blta bas bdag ni dag pa brla la blta bas bdag ni shin tu dga' la gdul bar dka'//
translated: Looking at the secret place, I am the pure one, and looking at the thighs, I am the one who is very pleased and difficult to tame.

original: pus mor blta bas bdag ni grub pa nges par rjod byed rkang bar blta bas rdzu 'phrul sbyin pa mo //
analyzed: pus mor blta bas bdag ni grub pa nges par rjod byed rkang bar blta bas rdzu 'phrul sbyin pa mo //
translated: Looking at the knees, I am the one who is said to be the accomplished one, and looking at the feet, I am the one who bestows miracles.

original: rkang pa'i mthe bong nges par blta na bdag ni srid par rdo rje'i sku ste dpa' mo gcig pu dang // sor mo kun gyi rtse mor blta bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su kun tu 'gro ma sna tshogs yum //
analyzed: rkang pa'i mthe bong nges par blta na bdag ni srid par rdo rje'i sku ste dpa' mo gcig pu dang // sor mo kun gyi rtse mor blta bas srid pa gsum gyi gnas su kun tu 'gro ma sna tshogs yum //
translated: Looking at the big toe of the foot, I am the one who is the vajra body in existence, and I am the solitary heroine, and looking at the tips of all the fingers, I am the mother of the three worlds, the omnipresent one.

original: pho nya mo rnams lta stangs nyid ni sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
analyzed: pho nya mo rnams lta stangs nyid ni sa yi steng gi gnas su rnal 'byor pa yis rig par bya //
translated: The yogin should know that the glances of the messengers are the places on the earth.

original: drug cha lus kyi nang nas lag pa rkang pa lus dag gi ni yan lag mchog kyang spyin pa ste //
analyzed: drug cha lus kyi nang nas lag pa rkang pa lus dag gi ni yan lag mchog kyang spyin pa ste //
translated: The hands and feet are the best limbs of the body, and they are given.

original: las kyi dbang po rnams kyi ngag dang dbang po rnams kyi nang na yon tan dang bcas yid dag kyang //
analyzed: las kyi dbang po rnams kyi ngag dang dbang po rnams kyi nang na yon tan dang bcas yid dag kyang //
translated: Of the organs of action, speech is the best, and of the organs of sense, the mind is the best.

original: khams kyi cha shas khams kyi nang na rkang gnyis pa dang phyugs kyi tshogs kyi de nyid cha yis gzhan //
analyzed: khams kyi cha shas khams kyi nang na rkang gnyis pa dang phyugs kyi tshogs kyi de nyid cha yis gzhan //
translated: Of the elements, the two feet are the best, and of the herd of cattle, the bull is the best.

original: mchog gi phyag rgya rjes su rig pa slob dpon la ni rab tu phul na bde ba'i gnas su z'gro //
analyzed: mchog gi phyag rgya rjes su rig pa slob dpon la ni rab tu phul na bde ba'i gnas su z'gro //
translated: When the supreme seal is offered to the master, one goes to the abode of bliss.

original: sems can gang dag rnam gsum srid par gnas @111a *//
analyzed: sems can gang dag rnam gsum srid par gnas @111a *//
translated: Those sentient beings who dwell in the three existences

original: rnams 'jig rten khams las ye shes rdo rje lcags kyu yis //
analyzed: rnams 'jig rten khams las ye shes rdo rje lcags kyu yis //
translated: are summoned from the world systems by the wisdom-vajra hook.

original: bkug ste de dag mtha' dag mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni sangs rgyas rnams dang rdo rje yi; ;bdud rtsi mngon par dbang bskur nas ni dri med ri bong can lus rdo rje can gyi lam thob pa //
analyzed: bkug ste de dag mtha' dag mchog gi snying rjes dkyil 'khor du ni sangs rgyas rnams dang rdo rje yi; ;bdud rtsi mngon par dbang bskur nas ni dri med ri bong can lus rdo rje can gyi lam thob pa //
translated: Having brought them all into the mandala, the buddhas and vajra-holders confer the supreme compassion and the consecration of vajra nectar, and they attain the path of the body of the stainless moon.

original: dri ma rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas rnams rang gi gnas su gtang bar bya; ;rdzas rnams med pa'i mngon par dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis kun spangs la ni sbyin par bya //
analyzed: dri ma rnam par bral zhing byang chub spyod la rjes su gnas rnams rang gi gnas su gtang bar bya; ;rdzas rnams med pa'i mngon par dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bka' yis kun spangs la ni sbyin par bya //
translated: The consecration of the absence of substances should be given by the command of the Victorious One to those who have abandoned everything.

original: de bzhin du ba la sogs lam dang mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rtsa yi rnal 'byor ldan pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba la sogs lam dang mtha' dag yon tan gter ni rtsa yi rnal 'byor ldan pa ste //
translated: In the same way, the path and all the ends are the treasure of qualities, endowed with the yoga of the nƒÅ·∏çƒ´s.

original: bsten pa'i don du lag pa'i phyag rgya rang gi snying gi dbang son skyon rnams kun las rnam par grol //
analyzed: bsten pa'i don du lag pa'i phyag rgya rang gi snying gi dbang son skyon rnams kun las rnam par grol //
translated: For the sake of practice, the hand gesture is attained in one's heart center, and one is liberated from all faults.

original: gzhan rnams la ni rgyal ba mchog gi snying po yum gyi mchod pa rnams dman sbyin pa nyid mi bya //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni rgyal ba mchog gi snying po yum gyi mchod pa rnams dman sbyin pa nyid mi bya //
translated: To others, the supreme Victorious One's essence, the offerings to the mother, should not be given in a lesser way.

original: dbang gi mthar ni dpal ldan bum pa rnams kyi 'jam zhing lus la bde stor stod mi dgos zung dag /
analyzed: dbang gi mthar ni dpal ldan bum pa rnams kyi 'jam zhing lus la bde stor stod mi dgos zung dag /
translated: At the end of the empowerment, the glorious vases should be held gently, bringing bliss to the body without needing to be lifted.

original: dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la sbyin bya gzhan yang de bzhin stod kor dang ni gos zung dag /
analyzed: dpal ldan rnal 'byor ma rnams dag la sbyin bya gzhan yang de bzhin stod kor dang ni gos zung dag /
translated: To the glorious yoginƒ´s, the offerings should be given, and likewise, the upper garment and the lower garment.

original: sgo na gnas pa rnams la rab sbyin mtha' dag yon tan rigs la bdag nyid nus pas de bzhin gzhan //
analyzed: sgo na gnas pa rnams la rab sbyin mtha' dag yon tan rigs la bdag nyid nus pas de bzhin gzhan //
translated: To those who dwell at the door, he should give everything, according to his ability, to those of good qualities and family.

original: mthar ni sbyin sreg byas nas rang gi snying ga'i padmar ye shes sems dpa' rab tu gzhug bya ste //
analyzed: mthar ni sbyin sreg byas nas rang gi snying ga'i padmar ye shes sems dpa' rab tu gzhug bya ste //
translated: In the end, having performed the fire sacrifice, he should introduce the gnosis being into his own heart lotus.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams rang gi gnas su mtha' dag rdul tshon dag kyang dag pa'i klung la spyan drang bya //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams rang gi gnas su mtha' dag rdul tshon dag kyang dag pa'i klung la spyan drang bya //
translated: The worldly ones, in their own places, and all the colored powders, he should invite into the pure river.

original: t'am bu @111b la dang dri sbos me tog 'bras bur bcas dang ras yug dag ni gzhon nu ma rnams la //
analyzed: t'am bu @111b la dang dri sbos me tog 'bras bur bcas dang ras yug dag ni gzhon nu ma rnams la //
translated: Having given cotton, scents, flowers, fruits, and cloth to the young women,

original: byin nas slob dpon slob mar bcas pas mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni ji ltar 'dod par mchod byas te; ;slob ma la ni gnang ba rab byin rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol //
analyzed: byin nas slob dpon slob mar bcas pas mtha' dag tshogs kyi rigs ni ji ltar 'dod par mchod byas te; ;slob ma la ni gnang ba rab byin rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni rang rang gnas su gshegs su gsol //
translated: the master, together with the disciples, should make offerings to the entire family of the ga·πáas as they desire. Having given permission to the disciples, he should send the supreme family of the ga·πáas to their own places.

original: dgra dang seng+ge glang chen dbang po me dang lto 'phye'i bdag po chom rkun zhags pas 'ching ba dang // chu gter 'khrugs pa dang ni sha za 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed nad dang dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe pa dang // dbul dang bud med bral dang mi bdag 'khrugs pa'i 'jigs pa dang ni rdo rje ltung dang don nyams pa //
analyzed: dgra dang seng+ge glang chen dbang po me dang lto 'phye'i bdag po chom rkun zhags pas 'ching ba dang // chu gter 'khrugs pa dang ni sha za 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed nad dang dbang po'i nye bar 'tshe pa dang // dbul dang bud med bral dang mi bdag 'khrugs pa'i 'jigs pa dang ni rdo rje ltung dang don nyams pa //
translated: poverty, separation from women, the fear of agitation from rulers, falling like a vajra, and loss of meaning,

original: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni nyin zhag so sor dran byed de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang zhig rnal 'byor ma rnams zhabs ni nyin zhag so sor dran byed de la rab tu nyams par 'gyur //
translated: for one who remembers the feet of the yoginƒ´s every day, there is no decline.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las /
translated: From the glorious Great Original Buddha, the glorious KƒÅlacakra,

original: mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: mngon par dbang bskur ba'i le'u ste gsum pa'o ////
translated: the chapter on consecration, the third, is completed.

original: rgyal ba skyed mdzad bdag gis dbang bskur bdun po rnams dang bum pa dang ni gsang ba'i dbang dag dang // shes rab ye shes dbang bskur srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya bzhi ba thob //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyed mdzad bdag gis dbang bskur bdun po rnams dang bum pa dang ni gsang ba'i dbang dag dang // shes rab ye shes dbang bskur srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa rnal 'byor dag gis bgrod bya bzhi ba thob //
translated: and the wisdom-knowledge empowerment, which conquers the fears of existence, and the fourth, which is to be attained by the yogis.

original: slar yang rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sna tshogs gtso bo'i skab thabs yang dag par ni bdag zhu'o //
analyzed: slar yang rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa sna tshogs gtso bo'i skab thabs yang dag par ni bdag zhu'o //
translated: Again, I request the method of the supreme Victorious Ones, the chief of the various ones.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos rdo rje can dag gi yang sgrub thabs gsungs //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig gsan nas ni rgyal ba'i bdag pos rdo rje can dag gi yang sgrub thabs gsungs //
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the Lord of the Victorious Ones spoke of the method of accomplishment of the Vajra Holders.

original: zla ba'i sku dang zung gi zhabs te me yi mgrin pa chu gter @112a *//
analyzed: zla ba'i sku dang zung gi zhabs te me yi mgrin pa chu gter @112a *//
translated: The body of the moon, the feet of the pair, the throat of fire, the ocean,

original: dpal ldan zhal ni sna tshogs mdog /
analyzed: dpal ldan zhal ni sna tshogs mdog /
translated: the glorious face of various colors,

original: phra ga pa drug dang nyi ma'i dpung ba rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma stong pa drug dang me yi tshigs //
analyzed: phra ga pa drug dang nyi ma'i dpung ba rgyal ba'i phyag gi padma stong pa drug dang me yi tshigs //
translated: the six subtle particles, the arm of the sun, the lotus of the Victorious One's hand, the six emptinesses, the joint of fire,

original: zhabs dag gis ni zla ba nyi ma bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor dag la bdud dang drag po skrag bzhin pa //
analyzed: zhabs dag gis ni zla ba nyi ma bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor dag la bdud dang drag po skrag bzhin pa //
translated: His feet are on the circles of the moon, sun, and RƒÅhu, terrifying MƒÅra and Rudra.

original: rol pas mnan pa'i srid med srid pa mnyam pa dus kyi 'khor lo gcig pu de ni bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: rol pas mnan pa'i srid med srid pa mnyam pa dus kyi 'khor lo gcig pu de ni bsgrub par bya //
translated: The one and only KƒÅlacakra, who is not in existence, who is the same as existence, who is trampled by the dance, should be accomplished.

original: skyed mos tshal lam ri bo dang ni rgyal ba mchog gi gnas dang lha yi gnas ni stong pa dang // grub pa'i gnas dang dur khrod dang ni mtsho dang bzang po'i gnas dang de bzhin nyid du sbas pa'i sa //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal lam ri bo dang ni rgyal ba mchog gi gnas dang lha yi gnas ni stong pa dang // grub pa'i gnas dang dur khrod dang ni mtsho dang bzang po'i gnas dang de bzhin nyid du sbas pa'i sa //
translated: In a garden, on a mountain, in the abode of the supreme Victor, in an empty abode of the gods, in a place of accomplishment, in a charnel ground, in a lake, in a good abode, and likewise in a hidden place,

original: gang du sems ni rab tu tshim par 'gyur ba der ni bsgrub par bya 'o mi yi bdag po ste //
analyzed: gang du sems ni rab tu tshim par 'gyur ba der ni bsgrub par bya 'o mi yi bdag po ste //
translated: where the mind is satisfied, there one should accomplish, O lord of men.

original: nges par 'jam pa'i mal stan dag dang gdan la nye bar 'dug nas sngar brjod srung ba byas nas ni //
analyzed: nges par 'jam pa'i mal stan dag dang gdan la nye bar 'dug nas sngar brjod srung ba byas nas ni //
translated: Having sat down on a soft bed or seat, having first performed the protection as described,

original: dang por snying gar zla ba'i dbus su de nyid 'od zer sna tshogs rnams ni phyogs bcur bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dang por snying gar zla ba'i dbus su de nyid 'od zer sna tshogs rnams ni phyogs bcur bsgom par bya //
translated: first in the heart, in the middle of the moon, one should meditate on the light rays in the ten directions.

original: kha la sogs pa dag pa byas nas slar yang nam mkha' dag la spros pa'i rgyal ba rnams la ni //
analyzed: kha la sogs pa dag pa byas nas slar yang nam mkha' dag la spros pa'i rgyal ba rnams la ni //
translated: Having purified the mouth and so forth, again in the sky the victor emanations are to be worshipped.

original: mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas sdig pa rnam pa mang po bsags pa dag ni bshags byas te //
analyzed: mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas nas sdig pa rnam pa mang po bsags pa dag ni bshags byas te //
translated: Having made various offerings, the many kinds of sins accumulated are to be confessed.

original: sgrub pa po yis lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dag pa yis ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya //
analyzed: sgrub pa po yis lus dang ngag dang sems rnams dag pa yis ni gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya //
translated: The practitioner, with pure body, speech, and mind, should go for refuge to the three.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rnam mang dge ba gang byas pa //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'phags pa'i tshogs kyis rnam mang dge ba gang byas pa //
translated: Whatever virtues are made by the perfect buddhas, the bodhisattvas, and the noble assemblies,

original: de dag mtha' dag la ni sdig pa rnam bral byang chub spyod la rjes su @112b gnas pa rjes yi rang //
analyzed: de dag mtha' dag la ni sdig pa rnam bral byang chub spyod la rjes su @112b gnas pa rjes yi rang //
translated: all of those, free from sin, I rejoice in, abiding in the practice of enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog la yang byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun srid pa'i 'jigs 'phrog la yang byang chub bar du bdag ni skyabs su mchi //
translated: I go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, the snatchers of the terrors of existence, until enlightenment.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas su bdag gyur cig ces 'dir ni smon lam sems can don gyi slad du bdag bgyid do //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas su bdag gyur cig ces 'dir ni smon lam sems can don gyi slad du bdag bgyid do //
translated: I make this aspiration prayer here, ‚ÄúMay I become a perfect buddha,‚Äù for the sake of sentient beings.

original: stong pa dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin 'gro ba mtha' dag 'di ni dngos po dag gis rnam par dman //
analyzed: stong pa dngos po'i ngo bo'i rang bzhin 'gro ba mtha' dag 'di ni dngos po dag gis rnam par dman //
translated: Emptiness is the nature of the essence of entities, and all migrating beings are inferior to entities.

original: de bas sangs rgyas byang chub med cing gzhan phan snying rje dag dang mtshan ma'i dam bca' med pa ste //
analyzed: de bas sangs rgyas byang chub med cing gzhan phan snying rje dag dang mtshan ma'i dam bca' med pa ste //
translated: Therefore, there is no buddhahood, no compassion for the benefit of others, and no proposition of signs.

original: mtha' dag de ltar shes nas de lta na yang mi yi bdag po sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
analyzed: mtha' dag de ltar shes nas de lta na yang mi yi bdag po sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ni //
translated: Having understood all things in this way, the lord of humans should meditate on the vajra of body, speech, and mind

original: dpag med yon tan dkyil 'khor dbang po dkyil 'khor la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dpag med yon tan dkyil 'khor dbang po dkyil 'khor la ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsgom par bya //
translated: in the mandala of the lord of the mandala of the immeasurable qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: chu yis me ni rnam par nyams pa dang por 'dir ni lus kyi dbus su sdom brtson dag gis bya //
analyzed: chu yis me ni rnam par nyams pa dang por 'dir ni lus kyi dbus su sdom brtson dag gis bya //
translated: The diligent should first dry up the fire with water in the middle of the body here.

original: phyi nas 'dzin ma dag ni chu ru 'gyur te lan tshva bzhin du chu yi dbus su rab tu zhugs //
analyzed: phyi nas 'dzin ma dag ni chu ru 'gyur te lan tshva bzhin du chu yi dbus su rab tu zhugs //
translated: Then, the bile becomes water and dissolves into the water in the middle, like salt.

original: rlung ni chu bo de dag bskams nas nam mkha' la ni snang ba min par myur du 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rlung ni chu bo de dag bskams nas nam mkha' la ni snang ba min par myur du 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: The wind dries up those rivers of water and quickly goes into space, becoming invisible.

original: sems ni me dang mun pa'i mtha' ma yul dang rnam par bral ba dbus kyis la gzhag par bya //
analyzed: sems ni me dang mun pa'i mtha' ma yul dang rnam par bral ba dbus kyis la gzhag par bya //
translated: The mind is to be placed in the center, free from objects, like the end of fire and darkness.

original: stong pa rlung me chu dang sa dang lha yi ri bo chu skyes zla ba nyi ma me rnams ni //
analyzed: stong pa rlung me chu dang sa dang lha yi ri bo chu skyes zla ba nyi ma me rnams ni //

analyzed: phyi rol tu ni gsung gi dkyil 'khor nor gyi padma 'di ni zla ba nyi mas rnam par dman //

analyzed: mgrin pa gsum dang nyi ma'i spyan te rnam par rgyas pa'i zhal yang mche ba phyed ni gtsigs pa'o //

analyzed: mdung dang dbyug pa dgra sta rnams ni rdo rje can gyi nyi ma'i phyag gi padma g-yas la'o //
translated: The spear, club, and battle-ax‚Äîthese are in the right lotus hands of the sun-like Vajra Holder.üîΩThe bell, the flag, the kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖga, the skull filled with blood and flesh, the bow, the noose, the jewel lotus, the water-born [lotus], the mirror, the chain,

analyzed: nag mo yi ni dang po'i phyag gi mthil na spos kyi snod dang gnyis pa dag na bsil ba'i snod //

analyzed: phyogs kyi padma ra chu gter sangs rgyas rnams ni nges par spyan dgu ma yi zhal dang dus kyi phyag /

analyzed: zur du @114b sgrol ma la sogs lha mo rnams dang slar yang de dag mtshams brgyad du ni bum pa brgyad //

analyzed: shar dang phyogs gzhan gyi na g-yas dang g-yas min padma dag la kun tu bzang po de bzhin nyid //

analyzed: dpal ldan phyag na rdo rje ma dang chos kyi dbyings ni rim pas so //
translated: ≈örƒ´ VajrapƒÅ·πái and DharmadhƒÅtu are in the east and other directions, respectively.

original: rmugs byed rengs byed khengs byed dag ste shin tu stobs shes gang yin sgo skyong de ni shar du'o //
analyzed: rmugs byed rengs byed khengs byed dag ste shin tu stobs shes gang yin sgo skyong de ni shar du'o //

analyzed: nag po rnams kyi g-yas kyi phyag na ral gri gri gug dag dang srid pa 'jigs byed rtse gsum ste //
translated: In the right hands of the black ones are a sword, a flaying knife, and a trident of Bhairava.

analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag gi mthil du phub dang thod pa dag dang kha tv'am ga ni dkar po nyid du 'gyur //

translated: The goddesses of the east and so forth are black, red, white, and like the finest gold.

translated: They are the lords of the elephants, the sheep, the crocodile, the deer, and the mouse, respectively.

original: bhe runda dang khrung khrung mig sngon bshang lam gdong ni bya rog gdong la sogs pa'i zung du ste //
analyzed: bhe runda dang khrung khrung mig sngon bshang lam gdong ni bya rog gdong la sogs pa'i zung du ste //
translated: The pairs are the Bheru·πá·∏ça, the crane, the blue-eyed one, the anus, the face, the crow-faced one, and so forth.

original: bse dang dom dang seng+ge g-yag ni khyi gdong ma la sogs pa yi ste phyogs su rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: bse dang dom dang seng+ge g-yag ni khyi gdong ma la sogs pa yi ste phyogs su rab tu 'gyur //
translated: The directions are the wild boar, the bear, the lion, the yak, the dog-faced one, and so forth.

original: rdo rje mig gi rkang pa brgyad pa sa yi shing rta la gnas mkha' la sngon mo'i shing rta yi; ;mkha' ba grong khro ba dang bcas kha dog lnga pa lus rgyas mig gsum ldan pa aa ni la zhes pa //
analyzed: rdo rje mig gi rkang pa brgyad pa sa yi shing rta la gnas mkha' la sngon mo'i shing rta yi; ;mkha' ba grong khro ba dang bcas kha dog lnga pa lus rgyas mig gsum ldan pa aa ni la zhes pa //
translated: The eight verses of Vajranetra are on the chariot of the earth, the blue chariot of the sky, the sky, the city, and the town, with five colors, a swollen body, and three eyes, the syllable A, and so forth.

original: 'od zer can dang tsund'a lcags sgrog ma dang khro gnyer can gyi shing rta rnams la phag dang ni /üîΩrta dang glang po seng+ge bdun gyi grangs su 'gyur te lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang du'o //
analyzed: 'od zer can dang tsund'a lcags sgrog ma dang khro gnyer can gyi shing rta rnams la phag dang ni / rta dang glang po seng+ge bdun gyi grangs su 'gyur te lha dang gshin rje chu dang byang du'o //
translated: The chariots of Marici, CundƒÅ, PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, and Bh·πõku·π≠ƒ´ are the number seven of pigs, horses, elephants, and lions, respectively, in the directions of the gods, Yama, water, and the north.üîΩIn the east are GandhƒÅ and MƒÅlya, and in the directions of Yama and water are Dh≈´pƒÅ, Dƒ´pƒÅ, and Pu·π£pƒÅ, respectively.

original: shar du dri dang phreng ba ma ste gshin rje chu la gnas pa spos ma mar me sgeg mo dang // bzhad ma'o gar ma rol mo ma ni nor spyi nas gzhi la ste mkha' la glu ma 'dod ma'o //
analyzed: shar du dri dang phreng ba ma ste gshin rje chu la gnas pa spos ma mar me sgeg mo dang // bzhad ma'o gar ma rol mo ma ni nor spyi nas gzhi la ste mkha' la glu ma 'dod ma'o //
translated: In the directions of the gods, Agni, and Varu·πáa are LƒÅsya, Gƒ´tƒÅ, and N·πõtya, respectively. In the direction of Indra is VƒÅdya, and in the direction of ƒ™≈õƒÅna is Dh≈´pƒÅ.

original: snying por brgyad ni kha khyer la ste mkha' dang 'og na gnas pa rta babs 'og tu nges par sbyar //
analyzed: snying por brgyad ni kha khyer la ste mkha' dang 'og na gnas pa rta babs 'og tu nges par sbyar //
translated: The eight in the center are on the ledges, and those in the sky and below are definitely to be applied below the archways.

original: gzungs ma rnams ni snam bu la ste gdengs can rigs dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod ma rnams ba khyer la //
analyzed: gzungs ma rnams ni snam bu la ste gdengs can rigs dang bcas pa'i phyir 'dod ma rnams ba khyer la //
translated: The dhƒÅra·πáƒ´ goddesses are on the ledges, and the kƒÅmƒÅ goddesses are on the parapets, because they are of the class of NƒÅgƒÅ.

original: dbye ba dang ni bskyod pa 'dod mar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po de bzhin rgyas par rengs 'dod ma //
analyzed: dbye ba dang ni bskyod pa 'dod mar 'gyur te mi yi bdag po de bzhin rgyas par rengs 'dod ma //
translated: The kƒÅmƒÅ goddesses are divided into the classes of shaking and expanding, O lord of men.

original: lha mo sgrol ma la sogs @118a *//
analyzed: lha mo sgrol ma la sogs @118a *//
translated: The goddesses TƒÅrƒÅ and so forthüîΩare in the directions of the gods, Yama, water, and the north.

original: dag pa yis te srid gsum skyed ma gsod pa dang ni skyed 'dod ma //üîΩrol mo 'dod ma dang ni rgyan 'dod mar 'gyur mi yi bdag po zas 'dod ma dang de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: dag pa yis te srid gsum skyed ma gsod pa dang ni skyed 'dod ma // rol mo 'dod ma dang ni rgyan 'dod mar 'gyur mi yi bdag po zas 'dod ma dang de bzhin nyid /
translated: The pure ones are the mother of the three worlds, the one who desires to kill, and the one who desires to give birth.

original: dri 'dod ma dang gos ni 'dod mar 'gyur te nges par 'khrig pa 'dod ma dag gi drug pa'o //
analyzed: dri 'dod ma dang gos ni 'dod mar 'gyur te nges par 'khrig pa 'dod ma dag gi drug pa'o //
translated: The one who desires music, the one who desires ornaments, the one who desires food, the one who desires smell, and the one who desires clothing‚Äîthese are the six who definitely desire sex.

original: lus la 'phrug 'dod ma dang kha na gnas pa'i mchil ma 'dor dang lus kyi dri ma 'dod ma dang // gar 'dod ma dang stan 'dod ma dang chu dang mal stan dag la rkyal dang bsnyes par 'dod ma dang // tsa mund'i sogs brgyad kyi bya ba rnams te de bzhin sa la khro skyes rnams kyi 'dod ma yang //
analyzed: lus la 'phrug 'dod ma dang kha na gnas pa'i mchil ma 'dor dang lus kyi dri ma 'dod ma dang // gar 'dod ma dang stan 'dod ma dang chu dang mal stan dag la rkyal dang bsnyes par 'dod ma dang // tsa mund'i sogs brgyad kyi bya ba rnams te de bzhin sa la khro skyes rnams kyi 'dod ma yang //
translated: The one who desires to scratch the body, the one who desires to spit on the face, the one who desires the body‚Äôs impurities, the one who desires to dance, the one who desires a seat, the one who desires to float and lean on water and bedding, and the one who desires to embrace‚Äîthese are the eight actions of CƒÅmu·πá·∏çƒÅ and so forth.

original: kun gdung dang 'ching 'dod ma dang nges par 'jam por smra ba dang ni skems dang skrod 'dod ma //
analyzed: kun gdung dang 'ching 'dod ma dang nges par 'jam por smra ba dang ni skems dang skrod 'dod ma //
translated: The one who desires to burn and bind, the one who desires to speak softly, the one who desires to dry up, and the one who desires to drive away‚ÄîüîΩthese are the eight who desire the earth.

original: reg dang dgug pa dag dang 'ching dang mi yi bdag po phur bu 'debs dang rgyug pa 'dod mar 'gyur; ;yan lag thams cad bskyod par 'dod ma rab tu gsal zhing nges par bshang gci zag par 'dod ma dang // sems can rnams la slu 'dod ma dang nges par rtsod pa mang po lnga pa lhag ma za ba dang //
analyzed: reg dang dgug pa dag dang 'ching dang mi yi bdag po phur bu 'debs dang rgyug pa 'dod mar 'gyur; ;yan lag thams cad bskyod par 'dod ma rab tu gsal zhing nges par bshang gci zag par 'dod ma dang // sems can rnams la slu 'dod ma dang nges par rtsod pa mang po lnga pa lhag ma za ba dang //
translated: desiring to deceive sentient beings, and being certain about many disputes, the fifth, eating the remainder,

original: g-yul 'dod ma dang sbrul 'ching ma dang byis pa khro bar 'dod ma rnams ni lha min rigs la 'gyur //
analyzed: g-yul 'dod ma dang sbrul 'ching ma dang byis pa khro bar 'dod ma rnams ni lha min rigs la 'gyur //
translated: desiring battle, binding a snake, and desiring a child to be angry‚Äîthese are the classes of demigods.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun phyir 'dod ma rnams slar yang de nas phyi rol dkyil 'khor dag gi kha khyer la //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun phyir 'dod ma rnams slar yang de nas phyi rol dkyil 'khor dag gi kha khyer la //
translated: The thirty-seven, desiring the outside, are again on the periphery of the outer ma·πá·∏çala.

original: nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig cung zad sems can bya ba rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba 'dir //
analyzed: nyin zhag so so'i dus su gang zhig cung zad sems can bya ba rnal 'byor ma yi bya ba 'dir //
translated: At the time of each day, whatever is the activity of sentient beings is the activity of the yoginƒ´s here.

original: zhes pa de ltar rdor je can gyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang @118b dkyil 'khor rnam bar gsungs //
analyzed: zhes pa de ltar rdor je can gyis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang @118b dkyil 'khor rnam bar gsungs //
translated: Thus, Vajradhara has explained the entire triple world as a ma·πá·∏çala.

original: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang ni spro dang sdud pa dag la dngos po'i skye ba yang dag gnas //
analyzed: phyi dang lus dang gzhan la yang ni spro dang sdud pa dag la dngos po'i skye ba yang dag gnas //
translated: In the external, in the body, and in others, there is expansion and contraction, and the arising of things is well established.

original: de la rtag pa mkha' yi rdo rje rnam gsum srid pa la gnas mi rtag nyid du 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: de la rtag pa mkha' yi rdo rje rnam gsum srid pa la gnas mi rtag nyid du 'gyur ma yin //
translated: There, the permanent, the sky-vajra, is of three kinds, and does not become impermanent in existence.

original: 'byung po'i tshogs ni rtag pa min par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mig 'khrul ji bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i tshogs ni rtag pa min par 'gyur te mi yi bdag po mig 'khrul ji bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: The host of beings becomes impermanent, just like an illusion, O lord of men.

original: rtag dang mi rtag mthong ste de lta na yang blun po'i blo can sems ni dag pa'i don slad du //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag mthong ste de lta na yang blun po'i blo can sems ni dag pa'i don slad du //
translated: Seeing the permanent and the impermanent, even so, for the sake of the mind of the pure meaning,

original: sgrub thabs dag ni brjod bar bya ste snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub bar bya ba med //
analyzed: sgrub thabs dag ni brjod bar bya ste snying por gyur pa 'ga' yang 'dir ni bsgrub bar bya ba med //
translated: The means of accomplishment should be expressed. Here, there is nothing at all to be accomplished in the essence.

original: gang zhig bsgrub bya sgrub pa bo de 'khrul ba zhes pa rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang //
analyzed: gang zhig bsgrub bya sgrub pa bo de 'khrul ba zhes pa rdo rje can gyi sgrub thabs mtha' dag gang //
translated: Whatever is to be accomplished, that is the delusion of the agent of accomplishment, O Vajra Holder, in all the means of accomplishment.

original: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag ni dkyil 'khor dbang po rab tu bya //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal po rang sems dri ma rnam par bral ba dag ni dkyil 'khor dbang po rab tu bya //
translated: Therefore, O King, the pure mind free from stains, is the lord of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: dpal ldan rdo rje can ni thugs kyi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi bdag dkyil 'khor sku yi rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan rdo rje can ni thugs kyi rdo rjer 'gyur te mi bdag dkyil 'khor sku yi rdo rje'o //
translated: The glorious Vajra is the mind-vajra, and the lord of men is the body-vajra of the mandala.

original: lha rnams 'khor lo a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes gsung gi rdo rje zla ba nyi ma'i steng du'o //
analyzed: lha rnams 'khor lo a'a li k'a li'i rigs skyes gsung gi rdo rje zla ba nyi ma'i steng du'o //
translated: The gods born of the family of Alikali are the speech-vajras, on the moon and sun.

original: rtsa ba sdong bu dag ni aa yig 'dab ma dag ni de bzhin ge sar rnams kyang au yig go; ;dbus su dpal ldan lte ba dang ni zla ba nyi ma rnam gnyis rkang pa'i gnas dag ma yig go //
analyzed: rtsa ba sdong bu dag ni aa yig 'dab ma dag ni de bzhin ge sar rnams kyang au yig go; ;dbus su dpal ldan lte ba dang ni zla ba nyi ma rnam gnyis rkang pa'i gnas dag ma yig go //
translated: The root and the stem are the letter A, the petals are the letter E, and the filaments are the letter O. The glorious navel is in the center, and the two moons and suns are the abode of the feet, the letter M.

original: ho yig thog ma tha ma'i snying po bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ste //
analyzed: ho yig thog ma tha ma'i snying po bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje ste //
translated: The essence of the beginning and end, the letter Ho, bestows the fruit of the bliss of equality, the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: de ni shes rab chags pas zhu ba khyab bdag rdo rje can yang ri bong 'dzin pa bzhin bltas na //
analyzed: de ni shes rab chags pas zhu ba khyab bdag rdo rje can yang ri bong 'dzin pa bzhin bltas na //
translated: That is seen by the lord of the vajra, who is pervaded by the melting due to the passion of wisdom, like the moon.üîΩThe goddesses sing:

original: lha mo rnams kyis glu dag mdzad de bcom ldan khyod ni sems can kun la phan par mdzad pa po //
analyzed: lha mo rnams kyis glu dag mdzad de bcom ldan khyod ni sems can kun la phan par mdzad pa po //
translated: Bhagavat, you are the one who acts for the benefit of all beings.

original: bdag @119a *// cag srungs shig lha mi'i bla ma rdo rje ldan pa 'dod pa don gnyer rnams la 'dod pa mdzod //
analyzed: bdag @119a *// cag srungs shig lha mi'i bla ma rdo rje ldan pa 'dod pa don gnyer rnams la 'dod pa mdzod //
translated: Protect us, O you who are endowed with the vajra, O you who are the guru of gods and men, O you who are the treasure of desires for those who strive for the goal of desire!

original: rdo rje can des glu dag gsan nas srid ba gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang mig 'phrul lta bur ni //
analyzed: rdo rje can des glu dag gsan nas srid ba gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang mig 'phrul lta bur ni //
translated: Having heard the song, the vajra-holder sees the entire triple world as a magical illusion,

original: gzigs nas skyed pa mdzad de dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba rang gi mtshan ma spros byas nas //üîΩrdo rje'i rgyan dang ldan zhing rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan shes rab kyis ni 'khyud par gyur pa yang;/
analyzed: gzigs nas skyed pa mdzad de dri ma med pa'i 'od zer 'phro ba rang gi mtshan ma spros byas nas // rdo rje'i rgyan dang ldan zhing rgyal ba'i bdag po'i cod pan shes rab kyis ni 'khyud par gyur pa yang;/
translated: and having seen it, he emits the pure light-rays, having emanated his own sign,üîΩendowed with the vajra ornaments, embraced by the wisdom of the crown of the lord of victors,

original: shes rab thabs kyis rgyal po slar yang dkyil 'khor ma lus pa ni rab tu spro ba dag kyang ngo //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyis rgyal po slar yang dkyil 'khor ma lus pa ni rab tu spro ba dag kyang ngo //
translated: and again, the king of wisdom and means, he radiates all the ma·πá·∏çalas.

original: 'od zer sngon po 'jigs pa'i sku ste rab tu bzhad pa'i zhal dang mche ba phyed ni gtsigs pa dang // sgra drag sgrog byed nyi ma'i spyan dang gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ste rig byed zhal dang zhabs gnyis pa //
analyzed: 'od zer sngon po 'jigs pa'i sku ste rab tu bzhad pa'i zhal dang mche ba phyed ni gtsigs pa dang // sgra drag sgrog byed nyi ma'i spyan dang gnyis lhag rgyal ba'i phyag ste rig byed zhal dang zhabs gnyis pa //
translated: making a loud sound, with sun-like eyes, two extra arms of the Victorious One, and a face and two feet of the Veda.

original: shes rab thabs la rab byung mtshon cha rnams dang bcas pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta dag la gnas //
analyzed: shes rab thabs la rab byung mtshon cha rnams dang bcas pa rkang pa brgyad pa'i shing rta dag la gnas //
translated: Wisdom and method, with the weapons, are on the chariot of the eight limbs.

original: rgyal ba'i dgra ni 'joms par byed pa rdo rje shugs te ye shes 'khor lo'i slad du bskul bar bya //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dgra ni 'joms par byed pa rdo rje shugs te ye shes 'khor lo'i slad du bskul bar bya //
translated: The vajra speed that conquers the enemies of the Victorious One, for the sake of the wheel of wisdom, should be urged.

original: dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes 'khor lo'i dbang phyug dag ni lte bar lcags kyus bsnun byas shing //
analyzed: dri med 'od zer 'phro ba ye shes 'khor lo'i dbang phyug dag ni lte bar lcags kyus bsnun byas shing //
translated: The lords of the wheel of wisdom, radiating stainless light rays, are pierced with hooks at the navel.

original: phyag rnams rang gi rdo rje gdengs can dag gi de bzhin rab bcings mtshon cha rnams kyis 'jigs byas te //
analyzed: phyag rnams rang gi rdo rje gdengs can dag gi de bzhin rab bcings mtshon cha rnams kyis 'jigs byas te //
translated: The hands, with their own vajras and hoods, are bound in the same way, terrified by the weapons.

original: mtha' dag bsgrub byar byas shing 'khor lo bzang po bskyod par byas nas 'di ni slar yang 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: mtha' dag bsgrub byar byas shing 'khor lo bzang po bskyod par byas nas 'di ni slar yang 'gro ba ste //
translated: Having made all of them the object of practice, and having set in motion the good wheel, he again goes.

original: gzhug dang bcing dang mnyes @119b pa dang ni ro mnyam byed sa dag ni rmugs byed la sogs rnams kyis byed //
analyzed: gzhug dang bcing dang mnyes @119b pa dang ni ro mnyam byed sa dag ni rmugs byed la sogs rnams kyis byed //
translated: The stages of entry, binding, pleasing, and equalizing the taste are performed by the mudras such as Mudgara.

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor dag la sems ni nam mkha' dang bcas snying po'i padmar me yi steng du 'gyur //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor dag la sems ni nam mkha' dang bcas snying po'i padmar me yi steng du 'gyur //
translated: In the yoga of completion, the mind is in the heart lotus above the fire, together with space.

original: shar du dpal ldan nag mo 'bar ma mchog gi padma la ni lho ru dmar mo 'bar ma ste //üîΩbyang du dpal ldan dkar mo 'bar mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis nub tu ser mo 'bar ma'o //
analyzed: shar du dpal ldan nag mo 'bar ma mchog gi padma la ni lho ru dmar mo 'bar ma ste // byang du dpal ldan dkar mo 'bar mar 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis nub tu ser mo 'bar ma'o //
translated: In the east is the glorious blazing black one, and in the lotus of the supreme one in the south is the blazing red one.üîΩIn the north is the glorious blazing white one, and in the west is the blazing yellow one by the power of the family.

original: mer ni du ba da nu'i bu yi phyogs su smig rgyu ma dang dbang ldan phyogs su mkha' snang ma //
analyzed: mer ni du ba da nu'i bu yi phyogs su smig rgyu ma dang dbang ldan phyogs su mkha' snang ma //
translated: In the southeast is the smoke one, in the southwest is the mirage one, in the northwest is the lightning one,

original: rlung du dpal ldan mar me ma ste nor bu dang ni shing dang chos kyi gandi dag dang dung //
analyzed: rlung du dpal ldan mar me ma ste nor bu dang ni shing dang chos kyi gandi dag dang dung //
translated: and in the northeast is the glorious lamp one. The jewel, tree, Dharma conch, and conch are in the directions.

original: me dang rlung dang lha min dang ni 'phrog byed phyogs su de bzhin bar gyi zur gyi cha la 'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung dang lha min dang ni 'phrog byed phyogs su de bzhin bar gyi zur gyi cha la 'o //
translated: In the southeast, in the southwest, in the northwest, and in the northeast, in the intermediate directions, in the same way.

original: shar du 'du byed dang ni sa bdag nges par padma la gnas lho ru tshor ba chu dag go //üîΩbyang du 'du shes dang ni me ru 'gyur te nub tu yang ni rlung dang bcas pa'i gzugs nyid do //
analyzed: shar du 'du byed dang ni sa bdag nges par padma la gnas lho ru tshor ba chu dag go // byang du 'du shes dang ni me ru 'gyur te nub tu yang ni rlung dang bcas pa'i gzugs nyid do //
translated: In the east, formation and the lord of the earth, certainly on a lotus; in the south, sensation and water.üîΩIn the north, perception and fire; in the west, form together with wind.

original: me yi phyogs su rlung dang gzugs su 'gyur te lha min bdag por me dang 'du shes gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: me yi phyogs su rlung dang gzugs su 'gyur te lha min bdag por me dang 'du shes gnyis pa'o //
translated: In the southeast, wind and form; in the southwest, fire and perception.

original: dbang ldan du ni chu dang tshor ba dag ste rlung du 'dzin ma 'du byed phung por ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan du ni chu dang tshor ba dag ste rlung du 'dzin ma 'du byed phung por ldan pa'o //
translated: In the northwest, water and sensation; in the northeast, formation and the aggregate of wind.

original: lha mo sangs rgyas par rnams su ni le tsha brgyad kyi gnas su bdud rtsi'i ro yi bum pa rnams //
analyzed: lha mo sangs rgyas par rnams su ni le tsha brgyad kyi gnas su bdud rtsi'i ro yi bum pa rnams //
translated: In the directions of the goddesses, in the eight chambers, the vases of the nectar of taste.

original: slar yang 'phar ma phyi ma la ni shar du sna dang dri ste lho ru mig dang gzugs dag 'gro //
analyzed: slar yang 'phar ma phyi ma la ni shar du sna dang dri ste lho ru mig dang gzugs dag 'gro //
translated: Again, in the next upper story, in the east, the nose and smell; in the south, the eye and form.

original: byang du lce dang ro ru 'gyur te chur ni de bzhin nyid du lus dang reg bya dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: byang du lce dang ro ru 'gyur te chur ni de bzhin nyid du lus dang reg bya dag tu 'gyur //
translated: In the north, tongue and taste, and in the nadir, body and touch, just as before.

original: sa 'og tu ni rna ba sgra ru 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lho yi sgo yi g-yon du 'o //
analyzed: sa 'og tu ni rna ba sgra ru 'gyur te rigs kyi dbang gis lho yi sgo yi g-yon du 'o //
translated: In the underworld, ear and sound, by the power of the family, to the left of the southern door.

original: nam @120a *// mkha' la ni nges par sems dang chos kyi dbyings su 'gyur te shar gyi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
analyzed: nam @120a *// mkha' la ni nges par sems dang chos kyi dbyings su 'gyur te shar gyi sgo yi g-yon du'o //
translated: In the sky, mind and the sphere of reality, to the left of the eastern door.

original: dang por thabs ni drug po dag kyang rgyal ba'i dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi ni lhag pa'i lha ru 'gyur //
analyzed: dang por thabs ni drug po dag kyang rgyal ba'i dbang gis dkyil 'khor gyi ni lhag pa'i lha ru 'gyur //
translated: First, the six methods are the special deities of the mandala by the power of the victors.

original: phyi nas shes rab la sogs drug ni rab tu gsal bar bdag po rang rang padma'i gdan la'o //
analyzed: phyi nas shes rab la sogs drug ni rab tu gsal bar bdag po rang rang padma'i gdan la'o //
translated: Then, the six, beginning with wisdom, are clearly the lords on their individual lotus seats.

original: shar gyi sgor ni rab gtum ral gri 'dzin pa shin tu stobs te de yi phyag rgya rengs byed ma'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor ni rab gtum ral gri 'dzin pa shin tu stobs te de yi phyag rgya rengs byed ma'o //
translated: At the eastern door is Ca·πá·∏ça, holding a sword, very powerful, and his consort, Stambhinƒ´.

original: g-yas su rmugs byed dang ni nga rgyal mar 'gyur nor sbyin du yang khengs byed dang ni rmugs byed ma //
analyzed: g-yas su rmugs byed dang ni nga rgyal mar 'gyur nor sbyin du yang khengs byed dang ni rmugs byed ma //
translated: To the right are Stambhana and MƒÅnain, and to the left are Pibana and MƒÅninƒ´.

original: chu ru rengs byed dang ni mtha' yas brtson 'grus mar 'gyur sgo yi dbus na gnas pa'i padma la'o //
analyzed: chu ru rengs byed dang ni mtha' yas brtson 'grus mar 'gyur sgo yi dbus na gnas pa'i padma la'o //

original: dbyug sngon 'od zer can dang mi g-yo zhes dang khro gnyer can ma brtson 'grus mtha' yas lcags sgrog ma //
analyzed: dbyug sngon 'od zer can dang mi g-yo zhes dang khro gnyer can ma brtson 'grus mtha' yas lcags sgrog ma //
translated: Nƒ´lƒÅmbara, MƒÅmakƒ´, AcalƒÅ, and Bh·πõku·π≠ƒ´, become Vƒ´ramatƒ´, and are in the center of the door.

original: 'dod pa tsund'a shing rta la gnas lha dang nor sbyin gzhan dang lho yi sgo yi dbus su ste //
analyzed: 'dod pa tsund'a shing rta la gnas lha dang nor sbyin gzhan dang lho yi sgo yi dbus su ste //
translated: KƒÅmadhenu, CundƒÅ, and Ratnasambhava, are in the chariot, and are in the center of the southern door.

original: gnod mdzes drag spyan ma ni 'og tu 'gyur zhing mkha' la gtsug tor dang ni shin tu sngon mo nyid //
analyzed: gnod mdzes drag spyan ma ni 'og tu 'gyur zhing mkha' la gtsug tor dang ni shin tu sngon mo nyid //
