original: de yi dbus su gzhom med gang de yul dang rnam par bral zhing yon tan med pa'i 'gyur med do //
analyzed: de yi dbus su gzhom med gang de yul dang rnam par bral zhing yon tan med pa'i 'gyur med do //
translated: In the middle of that is the imperishable, which is free from objects and is the unchanging absence of qualities.

original: rig byed mtha' las gsang ba 'di dag tshangs pa yis ni rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la sngon brjod de //
analyzed: rig byed mtha' las gsang ba 'di dag tshangs pa yis ni rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la sngon brjod de //
translated: These secrets were formerly taught by BrahmƒÅ to the yogis in the VedƒÅnta.

original: dus kyis shes pa rab nyams thub pa rnams kyis 'dir ni srog chags rnams la gsod pa dag kyang bstan //
analyzed: dus kyis shes pa rab nyams thub pa rnams kyis 'dir ni srog chags rnams la gsod pa dag kyang bstan //
translated: But in this age, when knowledge is declining, the sages have taught them to living beings for the sake of killing them.

original: mi rnams mtho ris don du de la rab tu 'jug ste dmyal ba ngan pa'i 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rnams mtho ris don du de la rab tu 'jug ste dmyal ba ngan pa'i 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur //
translated: People engage in them for the sake of heaven, but they give rise to the fruit of hell.

original: sol ba'o ma'i rgyun gyis mngon par bkrus pa 'dir ni zla ba'i mdog tu 'gar yang 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: sol ba'o ma'i rgyun gyis mngon par bkrus pa 'dir ni zla ba'i mdog tu 'gar yang 'gyur ma yin //
translated: This is never whitened by the stream of cow dung, nor does it ever become the color of the moon.

original: sbyor ba med pa'i rig byed tshig ni dam tshig rnam par bral ba dag gis bslus pa'i mi rnams gang //
analyzed: sbyor ba med pa'i rig byed tshig ni dam tshig rnam par bral ba dag gis bslus pa'i mi rnams gang //
translated: Those people who are deceived by the words of the Vedas, which are devoid of application and devoid of truth,

original: de rnams gzhan gyi bu ni mi bskyed don du nyin mtshan dus su rang gi bud med bsrungs byas nas //
analyzed: de rnams gzhan gyi bu ni mi bskyed don du nyin mtshan dus su rang gi bud med bsrungs byas nas //
translated: guard their own wives day and night for the sake of not producing another's son.

original: bu yis byin pa dag kyang yi dvags kyi ni 'jig rten du song ba yi sbyin par 'gyur ro la //
analyzed: bu yis byin pa dag kyang yi dvags kyi ni 'jig rten du song ba yi sbyin par 'gyur ro la //
translated: The gifts of a son go to the world of the hungry ghosts.

original: des na bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba 'dod pa'i sbyin pa 'di ni gdug pa'i bram ze rnams kyis sbas //
analyzed: des na bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba 'dod pa'i sbyin pa 'di ni gdug pa'i bram ze rnams kyis sbas //
translated: So this gift, which bestows the fruit of the bliss of liberation, is hidden by the wicked brahmins.

original: gal te rigs kyi rta yis rgod ma bzang mo la ni rta mchog skyes bu gzhan du gyur pa na //
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi rta yis rgod ma bzang mo la ni rta mchog skyes bu gzhan du gyur pa na //
translated: If a good mare of the noble breed gives birth to a fine horse, a superior being,

original: dpal @142a *// yang 'di yi mthu las slar yang 'gyur te bdag po yi ni rnyed pa dag kyang cis ma yin //
analyzed: dpal @142a *// yang 'di yi mthu las slar yang 'gyur te bdag po yi ni rnyed pa dag kyang cis ma yin //
translated: then glory comes from his power. Why should not the owner get wealth?

original: gang gis chags pa can rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su rang rang bud med dag ni srung bar byed //
analyzed: gang gis chags pa can rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su rang rang bud med dag ni srung bar byed //
translated: The greedy guard their women day and night, each in his turn.

original: shi bar gyur na khyod su khyod kyi rang gi bud med su ste kye ma mi dge'i las kyis bcings //
analyzed: shi bar gyur na khyod su khyod kyi rang gi bud med su ste kye ma mi dge'i las kyis bcings //
translated: When they are dead, whose are they? Whose is your own wife? Alas! You are bound by the fetters of nonvirtue.

original: ba lang sbyin dang sa gzhi sbyin pa de bzhin gzhan yang mi yi 'jig rten du ni longs spyod ster //
analyzed: ba lang sbyin dang sa gzhi sbyin pa de bzhin gzhan yang mi yi 'jig rten du ni longs spyod ster //
translated: The gift of cattle, the gift of land, and likewise the gift of wealth in the human world

original: sman dang kha zas sbyin pa dag ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog bkres pa dang ni skom pa dag kyang 'phrog //
analyzed: sman dang kha zas sbyin pa dag ni mtha' dag nad 'phrog bkres pa dang ni skom pa dag kyang 'phrog //
translated: The gift of medicine and food removes all sickness and hunger and thirst.

original: 'dod pa'i sbyin pa thams cad du ni bde mnyam 'bras ster 'khor lo'i dus su smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sbyin pa thams cad du ni bde mnyam 'bras ster 'khor lo'i dus su smos kyang ci zhig dgos //
translated: The gift of sensual pleasures, which is the bestowal of every bliss, is mentioned in the Wheel of Time Tantra, but what need is there to mention it here?

original: yid 'ong chung ma sring mo skal bzang bu mo rnams kyang gsang ba sbyin pa la ni rab sbyin bya //
analyzed: yid 'ong chung ma sring mo skal bzang bu mo rnams kyang gsang ba sbyin pa la ni rab sbyin bya //
translated: Beautiful young women, sisters, and fortunate maidens are given in the secret initiation.

original: smad tshong dam pa rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur zhing gsang ba'i mi mo gzhan gyi bud med dam tshig ste //
analyzed: smad tshong dam pa rnams kyi las kyi phyag rgyar 'gyur zhing gsang ba'i mi mo gzhan gyi bud med dam tshig ste //
translated: The best courtesans become the action seal, the secret woman, or the pledge seal.

original: rang dbang chos kyi phyag rgya yul ni mang po la dga' rang gi chung ma ye shes phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: rang dbang chos kyi phyag rgya yul ni mang po la dga' rang gi chung ma ye shes phyag rgya'o //
translated: The independent woman is the doctrine seal, and the many women one enjoys are the many seals. One‚Äôs own wife is the wisdom seal.

original: smad tshong dam pa bcu gnyis lo lon mchog gi bde ba la dga' gzhan gyi bud med bcu drug lo //
analyzed: smad tshong dam pa bcu gnyis lo lon mchog gi bde ba la dga' gzhan gyi bud med bcu drug lo //
translated: The best courtesan is sixteen years old and delights in supreme bliss. The other woman is sixteen years old.

original: rang dbang lo ni nyi shu lon pa bu mo dang bcas rang gi chung ma sum cu'i lo ru 'gyur //
analyzed: rang dbang lo ni nyi shu lon pa bu mo dang bcas rang gi chung ma sum cu'i lo ru 'gyur //
translated: The independent woman is twenty years old and has a daughter. One‚Äôs own wife is thirty years old.

original: sngon che sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dzin me dang ni glang chen rta dang shing rta du ma gser gyi khur //
analyzed: sngon che sangs rgyas rnams kyis 'dzin me dang ni glang chen rta dang shing rta du ma gser gyi khur //
translated: In the past, the great beings gave away many lamps, elephants, horses, and chariots, as well as burdens of gold.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du byin zhing slar yang mgo dang khrag dang sha rnams dag kyang rab tu byin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyi slad du byin zhing slar yang mgo dang khrag dang sha rnams dag kyang rab tu byin //
translated: For the sake of Buddhahood, they gave away their heads, blood, and flesh.

original: 'di rnams @142b kyis ni bzhed pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du ma gyur de nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rab tu byin //
analyzed: 'di rnams @142b kyis ni bzhed pa'i sangs rgyas nyid du ma gyur de nas 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rab tu byin //
translated: They gave away their desired objects, but did not attain the desired Buddhahood.

original: gsang ba'i sbyin pa de yis skyes bu rnams ni rgyal ba skyes byed rigs la sangs rgyas nyid du 'khrungs //
analyzed: gsang ba'i sbyin pa de yis skyes bu rnams ni rgyal ba skyes byed rigs la sangs rgyas nyid du 'khrungs //
translated: By that secret giving, the beings born in the Buddha lineage became Buddhas.

original: zangs ma yis ni gser dang mtshungs shing 'ching bu dum bus lha yi cod pan nor bu dag dang mtshungs //
analyzed: zangs ma yis ni gser dang mtshungs shing 'ching bu dum bus lha yi cod pan nor bu dag dang mtshungs //
translated: Copper is like gold, and a piece of stone is like a divine crown jewel.

original: smad tshong dam pa'i 'dod pa'i sbyin pas 'chi med rigs kyi bum pags pa dum bu gla rtsi ste //
analyzed: smad tshong dam pa'i 'dod pa'i sbyin pas 'chi med rigs kyi bum pags pa dum bu gla rtsi ste //
translated: By the giving of the desired objects of a prostitute, the immortal lineage is born.

original: bong bu yis ni rigs kyi rta dang ra yis rab mchog glang chen bdag po gal te rnyed pa na //
analyzed: bong bu yis ni rigs kyi rta dang ra yis rab mchog glang chen bdag po gal te rnyed pa na //
translated: If one obtains a donkey of the lineage, a goat of the best horse, and an elephant of the lord,

original: chung ma'i sbyin pas rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la lha mo de la 'di ni rnyed pa cis ma yin; ;byams pa'i gnas la sbyin pa dag ni bde mnyam 'bras ster ma yin sems can mtshungs pa'i mthu las te //üîΩltos pa dang bcas gnas la de bzhin rab mchog rgyal ba'i rigs la sems can bdud kyi rang bzhin phyir //üîΩsnying rje dga' dang bcas pa'i gnas ni zung la gzhan gyi don du bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyis //
analyzed: chung ma'i sbyin pas rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la lha mo de la 'di ni rnyed pa cis ma yin; ;byams pa'i gnas la sbyin pa dag ni bde mnyam 'bras ster ma yin sems can mtshungs pa'i mthu las te // ltos pa dang bcas gnas la de bzhin rab mchog rgyal ba'i rigs la sems can bdud kyi rang bzhin phyir // snying rje dga' dang bcas pa'i gnas ni zung la gzhan gyi don du bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyis //
translated: ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.üîΩ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.

original: rab tu byin na dman pa nyid dang mchog nyid phyir na tshogs gnyis rab rdzogs mi zad bde 'bras ster //üîΩgangs la rigs ni tshad mar gyur pa de la mi yi bdag po rig byed dag ni tshad mar 'gyur //
analyzed: rab tu byin na dman pa nyid dang mchog nyid phyir na tshogs gnyis rab rdzogs mi zad bde 'bras ster // gangs la rigs ni tshad mar gyur pa de la mi yi bdag po rig byed dag ni tshad mar 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of the equality of beings.

original: gang la rig byed tshad mar gyur pa de la nges par sa gzhi'i gnas su mchod sbyin tshad ma ste //
analyzed: gang la rig byed tshad mar gyur pa de la nges par sa gzhi'i gnas su mchod sbyin tshad ma ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThe gift to the object of compassion, which is dependent, does not give the fruit of equal bliss, because of the power of

original: gang la mchod sbyin tshad ma de la rnam mang phyugs dang mi rnams dag la 'tshe ba tshad mar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang la mchod sbyin tshad ma de la rnam mang phyugs dang mi rnams dag la 'tshe ba tshad mar 'gyur //
translated: Where there is a standard of sacrifice, there is a standard of harm to many animals and men.

original: gang la 'tshe ba tshad mar gyur @143a *//
analyzed: gang la 'tshe ba tshad mar gyur @143a *//
translated: Where there is a standard of harm,

original: pa de la dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i sdig pa tshad ma'o //
analyzed: pa de la dmyal ba'i 'jigs pa byed pa'i sdig pa tshad ma'o //
translated: there is a standard of sin that brings about the fear of hell.

original: gnas ni 'dzin pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal ldan gtsug lag khang gi rab gnas bzhed par gsungs //
analyzed: gnas ni 'dzin pa'i don du bcom ldan 'das kyis dpal ldan gtsug lag khang gi rab gnas bzhed par gsungs //
translated: The Blessed One has declared that the consecration of a glorious monastery is for the purpose of taking possession of it.

original: de la sman dang kha zas sbyin par nad ni zhi bar byed pa sbyin pa po yis sbyin no zer //
analyzed: de la sman dang kha zas sbyin par nad ni zhi bar byed pa sbyin pa po yis sbyin no zer //
translated: There, it is said, the donor who gives medicine and food gives health to the recipients.

original: sbyin pa med na gtsug lag khang 'dis yi steng gi gnas su dud 'gro rnams kyi gnas su ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa med na gtsug lag khang 'dis yi steng gi gnas su dud 'gro rnams kyi gnas su ste //
translated: If there is no donation, this monastery will become the abode of animals in the upper realms.

original: gang du dge 'dun gcig ni 'dzin par gyur pa de ni mi yi bdag po chos dang sangs rgyas kyang //
analyzed: gang du dge 'dun gcig ni 'dzin par gyur pa de ni mi yi bdag po chos dang sangs rgyas kyang //
translated: Where the Sa·πÖgha is united, there is the Dharma and the Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la ni mi rnams thar pa'i slad du skyabs su nye bar 'gro ba ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas chos dang dge 'dun la ni mi rnams thar pa'i slad du skyabs su nye bar 'gro ba ste //
translated: and men go for refuge to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha for the sake of liberation.

original: 'dir ni sangs rgyas gtsug lag khang na gnas pa 'di dang yi ge bris ba'i glegs bam chos nyid dang // dge 'dun dur smrig 'dzin pa mchog gi khyab bdag bde ba skye ba 'bum phrag rnams kyis ster ba min //
analyzed: 'dir ni sangs rgyas gtsug lag khang na gnas pa 'di dang yi ge bris ba'i glegs bam chos nyid dang // dge 'dun dur smrig 'dzin pa mchog gi khyab bdag bde ba skye ba 'bum phrag rnams kyis ster ba min //
translated: Here, the Buddha is the temple, the Dharma is the written book, the Sangha is the saffron robe, and the hundred thousand births of bliss are the supreme lord.

original: slob dpon dag ni sangs rgyas nyid de rab mchog sa yi gzhi la chos ni de yi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dag ni sangs rgyas nyid de rab mchog sa yi gzhi la chos ni de yi bstan pa'o //
translated: The master is the Buddha himself, the supreme ground is the Dharma,

original: dge 'dun gang zhig der gnas rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang sems can kun la rjes su brtse ba ste //
analyzed: dge 'dun gang zhig der gnas rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang sems can kun la rjes su brtse ba ste //
translated: and the Sangha is the one who abides there with a joyful heart, compassionate towards all beings.

original: de 'dir rnam bzhi rnam pa gnyis gsungs 'dir ni slar yang nyan thos pa dang bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir rnam bzhi rnam pa gnyis gsungs 'dir ni slar yang nyan thos pa dang bla na med pa'o //
translated: Here, it is said to be of four kinds, twofold, and again of two kinds, namely, the ≈örƒÅvakas and the unsurpassed.

original: dge slong rnams dang dge slong ma dang slar yang 'dir ni dge bsnyen chen po dag dang dge bsnyen ma //
analyzed: dge slong rnams dang dge slong ma dang slar yang 'dir ni dge bsnyen chen po dag dang dge bsnyen ma //
translated: The monks and nuns, and again here the great male and female lay practitioners,

original: rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor pa rnams lhan skyes bde ba la dga' dge bsnyen @143b ma dang dge bsnyen yang //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma dang rnal 'byor pa rnams lhan skyes bde ba la dga' dge bsnyen @143b ma dang dge bsnyen yang //
translated: the male and female yogins and yoginƒ´s, the male and female lay practitioners, delight in the innate bliss.

original: bsod nams ye shes don gyi slad du rtag par mchog tu 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes don gyi slad du rtag par mchog tu 'dod pa'i sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyang //
translated: For the sake of merit and wisdom, they always give various gifts to the supreme ones.

original: nyan thos rnams la mchod ston la sogs rnal 'byor ba la mchog gi bde byed 'dod pa'i sbyin pa yang //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams la mchod ston la sogs rnal 'byor ba la mchog gi bde byed 'dod pa'i sbyin pa yang //
translated: They give gifts to the ≈örƒÅvakas, such as feasts, and to the yogis, the supreme means of happiness.

original: sbyin pa po gang rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang dus kun tu ni chags pa'i sems kyis sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: sbyin pa po gang rab tu dga' ba'i snying dang dus kun tu ni chags pa'i sems kyis sbyin byed pa //
translated: Those givers who give with a mind of attachment, with a heart full of joy,

original: de dag bsod nams ye shes rdzogs te mchog gi bde ba'i gnas su skye ba 'di la 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag bsod nams ye shes rdzogs te mchog gi bde ba'i gnas su skye ba 'di la 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: they go to the supreme abode of happiness in this life, having perfected merit and wisdom.

original: slob dpon dang ni rgyal ba la yang mkhas pa min pa'i nyan thos gang dag gsal bar smod byed pa //
analyzed: slob dpon dang ni rgyal ba la yang mkhas pa min pa'i nyan thos gang dag gsal bar smod byed pa //
translated: Those ignorant ≈örƒÅvakas who clearly slander the masters and the Victorious Ones,

original: de dag bgegs kyi mgon po bsad de mchog tu 'jigs pa byed pa'i mnar med du ni myur du 'gro /
analyzed: de dag bgegs kyi mgon po bsad de mchog tu 'jigs pa byed pa'i mnar med du ni myur du 'gro /
translated: they quickly go to Avƒ´ci, the supreme terror, having killed the protector of obstacles.

original: gang la rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag pos sngags kyi mthu rnams kyis ni rang nyid byin gyis brlab pa mdzad //
analyzed: gang la rab mchog rgyal ba'i bdag pos sngags kyi mthu rnams kyis ni rang nyid byin gyis brlab pa mdzad //
translated: To whom the supreme Victorious One, the Lord, has blessed himself with the powers of mantra,

original: mi rnams dag las dge slong su zhig brtul zhugs nges pa'i gnas la de dang tshangs par spyod pa mtshungs //
analyzed: mi rnams dag las dge slong su zhig brtul zhugs nges pa'i gnas la de dang tshangs par spyod pa mtshungs //
translated: Among men, which monk is the one who is firm in his observances and who is his equal in pure conduct?

original: mchog gi bde ba la dga' dge slong dag gam kun tu rgyu dang gcer bu mgo zlum ral pa can //
analyzed: mchog gi bde ba la dga' dge slong dag gam kun tu rgyu dang gcer bu mgo zlum ral pa can //
translated: The one who delights in supreme bliss, the monk, the wandering ascetic, the naked one, the shaven-headed one, the one with matted hair,üîΩ the one who delights in learning and recitation, the wise one, the one who has not fallen away, the one who performs all actions, and the one who clings to self and creator,

original: thos dang klog pa la dga' mkhas pa la ma nyams thams cad byed po dang ni bdag tu zhen pa dang // 'dir ni rtag tu rang gzhan bu dang chung mar zhen dang bza' dang bza' ba min par zhen pa dang / rigs dang rigs ni min pa la dga' snod dang snod min dag tu zhen pas dga' ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: thos dang klog pa la dga' mkhas pa la ma nyams thams cad byed po dang ni bdag tu zhen pa dang // 'dir ni rtag tu rang gzhan bu dang chung mar zhen dang bza' dang bza' ba min par zhen pa dang / rigs dang rigs ni min pa la dga' snod dang snod min dag tu zhen pas dga' ba byed pa'o //
translated: the one who always delights in self and others, in sons and wives, in what is to be eaten and what is not to be eaten, in what is of the same caste and what is not of the same caste, and in what is a vessel and what is not a vessel,

original: sangs rgyas zhing ni sangs rgyas dang bcas bde mnyam 'bras ster lus dang ngag dang yid @144a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing ni sangs rgyas dang bcas bde mnyam 'bras ster lus dang ngag dang yid @144a *//
translated: The Buddha-field together with the Buddhas, which bestows the fruit of supreme bliss, with body, speech, and mind,

original: dang chags pa ste //
analyzed: dang chags pa ste //
translated: and with passion,

original: 'di dag kun tu bor nas sdig pa'i blo yis khyab bdag gzhan pa dag kyang yang dag tshol byed de //
analyzed: 'di dag kun tu bor nas sdig pa'i blo yis khyab bdag gzhan pa dag kyang yang dag tshol byed de //
translated: having completely abandoned all of these, with a sinful mind he seeks for another all-pervading Lord.

original: zhi dang 'jug ngogs yul gzhan dag tu brtul zhugs nges pa brgya dang smyang gnas ri las mchong ba dang // g-yul dang nyi ma gza' yis zin la yul gyi bde 'dod du ma'i mtshon dang me la mchong bas so //
analyzed: zhi dang 'jug ngogs yul gzhan dag tu brtul zhugs nges pa brgya dang smyang gnas ri las mchong ba dang // g-yul dang nyi ma gza' yis zin la yul gyi bde 'dod du ma'i mtshon dang me la mchong bas so //
translated: In other countries, by the hundred, the observances of ascetics, fasting, and leaping from cliffs; in battle, by the thousand, the observances of heroes, and leaping into fire and water for the sake of the king and for love.

original: bdud rnams dag gis khrag ni btung ba'i slad du 'di dag mtha' dag sngon gyi tshe yang bkod pa ste //üîΩ'jug ngogs smyung gnas dag gis shi bar gyur dang g-yul du bsnun pa nyid dang ba lang nyi ma ni //
analyzed: bdud rnams dag gis khrag ni btung ba'i slad du 'di dag mtha' dag sngon gyi tshe yang bkod pa ste // 'jug ngogs smyung gnas dag gis shi bar gyur dang g-yul du bsnun pa nyid dang ba lang nyi ma ni //
translated: All these were arranged by the demons in former times in order to drink the blood of those who died.üîΩIn other countries, by fasting and asceticism, by battle and by the bull sacrifice,

original: grol ba'i don dang khyim dang nor gyi yul dang bram ze'i bya ba dag la shi ba mtho ris so //
analyzed: grol ba'i don dang khyim dang nor gyi yul dang bram ze'i bya ba dag la shi ba mtho ris so //
translated: by the rite of the horse and the rite of the Brahman, death is heaven.

original: de yi phyir na rang dang gzhan gyi lus ni bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas 'di bsrung bar bya ba yin //
analyzed: de yi phyir na rang dang gzhan gyi lus ni bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas 'di bsrung bar bya ba yin //
translated: Therefore, one should protect this body, which is the abode of the equal pleasure of self and others.

original: gang zhig rgyud kyi rgyal po las ni rgyal ba mchog gi spyod pa thos shing dbang ni blangs nas kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyud kyi rgyal po las ni rgyal ba mchog gi spyod pa thos shing dbang ni blangs nas kyang //
translated: He who has heard the conduct of the Supreme Victor in the Tantra-raja and has received initiation,

original: slar yang phrag dog byed na de ni dmyal ba brgyad pa ji srid nyid du rab tu 'jug 'gyur te //
analyzed: slar yang phrag dog byed na de ni dmyal ba brgyad pa ji srid nyid du rab tu 'jug 'gyur te //
translated: If he should again become jealous, he will enter the eighth hell, Avƒ´ci.

original: gang na khab rtse'i sa la mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis dmyal ba rnams ni kun tu rgyu bar byed //
analyzed: gang na khab rtse'i sa la mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis dmyal ba rnams ni kun tu rgyu bar byed //
translated: There, by the power of the result of nonvirtue, the hell beings wander about on the points of needles.

original: de phyir mi rnams sems la phrag dog yod kyi bar du dbang ni blang bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir mi rnams sems la phrag dog yod kyi bar du dbang ni blang bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, until humans are free of jealousy, they will not obtain power.üîΩThe family that gives birth to the Victorious Ones is perfected in generosity, morality, patience, and effort;

original: rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la sbyin pa tshul khrims rab tu rdzogs dang bzod pa brtson 'grus rdzogs pa dang // bsam gtan shes rab dang ni thabs dang smon lam dag dang @144b stobs dang ye shes rdzogs pa chung ma yi //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la sbyin pa tshul khrims rab tu rdzogs dang bzod pa brtson 'grus rdzogs pa dang // bsam gtan shes rab dang ni thabs dang smon lam dag dang @144b stobs dang ye shes rdzogs pa chung ma yi //
translated: in concentration, wisdom, method, aspiration, power, and knowledge.

original: sbyin pa 'di yis myur du rab tu dga' ba'i yid can rnal 'byor pa yi skye ba 'di la ste //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'di yis myur du rab tu dga' ba'i yid can rnal 'byor pa yi skye ba 'di la ste //
translated: By this generosity, the yogi quickly becomes joyful in this life.

original: gang zhig rmongs pa'i mi de rnams kyis de la rjes su 'ching ba byas nas dmyal bar nye bar 'gro //
analyzed: gang zhig rmongs pa'i mi de rnams kyis de la rjes su 'ching ba byas nas dmyal bar nye bar 'gro //
translated: Those foolish people who are bound to it go to hell.

original: sa dang dpal 'byor slad du shin tu g-yo ba'i snying ldan sngar ma yis ni ral gri rnon po dag /
analyzed: sa dang dpal 'byor slad du shin tu g-yo ba'i snying ldan sngar ma yis ni ral gri rnon po dag /
translated: For the sake of land and wealth, with a very fickle heart, a man takes up a sharp sword

original: bzung ste kun nas 'thab mo yis dkigs pa'i yan lag bzhi ldan g-yul du rab tu zhugs pa na //
analyzed: bzung ste kun nas 'thab mo yis dkigs pa'i yan lag bzhi ldan g-yul du rab tu zhugs pa na //
translated: and enters the battle, with its four divisions, which is a cause of fear,

original: glang chen tshogs pa mthong nas 'jigs pas de yi lag pa'i mthil nas ral gri dag ni lhung gyur pa //
analyzed: glang chen tshogs pa mthong nas 'jigs pas de yi lag pa'i mthil nas ral gri dag ni lhung gyur pa //
translated: and when he sees a mass of elephants, he drops the sword from his hand through fear.

original: de la ral gri'i skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin ji ltar de bzhin nyid du sngags kyi rigs kyi'o //
analyzed: de la ral gri'i skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin ji ltar de bzhin nyid du sngags kyi rigs kyi'o //
translated: But he is not at fault for the sword, and in the same way there is no fault in the mantra family.

original: sngags dang dpa' bo'i rim pa yis kyang lha min gdengs can lha rnams drag po'i sa la bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: sngags dang dpa' bo'i rim pa yis kyang lha min gdengs can lha rnams drag po'i sa la bsgrub par bya //
translated: By the stages of mantra and hero, the asuras, serpents, and gods are established in the stage of Rudra.

original: rang byin brlabs pas lha mo dam tshig rigs la gnas rnams bsam gtan bzlas pa sbyin sreg dag gis kyang //
analyzed: rang byin brlabs pas lha mo dam tshig rigs la gnas rnams bsam gtan bzlas pa sbyin sreg dag gis kyang //
translated: By self-consecration, the goddesses abiding in the pledge and family, by meditation, recitation, and burnt offerings,

original: dag pa'i rim pas dbang ste sngags pa yis ni rgyun chad med par dga' ba chen po'i sems kyis so; ;ye shes yid bzhin nor bur gang zhig rab tu gyur pa de las kyang ni rgyal ba'i lam 'di'o //
analyzed: dag pa'i rim pas dbang ste sngags pa yis ni rgyun chad med par dga' ba chen po'i sems kyis so; ;ye shes yid bzhin nor bur gang zhig rab tu gyur pa de las kyang ni rgyal ba'i lam 'di'o //
translated: from that, too, is this path of the Victor, which is the wish-fulfilling gem of intuition.üîΩFire is the enemy of mercury; without fire, mercury is never bound;

original: me ni dngul chu'i dgra nyid yin te me dang rnam par bral na nam yang dngul chu 'ching ba med; ;ma bcings na ni gser byed med de gser dang bral na smra bo rnams la longs spyod med pa nyid //
analyzed: me ni dngul chu'i dgra nyid yin te me dang rnam par bral na nam yang dngul chu 'ching ba med; ;ma bcings na ni gser byed med de gser dang bral na smra bo rnams la longs spyod med pa nyid //
translated: without binding, there is no production of gold; without gold, there is no enjoyment for the talkers.

original: de bzhin bud med sbyor ba bral na rtag tu rnal 'byor pa rnams dag gi sems ni @145a *//üîΩ'ching mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin bud med sbyor ba bral na rtag tu rnal 'byor pa rnams dag gi sems ni @145a *// 'ching mi 'gyur //
translated: In the same way, the mind of the yogis is never bound without the union with a woman.

original: bcings pa med na lus 'bigs med de ma phug lus kyis 'dir ni lhan skyes bde ba ster ba min //
analyzed: bcings pa med na lus 'bigs med de ma phug lus kyis 'dir ni lhan skyes bde ba ster ba min //
translated: Without binding, there is no piercing of the body; without piercing, the body does not bestow the innate bliss here.

original: skyed mos tshal lam ri bo dag ni skye bo ri dvags bral bar zhi ba'i sngags rnams bsgrub par bya //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal lam ri bo dag ni skye bo ri dvags bral bar zhi ba'i sngags rnams bsgrub par bya //
translated: In a garden or on a mountain, free from people and beasts, one should practice the peaceful mantras.

original: drag po rnams ni drag po'i dur khrod du ste lha mchog gnas su rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa yang //
analyzed: drag po rnams ni drag po'i dur khrod du ste lha mchog gnas su rengs pa dang ni rmongs pa yang //
translated: The fierce ones in the fierce charnel ground, in the abode of the supreme deity, are paralyzed and stupefied.

original: dbang dang dgug pa sngags pas mchog gi sa la bde ba phyag rgya kun dang rab tu sbyor ba la //
analyzed: dbang dang dgug pa sngags pas mchog gi sa la bde ba phyag rgya kun dang rab tu sbyor ba la //
translated: The enchanters, by means of the supreme earth, the bliss, and the union with all the seals,

original: gnas gzhan dang ni skye gnas gzhan du mi rnams kyi ni skye ba 'bum phrag gis kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas gzhan dang ni skye gnas gzhan du mi rnams kyi ni skye ba 'bum phrag gis kyang 'grub mi 'gyur //
translated: are not successful in a hundred thousand births in other places and other wombs.

original: khyim dang grong du bgrang phreng dag gis nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su sngags kyi bzlas pa byas nas ni //
analyzed: khyim dang grong du bgrang phreng dag gis nyin dang mtshan mo'i dus su sngags kyi bzlas pa byas nas ni //
translated: In the house and in the village, by means of the rosary, at the time of day and night, having performed the recitation of the mantra,

original: ngal zhing rmongs te chags pa dang bral slar yang 'di ni sngags kyi dngos grub med pa rjod par byed //
analyzed: ngal zhing rmongs te chags pa dang bral slar yang 'di ni sngags kyi dngos grub med pa rjod par byed //
translated: weary, deluded, and detached, they again proclaim the absence of mantra accomplishment.

original: gnas dang stong pa dus dang mchog gi mtshan mo la gnas yang dag par ni shes pa min pa nyid //
analyzed: gnas dang stong pa dus dang mchog gi mtshan mo la gnas yang dag par ni shes pa min pa nyid //
translated: The place, the void, the time, and the supreme night, the abode, is not known.

original: rkang pa'i sor mo rnams kyi nad la spyi bor sman rnams kyis ni rab tu byug pa byed pa bzhin //
analyzed: rkang pa'i sor mo rnams kyi nad la spyi bor sman rnams kyis ni rab tu byug pa byed pa bzhin //
translated: The disease of the toes of the feet is anointed with medicines on the head.

original: bsam gtan dang ni sngags kyi bzlas pa byed pa dag dang dkyil 'khor chen po rnams dang gdan rnams dang // sbyin sreg sngags kyi rab gnas rdul tshon la ni rgyal ba'i rigs rnams spyan drang bskul ba med par yang //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang ni sngags kyi bzlas pa byed pa dag dang dkyil 'khor chen po rnams dang gdan rnams dang // sbyin sreg sngags kyi rab gnas rdul tshon la ni rgyal ba'i rigs rnams spyan drang bskul ba med par yang //
translated: the fire sacrifice, the consecration of the colored powders, the invitation of the Victorious Ones‚Äô families, without urging,

original: bud med sbyor ba rnam par spangs nas rab mchog khyab bdag bde ba phyag rgya'i dngos grub ster bar byed //
analyzed: bud med sbyor ba rnam par spangs nas rab mchog khyab bdag bde ba phyag rgya'i dngos grub ster bar byed //
translated: the union with a woman, having abandoned it, the all-pervading Lord bestows the supreme, the bliss of the seal‚Äôs accomplishment.

original: de phyir de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su @145b rnal 'byor pa yis thar pa'i slad du bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de phyir de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su @145b rnal 'byor pa yis thar pa'i slad du bsgom par bya //
translated: Therefore, the yogƒ´ should meditate on it every day, for the sake of liberation.

original: rang gi sems ni brgyal dang gnyid la rab tu zhugs pa mi yi bdag po rang bzhin med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni brgyal dang gnyid la rab tu zhugs pa mi yi bdag po rang bzhin med par 'gyur //
translated: One‚Äôs mind, having entered deep sleep and fainting, becomes devoid of nature, O King.

original: sad la rang bzhin dang bcas gsal bar byed de de dag srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i lam ma yin //
analyzed: sad la rang bzhin dang bcas gsal bar byed de de dag srog chags rnams kyi thar pa'i lam ma yin //
translated: When awakened, it becomes clear with its nature, but those are not the path to liberation for living beings.

original: dngos dang dngos med kyis phye sems kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la bde mnyam ster ba min //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med kyis phye sems kyi rdo rje rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la bde mnyam ster ba min //
translated: The mind-vajra of the yogƒ´, divided into real and unreal, does not bestow the bliss of equality.

original: gang zhig mkha' ye shes rab la 'khyud lhan skyes bde bar gnas pa'i rang sems de ni thar pa ster //
analyzed: gang zhig mkha' ye shes rab la 'khyud lhan skyes bde bar gnas pa'i rang sems de ni thar pa ster //
translated: That mind of one‚Äôs own which abides in the co-emergent bliss, embraced by the wisdom consort of space, bestows liberation.

original: aom a'a:h'um ho rim par gnas pas dang por 'dir ni rtag tu chang ni sbyangs nas rtogs par bya //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um ho rim par gnas pas dang por 'dir ni rtag tu chang ni sbyangs nas rtogs par bya //
translated: O·πÉ ƒÅ·∏• h≈´·πÉ ho·∏•, having purified the beer here in stages, one should realize it.

original: rab tu 'bar bar byas te ri bong can ni zhu ba bzhin du rim pas bsgoms par byas nas ni //
analyzed: rab tu 'bar bar byas te ri bong can ni zhu ba bzhin du rim pas bsgoms par byas nas ni //
translated: Having made it very hot, one should meditate on it in stages, like the melting of the moon.

original: snod de nas ni thig le dag gis lag pad ri bong can gyi ming med rtse mos sa dag la //
analyzed: snod de nas ni thig le dag gis lag pad ri bong can gyi ming med rtse mos sa dag la //
translated: From that vessel, with the drops, with the tip of the rabbit-named thumb, on the ground,

original: phyi rol tu ni zur gsum byas nas de yi dbus su nyin mor byed pa dang mtshungs zlum po'o //
analyzed: phyi rol tu ni zur gsum byas nas de yi dbus su nyin mor byed pa dang mtshungs zlum po'o //
translated: outside, having made a triangle, in the middle of that, a circle, like the sun.

original: de yi dbus su 'di yi ye shes 'khor lo srid gsum gnas pa dag kyang sngags pas bsgoms byas nas //
analyzed: de yi dbus su 'di yi ye shes 'khor lo srid gsum gnas pa dag kyang sngags pas bsgoms byas nas //
translated: In the middle of that, the wisdom wheel of this, the yogƒ´ should meditate on the three worlds.

original: mthe bong dang ni ming med dag gis nyin zhag so so'i dus su tshim par byed pa la sogs bya //
analyzed: mthe bong dang ni ming med dag gis nyin zhag so so'i dus su tshim par byed pa la sogs bya //
translated: The thumb and the ring finger should be satisfied at the time of each day, and so forth.

original: yul dang grong gi bdag po rnams la thog mar 'dir ni gtor ma dang po dbus mtha'i ming gis te //
analyzed: yul dang grong gi bdag po rnams la thog mar 'dir ni gtor ma dang po dbus mtha'i ming gis te //
translated: First, here, the middle oblation is for the lords of the land and the villages.

original: 'phrog ma la ni chang bu gnyis dang slar yang sngags pas khro bo'i rgyal po la ni gtor ma'o //
analyzed: 'phrog ma la ni chang bu gnyis dang slar yang sngags pas khro bo'i rgyal po la ni gtor ma'o //
translated: For HƒÅrƒ´tƒ´, two lumps, and again for the King of Wrathful Ones, the oblation.

original: pho nya mo rnams dag la zas kyi phud ni sa steng rnams su bdag po rdo rje rnams kyi sbyin //
analyzed: pho nya mo rnams dag la zas kyi phud ni sa steng rnams su bdag po rdo rje rnams kyi sbyin //
translated: For the messengers, the first portion of food is the gift of the lords of the vajras on the surface of the earth.

original: 'byung po rnams la zos pa'i lhag ma sla @146a *//
analyzed: 'byung po rnams la zos pa'i lhag ma sla @146a *//
translated: For the bh≈´tas, the remainder of the food is the oblation.

original: yang dge ba'i don du sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad 'di bklag go //
analyzed: yang dge ba'i don du sbyin pa'i tshigs bcad 'di bklag go //
translated: This verse on giving should be recited for the sake of virtue:

original: mgo dang mgrin pa snying ga lte gsang gtsug tor du ni rang gi rdo rje rnams kyi yan lag dgod //
analyzed: mgo dang mgrin pa snying ga lte gsang gtsug tor du ni rang gi rdo rje rnams kyi yan lag dgod //
translated: The limbs of one‚Äôs own vajra are placed on the head, throat, heart, genitals, and crown.

original: gnyis ka'i rigs la gnas pa'i yan lag sgo rnams kyis ni gnyid kyi dus dang mchod dang 'khrig pa la //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i rigs la gnas pa'i yan lag sgo rnams kyis ni gnyid kyi dus dang mchod dang 'khrig pa la //
translated: The limbs of the one abiding in the two families are placed on the doors at the time of sleep, worship, and sex.

original: lha yi dmigs pa gang yin mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: lha yi dmigs pa gang yin mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur ba ste //
translated: The deity is twofold: direct perception and inference.

original: mngon sum dag ni de nyid sbyor bas mkha' la skar ma bzhin du du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
analyzed: mngon sum dag ni de nyid sbyor bas mkha' la skar ma bzhin du du ma longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku //
translated: Direct perception is the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, which is manifold like stars in the sky through the application of reality.

original: mngon sum min na rjes su dpag pa shi ba'i lus bzhin de nyid min pa yis ni brtags pa gang //
analyzed: mngon sum min na rjes su dpag pa shi ba'i lus bzhin de nyid min pa yis ni brtags pa gang //
translated: If it is not direct perception, then whatever is imagined by those who are not real is like a dead body.

original: de ni ri me sogs la blta bya yongs su ma smin blo can rnal 'byor rnams kyi sgom pa'i don //
analyzed: de ni ri me sogs la blta bya yongs su ma smin blo can rnal 'byor rnams kyi sgom pa'i don //
translated: That is the object of meditation for yogins who have not fully ripened their minds with regard to the mountain, the fire, and so on.

original: gzugs sam yang na dkyil 'khor dag kyang dang por bris sku la ni de nyid min pas bsgom par bya //
analyzed: gzugs sam yang na dkyil 'khor dag kyang dang por bris sku la ni de nyid min pas bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on the ma·πá·∏çala or the form, which is not real, in the beginning, on the painted image.

original: nam mkha' la ni de nyid sbyor ba dag gi rang sems ma tshang med pa mtha' dag mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni de nyid sbyor ba dag gi rang sems ma tshang med pa mtha' dag mthong gyur pa //
translated: Having seen one‚Äôs own mind in its entirety, without exception, in the sky through the application of reality,

original: lo yi phyed dang lo gcig bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis ji srid nyid du brtan par gyur gyi bar //
analyzed: lo yi phyed dang lo gcig bla ma'i nges pa'i dbang gis ji srid nyid du brtan par gyur gyi bar //
translated: one should meditate for half a year or one year, for as long as stability occurs, by the order of the guru.

original: de nas phyag rgya'i sbyor bas nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis 'gyur ba med pa nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas phyag rgya'i sbyor bas nyin zhag 'ga' zhig dag gis 'gyur ba med pa nyid du rab tu 'gyur //
translated: Then, by the application of the consort, in a few days, it becomes immutable.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las ni nges par rdo rje'i tshig 'di rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la gsungs //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po thams cad las ni nges par rdo rje'i tshig 'di rnal 'byor pa rnams dag la gsungs //
translated: In all the kings of tantras, this vajra statement is taught for the yogis.

original: byis pa rnams ni smin par byed pa'i don du mchog gi snying rje dag gi sna tshogs gtso bos sbas //
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni smin par byed pa'i don du mchog gi snying rje dag gi sna tshogs gtso bos sbas //
translated: The chief one of compassion, for the sake of ripening the childish, has hidden it in various ways.

original: de phyir de ni @146b dbye ba byas nas nyin zhag so so'i dus su rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de phyir de ni @146b dbye ba byas nas nyin zhag so so'i dus su rnal 'byor pa yis bsgom par bya //
translated: Therefore, having divided it up, the yogi should meditate on it at each time of the day.

original: phyag rgya'i dngos grub don slad rgyal ba mchog gi skyed mdzad gzhom du med pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i dngos grub don slad rgyal ba mchog gi skyed mdzad gzhom du med pa dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: For the sake of the attainment of the consort, the supreme victor, the creator, the invincible one, is the Wheel of Time.

original: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las /
analyzed: dpal dang po'i sangs rgyas chen po las phyung ba dpal dus kyi 'khor lo las /
translated: From the glorious Great Original Buddha, the glorious Wheel of Time

original: sgrub thabs kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: sgrub thabs kyi le'u ste bzhi pa'o ////
translated: is extracted from the fourth chapter on the means of accomplishment.

original: gtso bo'i sgrub thabs rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa gang zhig khyod kyis gsungs pa dag ni cung zad shes //
analyzed: gtso bo'i sgrub thabs rgyal ba mchog dang bcas pa gang zhig khyod kyis gsungs pa dag ni cung zad shes //
translated: I know a little of the principal sadhana, together with the supreme Victor, that you have taught.

original: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo lha mi'i bla ma khams kyi dbye ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor dang // sangs rgyas rnams dang rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi rigs drug a'a li k'a li dag la gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: slar yang bdag ni nyan par 'tshal lo lha mi'i bla ma khams kyi dbye ba rnams kyi dkyil 'khor dang // sangs rgyas rnams dang rnal 'byor ma rnams dag gi rigs drug a'a li k'a li dag la gnas pa nyid //
translated: Again I wish to listen, O Guru of gods and men, to the mandala of the divisions of the elements, and to the families of the Buddhas and yoginis that abide in the vowels and consonants.

original: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas rgyal ba'i bdag pos khams kyi dbye ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs gsungs //
analyzed: zla ba bzang po'i tshig dag gsan nas rgyal ba'i bdag pos khams kyi dbye ba'i dkyil 'khor la sogs gsungs //
translated: Having heard the words of Sucandra, the Lord of Victors taught the mandala of the divisions of the elements and so forth.

original: ka ba rnams dang rdo rje phreng bas yi dkyil 'khor rtsig pa nyid ni rus pa rnams kyis mdzod //
analyzed: ka ba rnams dang rdo rje phreng bas yi dkyil 'khor rtsig pa nyid ni rus pa rnams kyis mdzod //
translated: The pillars and the vajra garland are the mandala walls, made of bones.

original: sha khrag chu dang bshang ba rnams kyis lha dang gshin rje nor sbyin gzhan du rdul tshon gdab pa ste; ;mkhris pa bad kan gyis ni nyi ma ri bong can yang de bzhin chu rgyus rnams kyi chu skyes rnams //
analyzed: sha khrag chu dang bshang ba rnams kyis lha dang gshin rje nor sbyin gzhan du rdul tshon gdab pa ste; ;mkhris pa bad kan gyis ni nyi ma ri bong can yang de bzhin chu rgyus rnams kyi chu skyes rnams //
translated: The sun and moon are placed with bile and phlegm, and the lotuses with the veins.üîΩThe five principal channels are born from earth, water, fire, wind, and space.

original: rab lnga yi re kh'a sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' las skyes rnams kyis so; ;dus kyi rtsa yis gtso bo'i chu skyes g-yo ba me yi dkyil 'khor la sogs pags pa la sogs kyis //
analyzed: rab lnga yi re kh'a sa dang chu dang bsreg za rlung dang nam mkha' las skyes rnams kyis so; ;dus kyi rtsa yis gtso bo'i chu skyes g-yo ba me yi dkyil 'khor la sogs pags pa la sogs kyis //
translated: The principal lotus moves in the navel and so forth by the channel of time.

original: nyi ma'i sgo rnams bug pa rnams kyis nor bu'i rang bzhin bkod pa so yi phreng @147a *//üîΩbas de bzhin nyid //üîΩdur khrod brgyad du 'khor lo g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas rnams ni sor mo rnams kyi sen mo yis //
analyzed: nyi ma'i sgo rnams bug pa rnams kyis nor bu'i rang bzhin bkod pa so yi phreng @147a *// bas de bzhin nyid // dur khrod brgyad du 'khor lo g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas rnams ni sor mo rnams kyi sen mo yis //
translated: The doors of the sun are the orifices, and the arrangement of the jewel is with the rows of teeth.üîΩThe eight charnel grounds are the places of the moving ma·πá·∏çala, and the nails of the fingers are the nails.

original: ba spu rnams kyis rdo rje me lce dkyil 'khor gyi ni mtha' ru phyogs dang phyogs bral dag la gnas //
analyzed: ba spu rnams kyis rdo rje me lce dkyil 'khor gyi ni mtha' ru phyogs dang phyogs bral dag la gnas //
translated: The vajra flames are the hairs of the body, and the directions and intermediate directions are the periphery of the ma·πá·∏çala.

original: de ltar nges par sku yi rdo rje mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dkyil 'khor gyi ni rnam par gsungs //
analyzed: de ltar nges par sku yi rdo rje mchog gi yon tan rnam mang dkyil 'khor gyi ni rnam par gsungs //
translated: Thus, the qualities of the supreme Vajra Body are said to be the ma·πá·∏çala of many kinds.

original: gsung gi rdo rje aa sogs ka sogs lha yi rnam pa nyid ni mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs rnams kyis //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje aa sogs ka sogs lha yi rnam pa nyid ni mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs rnams kyis //
translated: The Vajra Speech is the entire form of the deities, the vowels and consonants, of the families of the Victorious Ones.

original: stong pa drug gi thugs kyi rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi srid pa la gnas gtso bo'i rnam pa nyid //
analyzed: stong pa drug gi thugs kyi rdo rje rnam pa gsum gyi srid pa la gnas gtso bo'i rnam pa nyid //
translated: The Vajra Mind is the three aspects of the six emptinesses, abiding in existence, the form of the principal one.

original: de bzhin du ni ye shes rdo rje srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa sna tshogs yum gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ye shes rdo rje srid pa'i 'jigs pa 'joms pa sna tshogs yum gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, the Vajra Wisdom is the destroyer of the fear of existence, the nature of the mother of variety.

original: sde pa ka la sogs pa drug po rim pas yongs su bkod pa rnams kyi rigs ni rim pa yis; ;rdo rje ral gri rin chen 'khor lo chu skyes de bzhin gri gug nyid ni rgyal ba rnams kyi ste //
analyzed: sde pa ka la sogs pa drug po rim pas yongs su bkod pa rnams kyi rigs ni rim pa yis; ;rdo rje ral gri rin chen 'khor lo chu skyes de bzhin gri gug nyid ni rgyal ba rnams kyi ste //
translated: The families of the six classes beginning with ka, arranged in order, are the vajra, sword, jewel, wheel, lotus, and likewise, the flaying knife of the Victorious Ones.

original: slar yang sde pa re re la yang mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog gi dbye ba lnga rnams dag gis dbye //

analyzed: rig sngags 'chang gis dbang po mtha' dag tu 'gyur ka sogs sde pa brtsegs pa la gnas brgyad rnams so //

analyzed: dbyangs kyi rnam par 'gyur bas phye ba ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro ni 'khor lo'i mgon po rnams su 'gyur //
translated: The vowels are divided by the transformations of the vowels. The ras transformed by the ras are the lords of the wheel.

analyzed: sku ni gcig pa nges par gcig gis 'khor dang bcas pa gnyis ni shes rab dag gis 'khyud par 'gyur //
translated: The one body is definitely one, and the two with retinues are embraced by the two wisdoms.

analyzed: lnga yi bdag nyid lnga yis 'gyur te 'khor dang bcas pa dgu ni 'khor lo'i mgon po dgu dag nyid //
translated: The five natures are five, and the nine with retinues are the nine lords of the wheel.

analyzed: dbyangs kyi grangs kyis bdag nyid bcu gsum dgu dang phyogs rnams kyis kyang sum cu rtsa drug bdag nyid de //
translated: The thirteen natures by the number of vowels and the thirty-six natures by the directions

translated: The door-keepers are formed by the Ya and so forth, and the rest of the families by the remaining vowels.

translated: The six wrathful ones are formed by the Ha and so forth, and the ones abiding in the directions of their own families by the divisions of the wind, vowel, and so forth.

analyzed: so sor yi ge'i dbye ba rnams kyis ro yis bsgyur ba'i ro ni rnal 'byor ma dang rnal @148a *//

analyzed: thod pa rnams kyis phreng ba bcings shing chu yi gter gyi zhal dang nyi ma'i phyag ldan he ru ka /
translated: He is Heruka, garlanded with skulls, with a face like the ocean, and hands like the sun.

original: phyag rgya sprul dang stag gi pags pa mi bzad glang po'i bdag po'i pags pa bshus pa rlon pa 'dzin //
analyzed: phyag rgya sprul dang stag gi pags pa mi bzad glang po'i bdag po'i pags pa bshus pa rlon pa 'dzin //
translated: He has the emblems of the snake and tiger skins, and holds the fresh skin of the great elephant.

original: nag dang dmar dang dri med ri bong can lus lha mo rnams kyi phyi rol tu ni 'khor lo gsum //
analyzed: nag dang dmar dang dri med ri bong can lus lha mo rnams kyi phyi rol tu ni 'khor lo gsum //
translated: Black, red, and stainless, with the moon on his body, the goddesses are outside the three wheels.

original: rdo rje drug ni khro bo las skyes phyag gnyis zla zhal rnams dang de bzhin 'byung po skyes rnams kyis //
analyzed: rdo rje drug ni khro bo las skyes phyag gnyis zla zhal rnams dang de bzhin 'byung po skyes rnams kyis //
translated: The six vajras are the two-armed ones born from the wrathful ones, the moon-faced ones, and likewise the bh≈´ta-born ones.

original: sgor ni gtum mo ro la gnas shing phyag na gri gug thod pa phyogs bral du yang nges par ro //
analyzed: sgor ni gtum mo ro la gnas shing phyag na gri gug thod pa phyogs bral du yang nges par ro //
translated: In the doorways, Ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ stands on a corpse, with a flaying knife and skull-cup. In the intermediate directions, they are also certain.

original: dpa' bo rnams kyis rig byed phyag na rdo rje d'a ma ru dang @149b dril bu rdo rje kha tv'am ga /
analyzed: dpa' bo rnams kyis rig byed phyag na rdo rje d'a ma ru dang @149b dril bu rdo rje kha tv'am ga /
translated: The heroes have the Vedas, VajrapƒÅ·πái, the drum, and the bell.

original: dpal ldan dang po'i phyogs brgyad du ni sa chu'i dkyil 'khor dag la gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kun te //
analyzed: dpal ldan dang po'i phyogs brgyad du ni sa chu'i dkyil 'khor dag la gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kun te //
translated: In the glorious first directions, on the earth and water ma·πá·∏çalas, are the abodes and the neighboring abodes.

original: zhing dang tshando ha ngang 'dus pa can dang dur khrod sa ni me dang rlung gi dbus su yang //
analyzed: zhing dang tshando ha ngang 'dus pa can dang dur khrod sa ni me dang rlung gi dbus su yang //
translated: The fields and ca·πá·∏ça-mahƒÅ-ro·π£a-ca·πá·∏çƒÅlƒ´ are in the middle of fire and wind.

original: de bzhin yul dang grong khyer la ni phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas lha rnams rig par bya ba ste //
analyzed: de bzhin yul dang grong khyer la ni phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas lha rnams rig par bya ba ste //
translated: Likewise, the countries and cities are in the directions and intermediate directions. The gods should be known.

original: shes rab rgyud kyi mngon par brjod pa srid pa gsum gyi bla mas sher gyi zhal nas spros pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rgyud kyi mngon par brjod pa srid pa gsum gyi bla mas sher gyi zhal nas spros pa'o //
translated: This is the oral instruction of ≈örƒ´ Heruka, the lord of the three existences, from the Tantra of the Oral Instructions of Wisdom.

original: snying por 'khor lo cha dgu pa ste dkyil 'khor las ni phyed kyi cha shas zla nyi padma la //
analyzed: snying por 'khor lo cha dgu pa ste dkyil 'khor las ni phyed kyi cha shas zla nyi padma la //
translated: The essence is the nine-part wheel, half of the mandala, on the moon, sun, and lotus.üîΩIt is also adorned with a garland of vajra pillars, the great gods of the aggregates and elements.

original: rdo rje ka ba'i phreng ba dag gis spras pa yang ni phung po khams kyi lhag pa'i lha chen po; ;phyi rol tu ni ra ba'i rtsig pa dag la yul dang yul can zla ba nyi ma'i gdan la gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje ka ba'i phreng ba dag gis spras pa yang ni phung po khams kyi lhag pa'i lha chen po; ;phyi rol tu ni ra ba'i rtsig pa dag la yul dang yul can zla ba nyi ma'i gdan la gnas //
translated: Outside, on the walls of the enclosure, the objects and subjects are seated on moon and sun seats.

original: sgo skyong rnams ni nyi ma la gnas gzhan pa tshogs kyi rigs ni kha khyer dag la kun nas so //
analyzed: sgo skyong rnams ni nyi ma la gnas gzhan pa tshogs kyi rigs ni kha khyer dag la kun nas so //
translated: The gate guardians are on the sun, the other assembly types are all around on the ledges.

original: 'di le sogs pa la ni de bzhin rnal 'byor rgyud kyang 'dus pa rnam pa drug tu gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: 'di le sogs pa la ni de bzhin rnal 'byor rgyud kyang 'dus pa rnam pa drug tu gsungs pa ste //
translated: In this chapter and so forth, the yoga tantra is also included in six types.

original: zur du khro bo rnams dang logs su yul dang yul can dzam bha la ni phyag na so ba bsnams //
analyzed: zur du khro bo rnams dang logs su yul dang yul can dzam bha la ni phyag na so ba bsnams //
translated: The wrathful ones are in the corners, and JƒÅ·πÅbhalas, objects and subjects, are in the other directions, holding a club in their hands.

original: ngag dang rkang lag bshang lem bha ga nyi ma ri bong can rnams dus kyir tsa yi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: ngag dang rkang lag bshang lem bha ga nyi ma ri bong can rnams dus kyir tsa yi rang bzhin te //
translated: Speech, hands, anus, vagina, sun, and moon are the nature of the cakras.

original: shes rab dang ni thabs rnams mtha' dag zhal gsum ro yi phyag ldan g-yas kyi zhal nas spros pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ni thabs rnams mtha' dag zhal gsum ro yi phyag ldan g-yas kyi zhal nas spros pa'o //
translated: Wisdom and all the means are the three-faced, corpse-handed, right-faced emanations.

original: snying por 'khor lo chu gter zung du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po dkyil 'khor las ni gsum gyi cha //
analyzed: snying por 'khor lo chu gter zung du 'gyur te mi yi bdag po dkyil 'khor las ni gsum gyi cha //
translated: The essence is the wheel, the pair of oceans, and the third part of the mandala of the lord of men.

original: phung po khams rnams lhag pa'i lha nyid slar yang 'phar ma gzhan la sgra yi rdo rje la sogs brgyad //
analyzed: phung po khams rnams lhag pa'i lha nyid slar yang 'phar ma gzhan la sgra yi rdo rje la sogs brgyad //
translated: The aggregates and elements are the supreme deities, and again, on another floor, the eight beginning with ≈öabdavajrƒÅ.

original: phyi rol @150a *//
analyzed: phyi rol @150a *//
translated: Outside,

original: tu gnas dkyil 'khor la ni phyogs bcur bkod pa nyi ma la gnas khro bo'i tshogs rnams te //
analyzed: tu gnas dkyil 'khor la ni phyogs bcur bkod pa nyi ma la gnas khro bo'i tshogs rnams te //
translated: in the mandala, the wrathful hosts are arrayed in the ten directions, abiding in the sun.

original: der ni ra ba'i rtsig pa dag la dus la chu gter gyis snan byang chub sems dpa' mtha' dag rnams //
analyzed: der ni ra ba'i rtsig pa dag la dus la chu gter gyis snan byang chub sems dpa' mtha' dag rnams //
translated: There, on the walls of the enclosure, are all the bodhisattvas, added to the oceans and waters.

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba dbye ba gsum ste zhal gsum ro yi phyag ni lha yi sku yi dbye ba las //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba dbye ba gsum ste zhal gsum ro yi phyag ni lha yi sku yi dbye ba las //
translated: The net of illusions is threefold, the three-faced, corpse-handed, right-faced emanations from the division of the divine body.

original: rtog pa la sogs gang yin mtha' dag blon po'i snying gi dbang gis g-yon gyi zhal nas spros pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa la sogs gang yin mtha' dag blon po'i snying gi dbang gis g-yon gyi zhal nas spros pa'o //
translated: Whatever there is of imagination and so forth, all of it is emanated from the left face by the power of the heart of the minister.

original: rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa'i rgyud dang 'dir na nyis 'gyur sdom pa chen po mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa'i rgyud dang 'dir na nyis 'gyur sdom pa chen po mkha' 'gro ma rnams kyis //
translated: The Yoginƒ´-jƒÅti-j√±ƒÅna-tantra, and here the great vow of the ·∏çƒÅkinƒ´s, is doubled.

original: 'khor lo drug dang rigs drug mi bdag dur khrod sa rnams kyis ni nub kyi zhal nas spros pa'o //üîΩthig ni drug dang bug pa'i cha shas g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas rnams kyis dkyil 'khor thig btab nas //
analyzed: 'khor lo drug dang rigs drug mi bdag dur khrod sa rnams kyis ni nub kyi zhal nas spros pa'o // thig ni drug dang bug pa'i cha shas g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas rnams kyis dkyil 'khor thig btab nas //
translated: The six cakras, the six families, the lords of men, and the charnel grounds emanate from the western face.üîΩThe six bindus, the parts of the nostrils, and the ma·πá·∏çala located in the moving [winds] are the binding of the ma·πá·∏çala lines.

original: snying po las ni drug drug cha rnams kyis te padma'i 'dab ma phyed kyis lte bar ldan pa yang //
analyzed: snying po las ni drug drug cha rnams kyis te padma'i 'dab ma phyed kyis lte bar ldan pa yang //
translated: From the center, the six parts of six, and the stamens with half a lotus petal,

original: gri gug 'khor lo chu skyes rin chen ral gri mchog gi rdo rje'i phreng ba gnyis gnyis cha rnams kyis //
analyzed: gri gug 'khor lo chu skyes rin chen ral gri mchog gi rdo rje'i phreng ba gnyis gnyis cha rnams kyis //
translated: the two parts of the two garlands of the supreme vajra, the flaying knife, wheel, lotus, jewel, and sword,

original: nyi ma rnams kyi sgo dang sgo khyud dus dang ro rnams kyis kyang kha khyer dang ni do shal sa //
analyzed: nyi ma rnams kyi sgo dang sgo khyud dus dang ro rnams kyis kyang kha khyer dang ni do shal sa //
translated: the doors and door frames with the suns, and the ledges and garlands with the directions and tastes,

original: gsum gyis kyang ni ra ba lnga yi re kh'a rtse mo can gyis do shal rtsa bar snam bu'o //
analyzed: gsum gyis kyang ni ra ba lnga yi re kh'a rtse mo can gyis do shal rtsa bar snam bu'o //
translated: and the three also with the five lines of the enclosure, the garland with the peak, and the base with the cloth.

original: nyi ma rnams kyis logs dang 'gram ste sum 'gyur nyin byed rnams kyis ka ba'i steng du rta babs so //
analyzed: nyi ma rnams kyis logs dang 'gram ste sum 'gyur nyin byed rnams kyis ka ba'i steng du rta babs so //
translated: The sides and corners are three times the size of the sun. The pillars are the size of the sun.

original: phyogs dang phyogs bral dag tu sgo ni brgyad rnams bya ste dkyil 'khor chen po 'di ni zlum po'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs bral dag tu sgo ni brgyad rnams bya ste dkyil 'khor chen po 'di ni zlum po'o //
translated: The gates are in the cardinal and intermediate directions. This great ma·πá·∏çala is round.

original: dbus @150b su chu skyes sna tshogs mdog ste lte ba la ni nyi ma ri bong can dag spyar ba'i gdan //
analyzed: dbus @150b su chu skyes sna tshogs mdog ste lte ba la ni nyi ma ri bong can dag spyar ba'i gdan //
translated: In the center is a multicolored lotus. In the center is a seat of the sun and moon.

original: 'khor lo dang ni phreng ba sngon pos ni ljang gu dag dang sa gzhi nag po 'khor lo ser //
analyzed: 'khor lo dang ni phreng ba sngon pos ni ljang gu dag dang sa gzhi nag po 'khor lo ser //
translated: The wheel and garland are green. The ground is black. The wheel is yellow.üîΩThe four directions are red. The wheel is white. The ground is white. The garland is red. The wheel is red.

original: sa bzhi dmar la 'khor lo dkar dang sa ni dkar po phreng bar bcas pa'i 'khor lo dmar po dang // sa ni ser po sngon po dag dang 'khor lo dkar po min pa dang ni ljang gu'i mdog tu 'gyur //
analyzed: sa bzhi dmar la 'khor lo dkar dang sa ni dkar po phreng bar bcas pa'i 'khor lo dmar po dang // sa ni ser po sngon po dag dang 'khor lo dkar po min pa dang ni ljang gu'i mdog tu 'gyur //
translated: The ground is yellow. The wheel is blue. The wheel is not white. The wheel is green.

original: cha drug gis ni tshon gyis skyed byed zhal yig dbang gis sgo yi 'khor lo de bzhin no //
analyzed: cha drug gis ni tshon gyis skyed byed zhal yig dbang gis sgo yi 'khor lo de bzhin no //
translated: The colors are produced by six parts. The gate wheels are the same by the power of the syllables.

original: phyi rol tu ni brgyad gnyis dur khrod rnams te rigs kyi dbang gis de bzhin snying po'i lha mo brgyad //
analyzed: phyi rol tu ni brgyad gnyis dur khrod rnams te rigs kyi dbang gis de bzhin snying po'i lha mo brgyad //
translated: Externally, there are eight cremation grounds, and the eight goddesses of the essence are in the same way by the power of the families.

original: 'dab ma la ni thod pa bdud rtsi'i ro dang ldan pa brgyad de 'dab ma brgyad la lha mo rnams //
analyzed: 'dab ma la ni thod pa bdud rtsi'i ro dang ldan pa brgyad de 'dab ma brgyad la lha mo rnams //
translated: On the petals are eight skull cups filled with the taste of nectar, and the goddesses are on the eight petals.

original: phyir ni sgeg mo la sogs lha mo phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas de bzhin klu yi rgyal po brgyad //
analyzed: phyir ni sgeg mo la sogs lha mo phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas de bzhin klu yi rgyal po brgyad //
translated: Externally, the goddesses such as LƒÅsya are in the directions and intermediate directions, and likewise the eight nƒÅga kings.

original: de yi phyi rol tu ni sa chu me dang g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid dang rdo rje'i phreng ba'o //
analyzed: de yi phyi rol tu ni sa chu me dang g-yo ba'i dkyil 'khor nyid dang rdo rje'i phreng ba'o //
translated: Outside of that are the ma·πá·∏çalas of earth, water, fire, and wind, and the vajra garland.

original: ring po thung ngu'i dbyangs rnams kyis kyang sa ta pa ta tso ka sa sogs stong sogs yi ge rnams //
analyzed: ring po thung ngu'i dbyangs rnams kyis kyang sa ta pa ta tso ka sa sogs stong sogs yi ge rnams //
translated: The long and short vowels are the letters such as sa, ta, pa, ta, ca, and so on, and the letters such as ka, ·π£a, ·π£a, sa, and so on.

original: rlung sogs rtsibs rnams la ni nyi ma'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis ring pos sogs khams kyi rang bzhin rnams //
analyzed: rlung sogs rtsibs rnams la ni nyi ma'i rgyu ba'i dbang gis ring pos sogs khams kyi rang bzhin rnams //
translated: On the spokes of the wind and so on, by the movement of the sun, the long and so on are the natures of the elements.

original: steng sogs rtsibs la zla ba'i rgyu ba'i dbang gyis thung ngu rang rang 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi steng du'o //
analyzed: steng sogs rtsibs la zla ba'i rgyu ba'i dbang gyis thung ngu rang rang 'khor lo'i rtsibs kyi steng du'o //
translated: On the spokes of the upper and so on, by the movement of the moon, the short and so on are on the spokes of their own wheels.

original: sgo dang sgo yi bar du ha ksha dang ldan nam mkha'i mthil na gnas pa'i sde par bcas pa rnams //
analyzed: sgo dang sgo yi bar du ha ksha dang ldan nam mkha'i mthil na gnas pa'i sde par bcas pa rnams //
translated: In the door and in the door-jambs, with HAKSA, are the hosts dwelling in the depths of space.

original: mkha' 'gro ma rnams thung ba'i dngos po ri bong 'dzin pa'i zhal dang phyag na gri gug thod pa can //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma rnams thung ba'i dngos po ri bong 'dzin pa'i zhal dang phyag na gri gug thod pa can //
translated: The dakinis are short, with the faces and hands of the rabbit-holder, with a knife and a skull-cup.

original: g-yas pa brkyang zhing rang rang snod rnams kyis ni lha @151a *//
analyzed: g-yas pa brkyang zhing rang rang snod rnams kyis ni lha @151a *//
translated: They are standing on the right foot, with their own vessels,

original: min khrag 'thung skra grol gos dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: min khrag 'thung skra grol gos dang bral ba ste /
translated: the asura-drinking blood, with loose hair and naked.

original: rkang ba rked pa dpral ba dang ni rna ba mgrin pa lag par g-yer kha sogs dang rus pa'i rgya //
analyzed: rkang ba rked pa dpral ba dang ni rna ba mgrin pa lag par g-yer kha sogs dang rus pa'i rgya //
translated: On the feet, the waist, the forehead, the ears, the throat, the hands, the anklets, etc., and on the bones,

original: mgo dang rked pa'i ngos la thod pa'i du ma bu rgyal po rnams kyi kha dog lnga yi phed ba'o //üîΩmkha' 'gro zhal gnyis phyag na rdo rje mchog dang d'a ma ru dang rdo rje kha tv'am gdril bu //
analyzed: mgo dang rked pa'i ngos la thod pa'i du ma bu rgyal po rnams kyi kha dog lnga yi phed ba'o // mkha' 'gro zhal gnyis phyag na rdo rje mchog dang d'a ma ru dang rdo rje kha tv'am gdril bu //
translated: on the head and on the sides of the waist, are the many skulls of the kings, with the five colors.üîΩThe dakini has two faces, with the best of the thunderbolt, the damaru, the vajra, the katvanga, and the bell.

original: mgrin pa dpal ldan mgo phreng mgo bor cod pa na yang rdo rje dbyangs dang ni nor bu'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa dpal ldan mgo phreng mgo bor cod pa na yang rdo rje dbyangs dang ni nor bu'o //
translated: On the throat is the glorious garland of heads, and on the head is the diadem with the vajra and the gem.

original: dpal ldan mgul rgyan rkang la rkang gdub phyag la phyag gdub dang ni ska rags dag dang rna rgyan te //
analyzed: dpal ldan mgul rgyan rkang la rkang gdub phyag la phyag gdub dang ni ska rags dag dang rna rgyan te //
translated: The glorious necklace, the anklets on the feet, the bracelets on the wrists, the girdle, and the earrings,

original: rdzogs pa'i thod pa rnams kyis phreng ba mche ba can gyi mtha' dag lus la gnas dang thal ba'i rgya //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i thod pa rnams kyis phreng ba mche ba can gyi mtha' dag lus la gnas dang thal ba'i rgya //
translated: the garland of complete skulls, the ashes of all the rakshasas on the body,

original: gtso bo'i dbu la thod pa rnams kyis phreng ba mgrin par gdong brgya rnams kyis mgo yi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bo'i dbu la thod pa rnams kyis phreng ba mgrin par gdong brgya rnams kyis mgo yi phreng ba'o //
translated: the garland of skulls on the head of the chief, the garland of heads on the neck,

original: zla phyed rdo rje'i cod pan la ste rang gi rked dang phyag gnas stag lpags glang po'i bgas pa'o //
analyzed: zla phyed rdo rje'i cod pan la ste rang gi rked dang phyag gnas stag lpags glang po'i bgas pa'o //
translated: the crescent moon and vajra on the crown, the tiger skin and elephant hide on the waist and hands,

original: zla nyi bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor la ni zhabs kyi rtsa bar bdud dang dbang ldan lus la thal ba ste //üîΩphyag rgya klu yi dbang po dang ldan 'jig dus rtse mo can mtshungs mkha' 'gro ma la 'od dag byed //
analyzed: zla nyi bsreg za'i dkyil 'khor la ni zhabs kyi rtsa bar bdud dang dbang ldan lus la thal ba ste // phyag rgya klu yi dbang po dang ldan 'jig dus rtse mo can mtshungs mkha' 'gro ma la 'od dag byed //
translated: the moon, sun, and rahu on the mandala of the feet, the ashes of Mara and Ishvara on the body,üîΩthe mudra and naga lords, the light of the Kalpa fire, and the dakinis.

original: phyogs kyi 'dab mar mkha' 'gro rnams kyi lag pa d'a ma ru dang rdo rje kha tv'am ga nyid de //
analyzed: phyogs kyi 'dab mar mkha' 'gro rnams kyi lag pa d'a ma ru dang rdo rje kha tv'am ga nyid de //
translated: In the cardinal directions, the dakinis have damarus and kha·π≠vƒÅ·πÖgas in their hands.

original: bshad gcog khrag dang mi sha rnams kyis phyogs bral 'dab ma la gnas khu ba'i snod kyang phyag na'o //
analyzed: bshad gcog khrag dang mi sha rnams kyis phyogs bral 'dab ma la gnas khu ba'i snod kyang phyag na'o //
translated: The skull-cup in his hand is filled with blood and human flesh, and is placed on the petal in the southeast.

original: de bzhin du ni lha mo brgyad kyang kun nas gnyi ga bde la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni lha mo brgyad kyang kun nas gnyi ga bde la snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: In the same way, the eight goddesses are all in union with their respective male partners, and are in the four directions and corners.

original: ser dang @151b dkar po dam ra po'i mdogs dang nag po ljang gu'i lus dang sngon po'i mdog rnams rang phyogs su //
analyzed: ser dang @151b dkar po dam ra po'i mdogs dang nag po ljang gu'i lus dang sngon po'i mdog rnams rang phyogs su //
translated: The colors of the eight goddesses are yellow, white, red, black, green, blue, and so on, in their respective directions.

original: rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la gtso bo'i kha dog mtshan ma rnams ni sngar bzhin spyan gsum dag gi chogs //
analyzed: rgyal ba skyed mdzad rigs la gtso bo'i kha dog mtshan ma rnams ni sngar bzhin spyan gsum dag gi chogs //
translated: The colors and emblems of the principal deities of the families, which produce the Victors, are as before. They all have three eyes.

original: phan chun du ni 'khyud pa dag kyang rang gzhan rigs kyi dbang gis rig par bya ste kun nas so //
analyzed: phan chun du ni 'khyud pa dag kyang rang gzhan rigs kyi dbang gis rig par bya ste kun nas so //
translated: The mutual embrace is to be understood according to the family of each, whether it is one's own or another's.

original: sbyin pa sogs dang phung po 'byung pa yul dang yul can gzhan yang dbang po lnga la sogs pa dang // phyogs sa phyogs kyi stobs dang dpal ldan rgyal sras dbang rnams kyis kyang lha mo rnam par sbyang bar bya //
analyzed: sbyin pa sogs dang phung po 'byung pa yul dang yul can gzhan yang dbang po lnga la sogs pa dang // phyogs sa phyogs kyi stobs dang dpal ldan rgyal sras dbang rnams kyis kyang lha mo rnam par sbyang bar bya //
translated: The giving of gifts and so forth, the arising of the aggregates, the objects and subjects, the five sense faculties and so forth, the directions, the regions, the powers, and the glorious sons of the victors‚Äîall of these are purified by the goddesses.

original: lhun po'i phyogs su dbye ba brgyad kyi phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kun dang // zhi dang tshan do ha dang 'dus pa dur khrod sa dang khyim ni rlung gi phyed kyi mtshams su ste //
analyzed: lhun po'i phyogs su dbye ba brgyad kyi phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas gnas dang nye ba'i gnas kun dang // zhi dang tshan do ha dang 'dus pa dur khrod sa dang khyim ni rlung gi phyed kyi mtshams su ste //
translated: In the directions and intermediate directions of Meru, in the abodes and the neighboring regions, in the peaceful and wrathful places, in the charnel grounds, and in the houses, in the intermediate directions of the winds,

original: 'di dag sangs rgyas sa ni nyi ma phra mo lus skyes mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min dang / nus dang gtso bo'i nyin gcig rigs ldan ma ni rnam par rgyu ste nyi zla'i rab tu rgyu ba las //
analyzed: 'di dag sangs rgyas sa ni nyi ma phra mo lus skyes mi dang 'byung po lha dang lha min dang / nus dang gtso bo'i nyin gcig rigs ldan ma ni rnam par rgyu ste nyi zla'i rab tu rgyu ba las //
translated: the abodes of the buddhas, the subtle sun, the body, humans, bh≈´tas, gods, demigods, the powerful, and the principal, are traversed in a day by the kulas, the sun and moon in their courses.

original: rgyab tu lha mo dbang phyed thim pa zhes 'dir mdun du de nyid lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis te //
analyzed: rgyab tu lha mo dbang phyed thim pa zhes 'dir mdun du de nyid lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis te //
translated: Behind, the goddess is called ‚Äúhalf of the powerful one,‚Äù and here in front, she is of the nature of the five.

original: rlung dang dbang ldan lha min me dang 'og dang mkha' dang lha dang gshin rje gned sbyin nub tu yang //
analyzed: rlung dang dbang ldan lha min me dang 'og dang mkha' dang lha dang gshin rje gned sbyin nub tu yang //
translated: Wind, Indra, Asura, Fire, below, space, gods, Yama, and Rakshasa in the west.

original: gtsug tor snying ga'i phyogs dang mgrin pa mgo bo la gnas lta ba dang ni gsang ba'i 'khor lo la //
analyzed: gtsug tor snying ga'i phyogs dang mgrin pa mgo bo la gnas lta ba dang ni gsang ba'i 'khor lo la //
translated: The wheel of the crown of the head, the heart, the throat, and the head, and the secret wheel.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad 'og dang steng du nyin zhag so so'i chu srin nas ni dus sbyor gnyis gnyis par //
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad 'og dang steng du nyin zhag so so'i chu srin nas ni dus sbyor gnyis gnyis par //
translated: The wheel with eight spokes is above and below, in each day, from Capricorn to the two signs of the zodiac.

original: gtso bo'i chu skyes rdo rje kun dang 'gyur med thig le rnams kyis rdo rje nor bu la gnas pa //üîΩkun nas dga' ba thams @152a *//
analyzed: gtso bo'i chu skyes rdo rje kun dang 'gyur med thig le rnams kyis rdo rje nor bu la gnas pa // kun nas dga' ba thams @152a *//
translated: The lotus of the principal one, all the vajras, and the bindu of unchanging bliss, abiding in the vajra jewel.

original: cad rdo rje can gyi bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas te dus ni thams cad do //
analyzed: cad rdo rje can gyi bde ba mnyam pa'i gnas te dus ni thams cad do //
translated: All the joys are the abode of the bliss of the vajra holder, all the times.

original: zla ba zhu ba bla ma'i zhal te ru ni gang zhig zhugs pa dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid de //
analyzed: zla ba zhu ba bla ma'i zhal te ru ni gang zhig zhugs pa dus kyi 'khor lo de nyid de //
translated: The face of the guru, the melting moon, and the one who enters into it, that is the wheel of time.

original: bdud rnams kyi ni dus su gsungs shing 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo 'di dag go //
analyzed: bdud rnams kyi ni dus su gsungs shing 'chi ba'i 'jigs byed mkha' 'gro ma yi 'khor lo 'di dag go //
translated: These wheels of the dakinis are said to be the time of the demons, the destroyer of the fear of death.

original: shes rab thabs kyi yi ge dag gis gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang las mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro'i ming //
analyzed: shes rab thabs kyi yi ge dag gis gnyi ga'i rigs kyi dbang las mkha' 'gro ma dang mkha' 'gro'i ming //
translated: The names of the dakinis and dakas are from the empowerment of both families, with the syllables of wisdom and means.

original: rdo rje gsum pe rkang pa gzhan dang bcas pas thog ma dbus dang tha mar phye ba bzlas bya ste //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum pe rkang pa gzhan dang bcas pas thog ma dbus dang tha mar phye ba bzlas bya ste //
translated: The repetition is to be done with the three vajras, along with the other limbs, divided into beginning, middle, and end.

original: srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa gang zhig gnyi ga'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis rang rang las kyi rjes mthun pa'o //
analyzed: srog gis byin gyis brlabs pa gang zhig gnyi ga'i bgrod pa'i dbang gis rang rang las kyi rjes mthun pa'o //
translated: The life-force consecration is the practice of one‚Äôs own karma, by the power of the movement of both.

original: ro yi 'gro rnams la gnas mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro rnams ni myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ro yi 'gro rnams la gnas mkha' 'gro ma dang rdo rje mkha' 'gro rnams ni myur du 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: The dakinis and vajra dakinis, who abide in the corpses of those who have gone to the charnel grounds, are quickly accomplished.

original: dbugs rnams gang dag skye ba'i dus su dbu ma la ni rkang pa dang bcas ro dang mdar gyur pa //
analyzed: dbugs rnams gang dag skye ba'i dus su dbu ma la ni rkang pa dang bcas ro dang mdar gyur pa //
translated: The corpses, along with the limbs, are in the madhyama at the time of the arising of the breaths.

original: de brgyad rnams kyis 'khor lor 'gyur te 'og dang mkha' yi dbang gis sgo yi dbus gnas lha mo rnams //
analyzed: de brgyad rnams kyis 'khor lor 'gyur te 'og dang mkha' yi dbang gis sgo yi dbus gnas lha mo rnams //
translated: Those eight become the cakras, and the goddesses abide in the middle of the doors by the power of space below.

original: rkang pa gcig gis bskyed pa srid pa gsum gyi yum ste phyag na gri gug dang ni thod pa can //
analyzed: rkang pa gcig gis bskyed pa srid pa gsum gyi yum ste phyag na gri gug dang ni thod pa can //
translated: The mother of the three existences is generated with one limb, holding a flaying knife and skull cup.

original: bdud rtsi bde ba'i cha yis 'khyud pa nyi ma zla ba'i steng du g-yas brkyang dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi bde ba'i cha yis 'khyud pa nyi ma zla ba'i steng du g-yas brkyang dus kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: He is embraced by the nectar of bliss, and stands upon the sun and moon in the posture of right leg extended, as KƒÅlacakra.

original: lnga gsum me lce yul dang yon tan dbang gis zla ba nyi ma'i gdan rnams chu gter rkang pa las //
analyzed: lnga gsum me lce yul dang yon tan dbang gis zla ba nyi ma'i gdan rnams chu gter rkang pa las //
translated: The five and three are the tongues of fire, and the seats of the moon and sun are by the power of the objects and the qualities, as in the Padmini Pada.

original: gza' bdun dang ni rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan ni gzhan pa rnams //
analyzed: gza' bdun dang ni rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan ni gzhan pa rnams //
translated: The seven planets and the full moon are the seats of the sun and moon, and the other seats are of the moon and sun.

original: nag po dkar po'i rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan @152b ni gzhan rnams te //
analyzed: nag po dkar po'i rdzogs pa nyi ma nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan @152b ni gzhan rnams te //
translated: The full moon and sun are black and white, and the other seats are of the moon and sun.

original: 'di nyid la ni ri bo'i gza' rnams mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la nyi ma zla ba'i gdan rnams so //
analyzed: 'di nyid la ni ri bo'i gza' rnams mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la nyi ma zla ba'i gdan rnams so //
translated: In this very [mandala], the planets are in the mountains, and the sun and moon are in the even and uneven [places].

original: zla ba nyi ma'i rkang pa rtsibs rnams dang ni padma'i 'dab ma sgo bzhi zur gyi ro rnams te //
