analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i rkang pa rtsibs rnams dang ni padma'i 'dab ma sgo bzhi zur gyi ro rnams te //
translated: The moon and sun are the spokes of the feet, and the lotus petals are the four doors and the corners.

original: slar yang rkang pa nyis 'gyur de dag rnams ni nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan rnams nyid //
analyzed: slar yang rkang pa nyis 'gyur de dag rnams ni nyin mor byed dang ri bong can gyi gdan rnams nyid //
translated: Again, the double of the feet are the seats of the sun and moon.

original: rdzogs pa gza' dang nyi ma'i rkang pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la chu gter rkang pa gdan rnams te /
analyzed: rdzogs pa gza' dang nyi ma'i rkang pa mnyam dang mi mnyam gnas la chu gter rkang pa gdan rnams te /
translated: The complete [form] is the feet of the sun and moon, the even and uneven, the abode of the water-treasury, and the seats.

original: nyi ma 'am ni gang ba'i zla ba la 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis gtso bo yang na kha sbyor la //
analyzed: nyi ma 'am ni gang ba'i zla ba la 'gyur rigs kyi dbang gis gtso bo yang na kha sbyor la //
translated: The sun or the full moon is the principal one, by the power of the family, or the union.

original: rlung la reg bya'i zhal gcig dang ni yon tan gzhan gyi dbang gis rgyas gdab zhal ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rlung la reg bya'i zhal gcig dang ni yon tan gzhan gyi dbang gis rgyas gdab zhal ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The one with the wind has one face of touch, and the seal face is two, by the power of the other qualities.

original: rtse me can la gzugs dang reg bya'i zhal ni gnyis su 'gyur te rgyas gdab zhal ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: rtse me can la gzugs dang reg bya'i zhal ni gnyis su 'gyur te rgyas gdab zhal ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The one with the flame has two faces of form and touch, and the seal face is three.üîΩThe one with the water has three faces of touch, form, and taste, and the seal face is four.

original: chu la zhal yang reg bya dang ni gzugs dang ro yi zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni bzhi pa'o; ;sa la dri la sogs pa rag bya'i mtha' yi yon tan zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: chu la zhal yang reg bya dang ni gzugs dang ro yi zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni bzhi pa'o; ;sa la dri la sogs pa rag bya'i mtha' yi yon tan zhal te rgyas gdab zhal ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The one with the earth has the qualities of smell and so forth up to touch, and the seal face is five.

original: nam kha' la ni zhal yang stong pa rnams la lnga ste rgya yis gdab pa'i zhal ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: nam kha' la ni zhal yang stong pa rnams la lnga ste rgya yis gdab pa'i zhal ni drug pa'o //
translated: The one with space has five faces of emptiness, and the seal face is six.

original: de bzhin du ni ye shes khams la 'gyur te yon tan dbang las stong pa drug gi zhal rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni ye shes khams la 'gyur te yon tan dbang las stong pa drug gi zhal rnams so //
translated: In the same way, in the knowledge element, there are six faces of emptiness, from the power of the qualities.

original: gcig ni bzhi la bsres pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba dag ste gnyis dang gsum ni bsres pa lnga //
analyzed: gcig ni bzhi la bsres pa bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba dag ste gnyis dang gsum ni bsres pa lnga //
translated: One is mixed with four, giving the result of the bliss of union; two and three are mixed with five.

original: shes rab thabs ni zhal bcu yon tan rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis zhal ni bcu gnyis rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: shes rab thabs ni zhal bcu yon tan rnam pa gsum gyi dbang gis zhal ni bcu gnyis rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Wisdom and means are ten faces, and from the power of the three aspects of the qualities, there are twelve faces in four aspects.

original: thun mtshams dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa gsum gyi zhal yang dus sbyor dbye bas kha dog gsum //
analyzed: thun mtshams dbye bas rnam pa bzhi ste rnam pa gsum gyi zhal yang dus sbyor dbye bas kha dog gsum //
translated: From the division of the periods, there are four aspects, and the three aspects of the faces are also three colors from the division of the periods.

original: dus sbyor phyed @153a *//
analyzed: dus sbyor phyed @153a *//
translated: The division of the half-periods

original: pa phyag gi dbye ba mi mnyam mnyam pa 'khyud pa dag kyang lus dang sems la ni //
analyzed: pa phyag gi dbye ba mi mnyam mnyam pa 'khyud pa dag kyang lus dang sems la ni //
translated: is the division of the hands, the unequal and equal embrace, which are also for the body and mind.üîΩThe division of the periods is earlier and later, and the three faces are the embrace of the faces of the taste, the middle one. The parts of the body are the union of wisdom and the equipoise of the embrace.

original: thun mtshams cha bshas snga phyi las te zhal gsum ro yi phyag ni 'khyud pa dbu ma'o cha shas la; ;shes rab sbyor dang snyoms par zhugs pa dag kyang dgod pa la sogs rnams ni thun gyi mngon mtshams la'o //
analyzed: thun mtshams cha bshas snga phyi las te zhal gsum ro yi phyag ni 'khyud pa dbu ma'o cha shas la; ;shes rab sbyor dang snyoms par zhugs pa dag kyang dgod pa la sogs rnams ni thun gyi mngon mtshams la'o //
translated: The laughter and so on are in the periods.

original: shes rab yan lag dmar dang ser po la ni nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: shes rab yan lag dmar dang ser po la ni nges par dus kyi 'khor lo'i bsam pa rab tu 'jug /
translated: The left and right arms of the one of wisdom are definitely the thought of KƒÅlacakra.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of Hevajra.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of Cakrasa·πÉvara.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of VajrapƒÅ·πái.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of MahƒÅmƒÅya.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of GuhyasamƒÅja.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of Hevajra.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of Cakrasa·πÉvara.

original: rdo rje can gyi g-yon mdun yang lag dkar dang sprin nag mtshungs pa dag la shes rab bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi g-yon mdun yang lag dkar dang sprin nag mtshungs pa dag la shes rab bsam pa'o //
translated: The left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of VajrapƒÅ·πái.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of MahƒÅmƒÅya.

original: mchog gi lus la shes rab bsam pas phye ba g-yon dang mdun gyi yan lag dag ni zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mchog gi lus la shes rab bsam pas phye ba g-yon dang mdun gyi yan lag dag ni zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: The left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of GuhyasamƒÅja.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of Cakrasa·πÉvara.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of Hevajra.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: drag po g-yas dang rgya ba kyi yan lag mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bsam pas bye ba de bzhi nyid //
analyzed: drag po g-yas dang rgya ba kyi yan lag mchog gi rgyal ba'i bdag po'i bsam pas bye ba de bzhi nyid //
translated: The left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of MahƒÅmƒÅya.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of GuhyasamƒÅja.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of Cakrasa·πÉvara.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of Hevajra.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of VajrapƒÅ·πái.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of MahƒÅmƒÅya.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of GuhyasamƒÅja.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of Cakrasa·πÉvara.

original: shes rab kyis phye rgyal ba dag gi rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni gnyis kye rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab kyis phye rgyal ba dag gi rab mchog tshogs kyi rigs ni gnyis kye rang bzhin nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of Hevajra.üîΩThe left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: shes rab kyi ni gtso bos phye ba nges par phyogs bral du yang rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs nyid do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni gtso bos phye ba nges par phyogs bral du yang rnal 'byor ma yi tshogs nyid do //
translated: The left and right arms of the one of wisdom are the thought of MahƒÅmƒÅya.

original: g-yas dang g-yas min nyi ma dang ni bod can gyi sku dag zung ste shar dang nub nyid kyang //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yas min nyi ma dang ni bod can gyi sku dag zung ste shar dang nub nyid kyang //
translated: The left and right arms of the one of method are the thought of Guhyasam

original: nag po ser po dag ste sngon po ljang gu dag kyang de bzhin mkha' dang sa 'og yang dag gnas //
analyzed: nag po ser po dag ste sngon po ljang gu dag kyang de bzhin mkha' dang sa 'og yang dag gnas //
translated: Black, yellow, blue, and green, likewise, space and the netherworld.

original: dkar po rnams kyi shes rab dmar mo dmar po rnams kyi ri bong 'jin pa ltar dkar de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: dkar po rnams kyi shes rab dmar mo dmar po rnams kyi ri bong 'jin pa ltar dkar de bzhin nyid //
translated: The wisdom of the white ones is red; the red ones are like the moon.

original: ser po rnams kyi kha dog nag mo dkar min rigs rnams kyi yang mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: ser po rnams kyi kha dog nag mo dkar min rigs rnams kyi yang mchog gi gser dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The color of the yellow ones is black; the non-white families are like supreme gold.

original: sngon po rnams kyi kha @153b dog sna tshogs slar yang ljang gu rnams kyi sngon po rnams su de bzhin gsungs //
analyzed: sngon po rnams kyi kha @153b dog sna tshogs slar yang ljang gu rnams kyi sngon po rnams su de bzhin gsungs //
translated: The color of the blue ones is variegated; the green ones are blue, it is said.

original: de bzhin nges par lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa'i lha rnams dag tu rig par bya //
analyzed: de bzhin nges par lha mo rnams kyi rang rigs phyogs su gnas pa'i lha rnams dag tu rig par bya //
translated: Likewise, the goddesses should be known as the gods residing in their own family directions.

original: shes rab rgyud ni sha nas slar yang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa nyid ni nub kyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: shes rab rgyud ni sha nas slar yang rnal 'byor rjes su rig pa nyid ni nub kyi zhal nas so //
translated: The wisdom tantra is from the flesh; the yoga tantra is from the face to the rear; the knowledge tantra is from the western face.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas rgyal ba'i bdag pos rnal 'byor rgyud gsungs g-yon gyi zhal nas sa bya ba la sogs so //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas rgyal ba'i bdag pos rnal 'byor rgyud gsungs g-yon gyi zhal nas sa bya ba la sogs so //
translated: From the right face, the Lord of Victors taught the yoga tantra; from the left face, the earth tantra, and so forth.

original: shar nas rnal 'byor spyod pa nyid de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas nges par dbu ma mtha' dag go /
analyzed: shar nas rnal 'byor spyod pa nyid de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas nges par dbu ma mtha' dag go /
translated: From the eastern face, the YogƒÅcƒÅra; from the western face, the Madhyamaka.

original: /mdo ste pa ni g-yas kyi zhal nas gsungs te dkar po'i zhal nas dag pa'i bye brag smra ba'o //üîΩnub kyi zhal nas nges brjod rig byed dang ni rgyal ba'i dbang pos g-yon gyi zhal nas mchod sbyin gsungs //
analyzed: /mdo ste pa ni g-yas kyi zhal nas gsungs te dkar po'i zhal nas dag pa'i bye brag smra ba'o // nub kyi zhal nas nges brjod rig byed dang ni rgyal ba'i dbang pos g-yon gyi zhal nas mchod sbyin gsungs //
translated: The S≈´tra is from the right face; from the white face, the pure VaibhƒÅ·π£ika.üîΩFrom the western face, the ·πög Veda; from the left face, the Yajur Veda; from the right face, the SƒÅman Veda.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas snyan tshig rig byed mchog gi bsreg bya'i rigs la srid srung shar gyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas snyan tshig rig byed mchog gi bsreg bya'i rigs la srid srung shar gyi zhal nas so //
translated: From the right face, the supreme ·πög Veda; from the eastern face, the Atharva Veda.

original: shar gyi zhal nas rigs can rgyud de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas mkha' lding dang ni 'byung po'i rgyud //
analyzed: shar gyi zhal nas rigs can rgyud de slar yang nub kyi zhal nas mkha' lding dang ni 'byung po'i rgyud //
translated: From the eastern face, the ItihƒÅsa; from the western face, the PurƒÅ·πáa.

original: g-yon gyi zhal nas zhi ba'i mtha' ste nyi ma 'char kha dang mtshungs g-yas pa nas ni khyab 'jug chos //
analyzed: g-yon gyi zhal nas zhi ba'i mtha' ste nyi ma 'char kha dang mtshungs g-yas pa nas ni khyab 'jug chos //
translated: From the left face, the end of peace; from the right face, the Dharma of Vi·π£·πáu.

original: rgyab nas 'phral la ldog pa mchog tu dkar ba' zhal nas g-yon gyi lta dang rab tu gnas pa ste //
analyzed: rgyab nas 'phral la ldog pa mchog tu dkar ba' zhal nas g-yon gyi lta dang rab tu gnas pa ste //
translated: From the back, the sudden; from the supreme white face, the left view, and the established.

original: g-yas nas rig pa drag po min dang slar yang rlung gi zhal nas rlung skyes tshangs pa zhi ba dag /
analyzed: g-yas nas rig pa drag po min dang slar yang rlung gi zhal nas rlung skyes tshangs pa zhi ba dag /
translated: From the right face, the wind-born Brahma, the fierce one, and again the wind,

original: stong pa'i zhal nas stong pa dbang phyug dag ni srid gsum bdag pos 'jig rten pa yi don du spros //
analyzed: stong pa'i zhal nas stong pa dbang phyug dag ni srid gsum bdag pos 'jig rten pa yi don du spros //
translated: From the empty face, the empty Mahe≈õvara, the lord of the three worlds, emanate for the sake of the world.

original: rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan dang ni gzhan pa rtsod dus rgyab kyi zhal la @154a *//üîΩsogs pa'i dbye ba las //
analyzed: rdzogs ldan gsum ldan gnyis ldan dang ni gzhan pa rtsod dus rgyab kyi zhal la @154a *// sogs pa'i dbye ba las //
translated: The face in the back, divided into the Satya, TretƒÅ, DvƒÅpara, and Kali yugas,üîΩThe four directions, according to the sequence of the hero and so on, and the four junctures by the movement of the sun,

original: de bzhin dpa' bo'i rim pa sogs dang nyi ma'i dgrod pa'i dbang gis thu mtshams bzhi po nyid dag dang // kha zas dag ni g-yas kyi zhal nas mchog tu 'jigs pa dag kyang rgyab kyi zhal nas spros pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin dpa' bo'i rim pa sogs dang nyi ma'i dgrod pa'i dbang gis thu mtshams bzhi po nyid dag dang // kha zas dag ni g-yas kyi zhal nas mchog tu 'jigs pa dag kyang rgyab kyi zhal nas spros pa ste //
translated: Food from the right face, and the most frightening from the back face,

original: mdun gyi zhal nas 'khrig pa nyid do mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas rgyal po la rmi lam dag dang gnyid //
analyzed: mdun gyi zhal nas 'khrig pa nyid do mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas rgyal po la rmi lam dag dang gnyid //
translated: Sex from the front face, and dreams and sleep from the most white face.

original: rgyab nas rje rigs gnyis skyes mi yi bdag po dang ni de bzhin dmangs rigs dag kyang rim pas 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyab nas rje rigs gnyis skyes mi yi bdag po dang ni de bzhin dmangs rigs dag kyang rim pas 'gyur //
translated: The two castes of the Kshatriyas and the Vaishyas are on the back, and the Shudras are on the right side.

original: rgyal ba'i dbag pos mdun nas thams cad yod par smra ba gsungs te g-yas nas mang pos bkur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbag pos mdun nas thams cad yod par smra ba gsungs te g-yas nas mang pos bkur ba'o //
translated: The Vaibhashika is on the front face, and the Sa·πÉmitƒ´ya is on the right side.

original: rgyab kyi zhal nas gnas brtan pa ste slar yang dge 'dun phal chen pa ni g-yon gyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: rgyab kyi zhal nas gnas brtan pa ste slar yang dge 'dun phal chen pa ni g-yon gyi zhal nas so //
translated: The Sthavira is on the back face, and the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika is on the left side.

original: mdun gyi zhal nas mi rnams dang ni slar yang rgyab kyi zhal nas dud 'gro rnams ni nges par spros //
analyzed: mdun gyi zhal nas mi rnams dang ni slar yang rgyab kyi zhal nas dud 'gro rnams ni nges par spros //
translated: The human beings are on the front face, and the animals are on the back face.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas 'byung po lha rnams mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas dmyal ba rnams dang lha min rnams //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas 'byung po lha rnams mchog tu dkar ba'i zhal nas dmyal ba rnams dang lha min rnams //
translated: The gods are on the right face, and the hell beings and asuras are on the white face.

original: mdun gyi zhal nas spros pa dag kyang snying ga'i 'khor lo nas 'gyur rgyab zhal lte ba'i 'khor lo nas //
analyzed: mdun gyi zhal nas spros pa dag kyang snying ga'i 'khor lo nas 'gyur rgyab zhal lte ba'i 'khor lo nas //
translated: The elaborations are on the face in the heart cakra, and the back face is in the navel cakra.

original: g-yas kyi zhal nas longs spyod rdzogs pa nas 'gyur kun tu g-yon gyi zhal nas lhan cig skyes pa nas //
analyzed: g-yas kyi zhal nas longs spyod rdzogs pa nas 'gyur kun tu g-yon gyi zhal nas lhan cig skyes pa nas //
translated: The enjoyment body is on the right face, and the connate is on the left face.

original: 'khor lo rnams kyi zhal gyi dbus nas lus la dngos po spro ba dang ni sdud pa nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor lo rnams kyi zhal gyi dbus nas lus la dngos po spro ba dang ni sdud pa nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The emanation and withdrawal of the elements in the body occur from the center of the face of the wheels.

original: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang rgyal ba skyed byed zhal gyi dbye ba rnams kyis yang dag go /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum po mtha' dag rnams kyang rgyal ba skyed byed zhal gyi dbye ba rnams kyis yang dag go /
translated: The entire triple world is pervaded by the faces of the Victorious Ones, which give rise to the Victorious Ones.

original: dpal ldan zla ba zla ba chu shel @154b rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin las ni chu 'byung ba //
analyzed: dpal ldan zla ba zla ba chu shel @154b rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin las ni chu 'byung ba //
translated: The glorious moon, which is the nature of water crystal, gives rise to water without conceptualization.

original: de bzhin 'jig rten du ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phung po la rten thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos 'dzag ste //
analyzed: de bzhin 'jig rten du ni rgyal ba'i bdag po'i phung po la rten thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos 'dzag ste //
translated: In the same way, in the world, the Dharma of omniscience, which is supported by the aggregates of the Victorious Ones, drips.

original: chu ni sa bon khams la kun tu brten nas ro mnyam 'gyur ba ji bzhin nyid du chos dag ni //
analyzed: chu ni sa bon khams la kun tu brten nas ro mnyam 'gyur ba ji bzhin nyid du chos dag ni //
translated: Just as water, supported by the elements of the seed, becomes of the same taste,

original: sems can rnams kyi ngag pa'i sems kyi rnam pa mang por 'gyur te sngon gyi las kyi mthu las so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngag pa'i sems kyi rnam pa mang por 'gyur te sngon gyi las kyi mthu las so //
translated: the dharmas become the many aspects of the minds of sentient beings through the power of previous karma.

original: srid gsum gnas na sems can don gyi byed po dang ni yid bzhin nor bu la yang bsam pa med //
analyzed: srid gsum gnas na sems can don gyi byed po dang ni yid bzhin nor bu la yang bsam pa med //
translated: The one who acts for the benefit of sentient beings in the three worlds of existence and the wish-fulfilling jewel have no thoughts.

original: sems lag nas de mi dge 'bras bu'i dbang gis sdig pa'i las can sems can rnams kyis mi mthong ste //
analyzed: sems lag nas de mi dge 'bras bu'i dbang gis sdig pa'i las can sems can rnams kyis mi mthong ste //
translated: The mind is not seen by beings who are evil-doers, because of the power of the result of non-virtue.

original: yid bzhin nor bu'i skyon min mi dge ba dang dge pa'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad rab tu spyod //
analyzed: yid bzhin nor bu'i skyon min mi dge ba dang dge pa'i 'bras bu sems can thams cad rab tu spyod //
translated: The result of non-virtue and virtue is the enjoyment of all beings, not the fault of the wish-fulfilling gem.

original: sems ni dag na mi de yang ni rgyal ba'i dbang por 'gyur te rgyal ba gzhan gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: sems ni dag na mi de yang ni rgyal ba'i dbang por 'gyur te rgyal ba gzhan gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If the mind is pure, that man becomes the lord of the victors. What is the use of another victor?

original: gang gis myu gu 'di bskyed skyed par byed pa de ni dngos po skyes nas rnam par nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis myu gu 'di bskyed skyed par byed pa de ni dngos po skyes nas rnam par nyams par 'gyur //
translated: The one who produces this sprout, the producer, is destroyed after the thing is produced.

original: nyas pa de yis skyes pa rab tu 'gyur te slar yang sa bon rgyal po dag gi skyed byed do //
analyzed: nyas pa de yis skyes pa rab tu 'gyur te slar yang sa bon rgyal po dag gi skyed byed do //
translated: The one who is destroyed is produced again, and again the seed is produced by the king.

original: snga ma gang de gzhan gyi dngos las shi ba zhes pa'i tshig ste rang gi ngo bos skyes pa min //
analyzed: snga ma gang de gzhan gyi dngos las shi ba zhes pa'i tshig ste rang gi ngo bos skyes pa min //
translated: The one who was before is called ‚Äúdead‚Äù from the thing of another, not by his own nature.

original: gang gis stong pa nas ni sa la 'ongs pa bde ba'i skad cig de yis stobs bcu 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis stong pa nas ni sa la 'ongs pa bde ba'i skad cig de yis stobs bcu 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: The one who is empty from that, having come to the earth, by that moment of happiness, becomes the one with the ten powers.

original: bde nas bde la rjes chags skad cig 'dir ni lhan skyes dngos po gzhan la rjes su chags pa min //
analyzed: bde nas bde la rjes chags skad cig 'dir ni lhan skyes dngos po gzhan la rjes su chags pa min //
translated: In this very moment, he is attached to the bliss of the bliss, not to the other thing which is the innate.

original: phung po gang dag de yis bskyed rnams slar yang bde ba'i skad cig de yis skyed par byed pa ste //
analyzed: phung po gang dag de yis bskyed rnams slar yang bde ba'i skad cig de yis skyed par byed pa ste //
translated: The aggregates which he has produced are again produced by that moment of bliss.

original: dag pa las chos de las gzhan te slar yang de las gzhan dang @155a *//
analyzed: dag pa las chos de las gzhan te slar yang de las gzhan dang @155a *//
translated: From the pure, from that dharma, from the other, again from the other,

original: de las rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de las rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: and from that, there is purity.

original: dag pa'i sa la sa bon btab pa las ni rtsa ba rnams dang lo ma me tog 'bras bu bzhin //
analyzed: dag pa'i sa la sa bon btab pa las ni rtsa ba rnams dang lo ma me tog 'bras bu bzhin //
translated: When a seed is planted in the pure ground, there are roots, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang mchog gi ro ste phra rab dag ni rnams pa drug /
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dang ro dang mchog gi ro ste phra rab dag ni rnams pa drug /
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, taste, and supreme taste are the six types of atoms.

original: dri la sogs pa re res dman zhing yul dang rnam par bral ba tha ma ye shes blta bya rnams //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa re res dman zhing yul dang rnam par bral ba tha ma ye shes blta bya rnams //
translated: Each one is inferior due to smell and so forth, and the last object of knowledge is free from objects.

original: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med rnams ni zung dang zung dang ri bong can te tha ma chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzugs dang gzugs med rnams ni zung dang zung dang ri bong can te tha ma chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The desire, form, and formless realms are the pairs, the rabbit, and the last, the dharmadhatu.

original: rnam pa kun ldan de dag kun nas rtag tu 'pho med bde ba lhan skyes rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa kun ldan de dag kun nas rtag tu 'pho med bde ba lhan skyes rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: Endowed with all aspects, they are always, in every way, the support of the innate bliss that is free of change.

original: slar yang sa sogs khams la phan tshun du ni gtso bo'i dngos po dag la chung ba'i dngos rnams gnas //
analyzed: slar yang sa sogs khams la phan tshun du ni gtso bo'i dngos po dag la chung ba'i dngos rnams gnas //
translated: Again, the small things are situated in the principal things, in the elements such as earth, in mutual dependence.

original: phan tshun phung po 'byung ba dang ni yul dang yul can rnams dang phan tshun bdud dang ma rig pa //
analyzed: phan tshun phung po 'byung ba dang ni yul dang yul can rnams dang phan tshun bdud dang ma rig pa //
translated: The mutual dependence of the aggregates, the elements, the sense bases, and the mutual dependence of the mƒÅras and ignorance,

original: phan tshun rjes chags ldan ri yi 'gro rnams la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i skad cig gis //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes chags ldan ri yi 'gro rnams la gnas sdug bsngal dang ni bde ba'i skad cig gis //
translated: the mutual dependence of the beings of the three realms with their attachment, and the mutual dependence of suffering and happiness in every moment,

original: rnam pa thams cad pa rnams kun nas gzhan gyi yon tan mi dga' mi phyed rdo rje yang dag gnas //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad pa rnams kun nas gzhan gyi yon tan mi dga' mi phyed rdo rje yang dag gnas //
translated: the mutual dependence of all aspects, the mutual dependence of the non-appreciation of others' qualities and the indivisibility of the vajra,

original: de dag rnams kyis dus kyi 'khor lo rdzu 'phrul rab tu gsal byed chen po du ma sprul la pa'i sku //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyis dus kyi 'khor lo rdzu 'phrul rab tu gsal byed chen po du ma sprul la pa'i sku //
translated: by them the KƒÅlacakra, the great illuminator of miracles, emanates many nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya bodies.

original: rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa lta min dang ni mi rnams dang // longs spyod rdzogs pas gzugs can rnams dang mkha' la rgyal ba'i sras sogs dgra bcom rnams la chos sku yis //
analyzed: rdo rje 'bar ba 'phro ba rnams kyis 'dod pa'i khams na gnas pa lta min dang ni mi rnams dang // longs spyod rdzogs pas gzugs can rnams dang mkha' la rgyal ba'i sras sogs dgra bcom rnams la chos sku yis //
translated: The enjoyment body burns the form realm, the bodhisattvas in the celestial realms, and the arhats.

original: stong pa'i cha yis srid gsum mtha' dag stong pa'i zad par rlung rnams kyis ni rlung gi zad bar ste //
analyzed: stong pa'i cha yis srid gsum mtha' dag stong pa'i zad par rlung rnams kyis ni rlung gi zad bar ste //
translated: The empty aspect of the enjoyment body burns the three realms, the wind ma·πá·∏çala burns the wind ma·πá·∏çala,

original: @155b me yi cha bshas rnams kyis me yi zad par chu yang 'gro la spros pa'i chu yi cha rnams kyis //üîΩ'dzin ma'i cha shas rnams kyis sa yi zad par chogs pa'i yul rnams kyis ni dngos po'i rang bzhin kun //
analyzed: @155b me yi cha bshas rnams kyis me yi zad par chu yang 'gro la spros pa'i chu yi cha rnams kyis // 'dzin ma'i cha shas rnams kyis sa yi zad par chogs pa'i yul rnams kyis ni dngos po'i rang bzhin kun //
translated: the fire aspect burns the fire ma·πá·∏çala, the water aspect burns the water ma·πá·∏çala,üîΩand the earth aspect burns the earth ma·πá·∏çala.

original: kun nas nam mkha' dag dang mtshungs pa gcig gi bdag nyid 'di ni dag pa'i sa la ston par byed //
analyzed: kun nas nam mkha' dag dang mtshungs pa gcig gi bdag nyid 'di ni dag pa'i sa la ston par byed //
translated: The nature of all things is completely the same as space. This is taught on the stage of purity.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas skur 'gyur bde ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin phyir na 'chi bar yang ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas skur 'gyur bde ba gcig pu'i rang bzhin phyir na 'chi bar yang ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, since the body of the buddhas is the nature of the sole bliss, it does not die.

original: de gcig pu las rnam pa lnga ste mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog rnams kyis ni mngon rdzogs byang chub 'di //
analyzed: de gcig pu las rnam pa lnga ste mtha' dag rgyal ba mchog rnams kyis ni mngon rdzogs byang chub 'di //
translated: From that alone, in five aspects, the supreme victors have fully realized this enlightenment.

original: rnam par nyi sh'i rang bzhin dang ni slar yang de nas sgyu 'phrul du ma'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnam par nyi sh'i rang bzhin dang ni slar yang de nas sgyu 'phrul du ma'i rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: It has the nature of the twenty-two, and then again the nature of many magical emanations.

original: de yi skad cig gcig ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur te las gzhan gyi ni rang bzhin min //
analyzed: de yi skad cig gcig ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster bar 'gyur te las gzhan gyi ni rang bzhin min //
translated: In one instant it bestows the fruit of the union of bliss, not the nature of other actions.

original: 'dir thabs 'pho med skad cig gang yin 'dir ni lhan skyes chos kyi dbyings su rab tu zhugs pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir thabs 'pho med skad cig gang yin 'dir ni lhan skyes chos kyi dbyings su rab tu zhugs pa la'o //
translated: Here, in whatever instant there is no transference of method, there is the innate entry into the dhatu.

original: mtha' yas sangs rgyas zhing rnams dang ni dpag med yon tan rnams dang na mkha' la sogs khams rnams dang // gnas dang skyes dang nyams pa rnam gsum zhes pa'i srid pa dang ni 'gro ba drug tu sems can kun //
analyzed: mtha' yas sangs rgyas zhing rnams dang ni dpag med yon tan rnams dang na mkha' la sogs khams rnams dang // gnas dang skyes dang nyams pa rnam gsum zhes pa'i srid pa dang ni 'gro ba drug tu sems can kun //
translated: The infinite buddhafields, the immeasurable qualities, the elements of space and so on, the three states of abiding, birth, and death, and all sentient beings in the six realms,

original: sangs rgyas khro bo lha sogs rnams dang snying rje'i thugs ldan bya chub sems dpa' btsun mor bcas rnams te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khro bo lha sogs rnams dang snying rje'i thugs ldan bya chub sems dpa' btsun mor bcas rnams te //
translated: The Buddhas, the wrathful deities, and so forth, and the Bodhisattvas, who are endowed with compassion, together with their queens,

original: 'di dag rnams ni srid pa gsum gyis phyag byas rgyal ba bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni srid pa gsum gyis phyag byas rgyal ba bde 'byung gcig pu'i 'khor lo gcig yin no //
translated: are the retinue of the one wheel of the Victor, the source of bliss, who is worshipped by the three worlds.

original: spu dang pags pa sha khrag ro dang bcas pa dag kyang de bzhin rus pa dang ni rkang dang rtsa //üîΩde dag rnams la srog @156a *//
analyzed: spu dang pags pa sha khrag ro dang bcas pa dag kyang de bzhin rus pa dang ni rkang dang rtsa // de dag rnams la srog @156a *//
translated: The hair, skin, flesh, blood, and marrow, as well as the bones, sinews, and veins,

original: sogs rlung ste kun nas rlung gi dbus su nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: sogs rlung ste kun nas rlung gi dbus su nyi ma zla ba'i bgrod pa'o //
translated: are the life-force and so forth, the vital energies, in the center of which is the movement of the sun and moon.

original: zla ba'i dbus su dri med nor bu bzhin du dngos po kun gyis 'khyud pa'i rnam par shes pa ste //
analyzed: zla ba'i dbus su dri med nor bu bzhin du dngos po kun gyis 'khyud pa'i rnam par shes pa ste //
translated: In the center of the moon, like a stainless jewel, is consciousness, embraced by all things.

original: de ni dngos dang dngos med gnyis med nyid dang mchog gi bdud rtsi'i go 'phang khyab byed gzho ma med do //
analyzed: de ni dngos dang dngos med gnyis med nyid dang mchog gi bdud rtsi'i go 'phang khyab byed gzho ma med do //
translated: That is the state of neither existence nor nonexistence, the supreme nectar, the all-pervading, without parts.

original: spu la sogs pa zla ba'i mtha' ni mtha' dag lus la gnas rnams gang zhigs bcur gsungs pa rnams //
analyzed: spu la sogs pa zla ba'i mtha' ni mtha' dag lus la gnas rnams gang zhigs bcur gsungs pa rnams //
translated: The hair and so forth, the end of the moon, all that abides in the body, are said to be the ten.

original: sde pa drug dang la sogs gzhan rnams de dag dus kun rnal 'byor rnams la bde mnyam 'bras bu ster //
analyzed: sde pa drug dang la sogs gzhan rnams de dag dus kun rnal 'byor rnams la bde mnyam 'bras bu ster //
translated: The six schools and others, all of them, always give the fruit of the equality of bliss to the yogis.

original: de phyir bla ma'i zhabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis ni thar pa'i slad du btsal bar bya //
analyzed: de phyir bla ma'i zhabs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis ni thar pa'i slad du btsal bar bya //
translated: Therefore, the yogis who abide at the feet of the guru should seek it for the sake of liberation.

original: lus las ma gtogs gang zhig khyab byed thar pa ster ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa min //
analyzed: lus las ma gtogs gang zhig khyab byed thar pa ster ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan ni 'ga' yang yod pa min //
translated: There is no other buddha who bestows liberation apart from the body.

original: sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas yin te sangs rgyas chen po gzhan 'dir 'jig rten khams na yod ma yin //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni sangs rgyas yin te sangs rgyas chen po gzhan 'dir 'jig rten khams na yod ma yin //
translated: Sentient beings are buddhas; there is no other great buddha in this world.

original: de rnams mnyes par byas pas dpag med srid pa gcod de rnam par mi rtog pa las so //
analyzed: de rnams mnyes par byas pas dpag med srid pa gcod de rnam par mi rtog pa las so //
translated: By pleasing them, one cuts off immeasurable existence from nonconceptuality.

original: rnal 'byor pa ni 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen po'i mtha' ru 'gro bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni 'khu bar byed na dmyal ba du 'bod la sogs chen po'i mtha' ru 'gro bar 'gyur //
translated: If the yogi hates them, he will go to the end of the great hell of the Wailing and so forth.

original: de phyir sems ni dag pa na yang mkhas dang mi mkhas skye bo rnams la 'gal ba mi bya'o //
analyzed: de phyir sems ni dag pa na yang mkhas dang mi mkhas skye bo rnams la 'gal ba mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even when the mind is pure, one should not contradict the wise and the unwise.

original: sems can dag dang 'grogs pa thob nas mi yi bdag po dag pa'i byams pa la sogs sems su 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can dag dang 'grogs pa thob nas mi yi bdag po dag pa'i byams pa la sogs sems su 'gyur //
translated: But when they are with other beings, the pure love and so on of the lords of men become the mind of enlightenment.

original: mi dge'i yon tan dang ldan 'khor ba pa ni drug po rnams kyi zhe sdang chags sogs sems @156b su 'gyur //
analyzed: mi dge'i yon tan dang ldan 'khor ba pa ni drug po rnams kyi zhe sdang chags sogs sems @156b su 'gyur //
translated: The mind of the worldly person who has the qualities of nonvirtue becomes hatred, attachment, and so on.

original: dus kun tu ni byang chub sems kyang 'gro ba dang ni 'gro bar 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur //
analyzed: dus kun tu ni byang chub sems kyang 'gro ba dang ni 'gro bar 'dod pa rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur //
translated: The mind of enlightenment is twofold: the mind of enlightenment that goes and the mind of enlightenment that wishes to go.

original: thar par 'jug pas dman zhing smon pa rnam par spangs pa dag ni thams cad dus su bdud kyi sems //
analyzed: thar par 'jug pas dman zhing smon pa rnam par spangs pa dag ni thams cad dus su bdud kyi sems //
translated: The mind of MƒÅra is always in all places for those who are inferior in entering liberation and who have abandoned aspiration.

original: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdud rnams zhi ba min pa dang ni byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba byed //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdud rnams zhi ba min pa dang ni byang chub sems dpa' zhi ba byed //
translated: The MƒÅras in the three worlds are not peaceful, but the bodhisattvas are peaceful.

original: bdud kyi dbang po rdzu 'phrul gyis dman mchog tu 'jigs byed yin te ston pa gcig pu rdzu 'phrul ldan //
analyzed: bdud kyi dbang po rdzu 'phrul gyis dman mchog tu 'jigs byed yin te ston pa gcig pu rdzu 'phrul ldan //
translated: The lord of MƒÅras is inferior in magical power, but the one teacher who has magical power is terrifying.

original: bdud rnams kyi ni bdud kyi blo dang skyo ba pa rnams kyi bde ba'i blo gros gzhan gyi snying la 'jug /
analyzed: bdud rnams kyi ni bdud kyi blo dang skyo ba pa rnams kyi bde ba'i blo gros gzhan gyi snying la 'jug /
translated: The mind of MƒÅra and the mind of happiness of the weary enter the hearts of others.

original: de phyir sangs rgyas mthu rnams kyis ni srid pa gsum po mtha' yas dus su 'jug par 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir sangs rgyas mthu rnams kyis ni srid pa gsum po mtha' yas dus su 'jug par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the Buddhas, they enter the three worlds for infinite time.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis 'jig rten khams la tshad gsungs gang yin de yang mi rnams ye shes nyid ma yin //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis 'jig rten khams la tshad gsungs gang yin de yang mi rnams ye shes nyid ma yin //
translated: The measure of the world-realms taught by the Victorious Ones is not the knowledge of humans.

original: sangs rgyas rnams la lhan skyes lus kyi dbang gis khru ni gcig dang du ma dag gi tshad med de //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams la lhan skyes lus kyi dbang gis khru ni gcig dang du ma dag gi tshad med de //
translated: The Buddhas do not have a body born from the womb, with a measure of one cubit or many.

original: las kyis ra ni srog chags rnams la sems can rjes mthun tshad dag rtag tu rab tu gsal bar byed //
analyzed: las kyis ra ni srog chags rnams la sems can rjes mthun tshad dag rtag tu rab tu gsal bar byed //
translated: By karma, the measure of beings is always clearly manifested for beings in accordance with their minds.

original: gal te tshad 'di dag gi 'dod pa brjod na lha rnams kyis 'di med pa pa zhes brjod par 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te tshad 'di dag gi 'dod pa brjod na lha rnams kyis 'di med pa pa zhes brjod par 'gyur //
translated: If this measure is expressed as desire, the gods would say it is non-existent.

original: gang gis rgyal ba'i dbang po bskyed cing nyin zhag so so'i dbang las gang gis mngal nas nges par 'byung //
analyzed: gang gis rgyal ba'i dbang po bskyed cing nyin zhag so so'i dbang las gang gis mngal nas nges par 'byung //
translated: By what the Victorious One is generated, and by what he emerges from the womb on each day,

original: skad cig gang gis 'gyur ba dag dang rnam par bral ba grub cing g-yo ba g-yo ba med gyur pa //
analyzed: skad cig gang gis 'gyur ba dag dang rnam par bral ba grub cing g-yo ba g-yo ba med gyur pa //
translated: By what instant he becomes free from change, established, and unmoving,

original: sangs rgyas bya ba de spangs nas ni bde mnyam dang bral stong pa @157a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas bya ba de spangs nas ni bde mnyam dang bral stong pa @157a *//
translated: Apart from the Buddha, who has abandoned it, there is no one who can cultivate the innate bliss, which is the state of supreme equality.

original: gzhan dag gang zhig sgom byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan dag gang zhig sgom byed pa //
translated: Even if one were to practice for many eons,

original: de yi bskal pa byed pa du ma rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid dang lhan skyes bde ba dag kyang ring //
analyzed: de yi bskal pa byed pa du ma rnams kyis sangs rgyas nyid dang lhan skyes bde ba dag kyang ring //
translated: the innate bliss of buddhahood would still be far away.üîΩGrapes do not grow from nimba trees, nectar from poison, nor lotuses from mud.

original: nim pa'i shing las rgun 'brum min te dug las bdud rtsi dang ni tshangs pas shing las 'dam skyes dang // stong pa las ni myang 'das pa des mi dge'i dbang las dge ba srog chags gsod las grub pa rnams //
analyzed: nim pa'i shing las rgun 'brum min te dug las bdud rtsi dang ni tshangs pas shing las 'dam skyes dang // stong pa las ni myang 'das pa des mi dge'i dbang las dge ba srog chags gsod las grub pa rnams //
translated: Nirvana does not come from emptiness, nor virtue from nonvirtue, nor are living beings created from the slaughter of living beings.

original: mchod sbyin dag las phyugs rnams mtho ris mchog tu zhi ba'i go 'phang dbang po rnams ni 'gog las min //
analyzed: mchod sbyin dag las phyugs rnams mtho ris mchog tu zhi ba'i go 'phang dbang po rnams ni 'gog las min //
translated: Cattle are not led to the highest heaven by sacrificial rites, nor is the state of peace attained by the cessation of the senses.

original: rig byed las ni kun mkhyen gsung dang 'gyur med bde ba g-yo med 'gyur ba ma dag sems las min //
analyzed: rig byed las ni kun mkhyen gsung dang 'gyur med bde ba g-yo med 'gyur ba ma dag sems las min //
translated: Omniscience, the speech of the Buddha, unchanging bliss, and the immovable are not to be found in the Vedas, nor in the minds of impure beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi sdig pa'i sems ni mi yi bdag po bdud kyi tshogs kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sdig pa'i sems ni mi yi bdag po bdud kyi tshogs kyis byin gyis brlabs par 'gyur //
translated: The sinful thoughts of beings are blessed by the hosts of MƒÅra, O lord of men.

original: bsod nams ye shes rjes chags bde ster dag kyang rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin brlabs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes rjes chags bde ster dag kyang rtag tu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis byin brlabs pa'o //
translated: But the virtuous, the wise, the loving, and the blissful are always blessed by the bodhisattvas.

original: gang phyir bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis bdud dang nyon mongs bcom nas mya ngan 'das par 'gro byed pa //
analyzed: gang phyir bde ba'i dam tshig dbang gis bdud dang nyon mongs bcom nas mya ngan 'das par 'gro byed pa //
translated: Because, by the power of the pledge of bliss, having conquered MƒÅra and the afflictions, one goes to nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de phyir bdud rnams nyi ma so so'i dus su de dag rnams la dum yis ni bgegs rnams byed //
analyzed: de phyir bdud rnams nyi ma so so'i dus su de dag rnams la dum yis ni bgegs rnams byed //
translated: Therefore, the MƒÅras, at their appointed times, create obstacles for them with various misfortunes.

original: rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel pa'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bstan par bya; ;de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni lus dag pa brdzong dang rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i lhan skyes bde ba 'di ni 'phel pa'i don slad dang por las kyi phyag rgya bstan par bya; ;de nas nyi ma'i gzugs ni lus dag pa brdzong dang rkang pa gtsug tor yan lag thams cad rdzogs pa ste //
translated: This innate bliss of the Victor is first taught as the karmamudrƒÅ for the sake of its increase. Then, the form of the sun is the pure body, the feet, the u·π£·πáƒ´·π£a, and all the limbs complete.

original: glog gi dbyug pa'i rjes mthun 'pho med bde ba skyed par byed ma mchan nyid @157b yan lag rab tu rdzogs //
analyzed: glog gi dbyug pa'i rjes mthun 'pho med bde ba skyed par byed ma mchan nyid @157b yan lag rab tu rdzogs //
translated: The one who generates the unchanging bliss that is in accord with the lightning-like mudra is the one who is completely perfect in the limbs.

original: rdo rje rnams kyis rab tu snang bar byed ma srid gsum gnas lus chos kyi dbyings ni de nas 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje rnams kyis rab tu snang bar byed ma srid gsum gnas lus chos kyi dbyings ni de nas 'gyur //
translated: The one who illuminates with the vajras is the one who transforms the bodies and abodes of the three existences into the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i 'bras ster phyag rgya bzhi po 'di rnams grong dang 'brog dgon dur khrod dang // mi gtsang ba dang gtsang ba'i gnas dang khyim dang lha yi khang ba thams cad du ni dus kun tu //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa'i bde ba'i 'bras ster phyag rgya bzhi po 'di rnams grong dang 'brog dgon dur khrod dang // mi gtsang ba dang gtsang ba'i gnas dang khyim dang lha yi khang ba thams cad du ni dus kun tu //
translated: These four mudras, which bestow the result of unchanging bliss, are in all towns, forests, charnel grounds, pure and impure places, houses, and temples.

original: shin tu dga' ba'i dga' ba la gnas 'jig rten lam las rab grol rigs dang rigs min mngon spyod cing //
analyzed: shin tu dga' ba'i dga' ba la gnas 'jig rten lam las rab grol rigs dang rigs min mngon spyod cing //
translated: The one who abides in the joy of supreme joy, who is completely free from worldly paths, and who engages in the proper and improper is

original: lus stobs bde ster bza' ba btung ba la sogs longs spyod dang ldan rnal 'byor rnams kyis bsgom par bya //
analyzed: lus stobs bde ster bza' ba btung ba la sogs longs spyod dang ldan rnal 'byor rnams kyis bsgom par bya //
translated: the one who bestows the bliss of physical strength and the enjoyment of food, drink, and so on.

original: rlung ni yang dag phrad pa rnams kyis glog gi me yi rtse mos spyi bo'i zla ba zhu bar byed //
analyzed: rlung ni yang dag phrad pa rnams kyis glog gi me yi rtse mos spyi bo'i zla ba zhu bar byed //
translated: The winds, having met together, cause the fire-flame of lightning to melt the moon in the head.

original: thig le gang gang zhu ba 'di las mgrin pa snying ga la son lte ba gsang ba dag la 'gog /
analyzed: thig le gang gang zhu ba 'di las mgrin pa snying ga la son lte ba gsang ba dag la 'gog /
translated: The drops, wherever they melt, are arrested in the throat, the heart, the navel, and the genitals.

original: thig le las ni g-yo ba'i khu ba rdo rje nor bu la gnas rgyal mtshan rtse la 'god pa gang //
analyzed: thig le las ni g-yo ba'i khu ba rdo rje nor bu la gnas rgyal mtshan rtse la 'god pa gang //
translated: The drop, which is the fluid that moves from the drop, is placed on the tip of the victory banner, which is the vajra jewel.

original: de ni shes rab ye shes skad cig gal te thig le'i phreng ba 'pho ba med pas bde ster na'o //
analyzed: de ni shes rab ye shes skad cig gal te thig le'i phreng ba 'pho ba med pas bde ster na'o //
translated: That is the moment of the wisdom-knowledge, if it gives bliss by the non-emission of the garland of drops.

original: de phyir g-yo med bde ba'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings kyis ster byed do //
analyzed: de phyir g-yo med bde ba'i skad cig lhan cig skyes pa 'dir ni chos kyi dbyings kyis ster byed do //
translated: Therefore, the moment of unmoving bliss, which is innate, is given here by the dharmadhatu.

original: srog gis ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa thams cad bkug cing nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom byas nas //
analyzed: srog gis ro yi 'gro ba rnams la gnas pa thams cad bkug cing nyon mongs bdud rnams bcom byas nas //
translated: Having drawn in all the life-breaths of all beings and having conquered the demons of the afflictions,

original: rdzu 'phrul kun mkhyen sa dang srid gsum bla ma nyid ni rnal 'byor rnams kyi skye ba 'di las te //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul kun mkhyen sa dang srid gsum bla ma nyid ni rnal 'byor rnams kyi skye ba 'di las te //
translated: the yogis attain the stage of omniscience and magic and the state of being the highest in the three worlds in this very life.

original: gal te lam du rab zhugs 'chi bar 'gyur na de tshe de yi 'dzin pas skye ba gzhan la'o //
analyzed: gal te lam du rab zhugs 'chi bar 'gyur na de tshe de yi 'dzin pas skye ba gzhan la'o //
translated: If one who has entered the path should die, then by the retention of that, in another birth.

original: gang zhig yon tan med cing dngos chung yul @158a *//
analyzed: gang zhig yon tan med cing dngos chung yul @158a *//
translated: He who is devoid of qualities and of little substance,

original: dang rnam bral de ni sku yi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: dang rnam bral de ni sku yi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis //
translated: is the two-fold seal of the body.

original: de nas chags pa rjes chags dang ni yon tan gter gzhan dag kyang gsung gi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: de nas chags pa rjes chags dang ni yon tan gter gzhan dag kyang gsung gi rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Then, the two-fold seal of speech is the treasure of qualities, which is the passion and the subsequent passion.

original: nag dang dkar la rjes chags yul gyi yon tan la dga' thugs kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis 'gyur te //
analyzed: nag dang dkar la rjes chags yul gyi yon tan la dga' thugs kyi phyag rgya rnam pa gnyis 'gyur te //
translated: The two-fold seal of the mind is the passion for the black and the white, and the delight in the qualities of the object.üîΩThe eight, the two, the five, the five, and the clear sky, time, and the knowledge of the void,

original: brgyad dang gnyis dang lnga dang lnga dang gsal bar mkha' dus dang ni stong pa rig byed dag gi lo; ;rin chen dbang po mi 'byung bar du rgyal ba mchog skyed ma ni rnal 'byor pa yis bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: brgyad dang gnyis dang lnga dang lnga dang gsal bar mkha' dus dang ni stong pa rig byed dag gi lo; ;rin chen dbang po mi 'byung bar du rgyal ba mchog skyed ma ni rnal 'byor pa yis bsrung bar bya //
translated: the mother who gives birth to the supreme Victor until the appearance of Ratnasambhava, should be protected by the yogi.

original: rin chen dbang po rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas //
analyzed: rin chen dbang po rab tu 'byung ba'i dus su mtha' dag yon tan gter gyi dkyil 'khor bzhengs byas nas //
translated: At the time of the appearance of Ratnasambhava, having erected the mandala of the treasure of all good qualities,

original: sangs rgyas byin rlabs sngags rnams kyis ni gsang ba'i padmar bde mnyam sngags dang bcas pa spro bya ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byin rlabs sngags rnams kyis ni gsang ba'i padmar bde mnyam sngags dang bcas pa spro bya ste //
translated: The mantras of the Buddhas' blessings should emit the mantra of the bliss of the union in the secret lotus.

original: gsang bar srung ba rab tu byas nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas byang chub sems ni myang bar bya //
analyzed: gsang bar srung ba rab tu byas nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas byang chub sems ni myang bar bya //
translated: Having well guarded the secret, one should taste the bodhicitta which is located in the vajra gem.

original: de la gang zhig bu ru gyur pa rgyal ba skyed byed sras po de ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje nyid //
analyzed: de la gang zhig bu ru gyur pa rgyal ba skyed byed sras po de ni 'jam pa'i rdo rje nyid //
translated: The son who is born there, the producer of the Victor, is Ma√±juvajra himself.

original: shes rab lhag pa las ni 'ga' zhig tshe na bu mor 'gyur te nges par sangs rgyas yum du 'gyur //
analyzed: shes rab lhag pa las ni 'ga' zhig tshe na bu mor 'gyur te nges par sangs rgyas yum du 'gyur //
translated: From the excess of wisdom, one becomes a daughter at some time, and certainly becomes the Mother of the Buddha.

original: de nas gzhan ma me tog gsum gyis padma dkar 'dzin dzam bha la dang phyag na rdo rje ste //
analyzed: de nas gzhan ma me tog gsum gyis padma dkar 'dzin dzam bha la dang phyag na rdo rje ste //
translated: Then, with the other three flowers, there is JƒÅmbhaladhƒÅranamƒÅlƒÅ and VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: me tog brgyad kyis gzhan brgyad phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas rdzu 'phrul che ldan khro bo'i rgyal po rnams //
analyzed: me tog brgyad kyis gzhan brgyad phyogs dang phyogs bral du gnas rdzu 'phrul che ldan khro bo'i rgyal po rnams //
translated: With the eight flowers, the other eight are the great miracle-workers, the kings of wrath, located in the directions and quarters.

original: zla bde la rdul gang rab tu byung ba de ni slar yang 'jam dbyangs rab tu bskyed pa ste //
analyzed: zla bde la rdul gang rab tu byung ba de ni slar yang 'jam dbyangs rab tu bskyed pa ste //
translated: The one who has gone forth, the dust of whose moon of bliss produces Ma√±jugho·π£a again,

original: lo ni nyi shu dag gi bar du so so'i rdul la byang chub @158b sems dpa' snying stobs chen po ste //
analyzed: lo ni nyi shu dag gi bar du so so'i rdul la byang chub @158b sems dpa' snying stobs chen po ste //
translated: For twenty years, in the individual particles, the Bodhisattva is of great courage.

original: de nas stong pa dang ni rig byed par du cung zad snying stobs cha shas dman par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de nas stong pa dang ni rig byed par du cung zad snying stobs cha shas dman par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: Then, for a little while, in the void and in the Veda, he is of a lesser part of courage.

original: slar yang lo ni nyi shu'i bar du de bas kyang ni snying stobs chung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'o //
analyzed: slar yang lo ni nyi shu'i bar du de bas kyang ni snying stobs chung zhing brtson 'grus chung ba'o //
translated: Then, for twenty years, he is of still less courage and less effort.

original: de nas skye gnas la ni rdul med yul ni rab tu bcom pa'i de nyams pa las dbang ma yin //
analyzed: de nas skye gnas la ni rdul med yul ni rab tu bcom pa'i de nyams pa las dbang ma yin //
translated: Then, in the womb, he is without dust, the object being destroyed, he is not subject to deterioration.

original: 'on kyang sa bon nyams pa la ni shes rab dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i gsung gis sbyin par bya //
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon nyams pa la ni shes rab dbang bskur rgyal ba'i bdag po'i gsung gis sbyin par bya //
translated: Nevertheless, the seed being deteriorated, he is given the consecration of wisdom by the speech of the Lord of the Conquerors.

original: de dag rnams kyi sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i yon tan rgyal ba'i yan lag dag gis btsal bar bya //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi sa chu me rlung nam mkha'i yon tan rgyal ba'i yan lag dag gis btsal bar bya //
translated: His qualities of earth, water, fire, wind, and space are sought by the branches of the Conqueror.

original: byang chub sems kyi bsnyen pa 'di ni sems can don gyi byed pa mo ste 'bras bu mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub sems kyi bsnyen pa 'di ni sems can don gyi byed pa mo ste 'bras bu mang por 'gyur //
translated: This service of the Thought of Enlightenment is the instrument for the sake of sentient beings, and it becomes the many fruits.

original: gang zhig khrag ni 'thung byed rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi sbrang bu de ni bdud rtsi gcig pu ste //
analyzed: gang zhig khrag ni 'thung byed rab mchog lha mi rnams kyi sbrang bu de ni bdud rtsi gcig pu ste //
translated: The supreme nectar of the gods and men is the bee that drinks the blood.

original: skyug pa snying ga gsang ba'i kha nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas chu skyes nang du rab zhugs min //
analyzed: skyug pa snying ga gsang ba'i kha nas rdo rje nor bu la gnas chu skyes nang du rab zhugs min //
translated: The vomit is not in the lotus at the vajra jewel, having entered from the mouth of the secret heart center.

original: bshang ba gci ba khrag dang sha ni mchog tu ro mnyam skyug pa'i dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ste //
analyzed: bshang ba gci ba khrag dang sha ni mchog tu ro mnyam skyug pa'i dbus su rab tu zhugs pa ste //
translated: The feces, urine, blood, and flesh are of equal taste in the center of the vomit.

original: 'di dag rnams ni ye shes bdud rtsi srid pa gsum gye bla ma yis kyang rgyud rnams kun tu bstan //
analyzed: 'di dag rnams ni ye shes bdud rtsi srid pa gsum gye bla ma yis kyang rgyud rnams kun tu bstan //
translated: These are taught in all the tantras by the guru of the three worlds, the nectar of wisdom.

original: shes rab chos 'byung la ni gang zhig lhung ba'i bde ba dag kyang rab tu 'bad pas bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: shes rab chos 'byung la ni gang zhig lhung ba'i bde ba dag kyang rab tu 'bad pas bsrung bar bya //
translated: The bliss that falls into the dharma source of wisdom should be protected with effort.

original: de yis sems can gang dag su zhig 'byung ba de ni rgyal ba'i rigs la byang chub sems dpa' nyid //
analyzed: de yis sems can gang dag su zhig 'byung ba de ni rgyal ba'i rigs la byang chub sems dpa' nyid //
translated: Whoever is born from that is a bodhisattva in the family of the Victor.

original: de phyir de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su bdud kyi pho nya srin po rnams kyis za ru 'jug /
analyzed: de phyir de ni nyin zhag so so'i dus su bdud kyi pho nya srin po rnams kyis za ru 'jug /
translated: Therefore, every day at the proper time, the messengers of the mƒÅras are allowed to eat the rakshasas.

original: shes rab me tog dang ldan zos pa zhi ba bde ba'i 'bras bu ster bar don du @159a *//üîΩ'jug par byed //
analyzed: shes rab me tog dang ldan zos pa zhi ba bde ba'i 'bras bu ster bar don du @159a *// 'jug par byed //
translated: The flower of wisdom, when eaten, gives the fruit of peace and bliss.

original: mchog gi bde ba la gnas rdo rje ma 'khums nyid kyi bar du chu skyes las ni dbyung mi bya //
analyzed: mchog gi bde ba la gnas rdo rje ma 'khums nyid kyi bar du chu skyes las ni dbyung mi bya //
translated: One should enter into the supreme bliss, not letting the vajra woman come out of the lotus until she is exhausted.

original: gang tshe 'dod pa grub pa de yi tshe na 'di ni sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs par rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: gang tshe 'dod pa grub pa de yi tshe na 'di ni sangs rgyas byin gyis brlabs par rab tu 'gyur //
translated: When the desire is fulfilled, then she becomes the consecration of the Buddha.

original: rdo rje chu skyes dag nas gzhug bya rang gi rdo rje'i snying gar ye shes 'khor lo rab bcug ste //
analyzed: rdo rje chu skyes dag nas gzhug bya rang gi rdo rje'i snying gar ye shes 'khor lo rab bcug ste //
translated: Having inserted the vajra into the lotus, one should insert the wisdom wheel into one‚Äôs vajra heart.

original: 'di yi 'od zer rnams kyi gnyi ga'i lus ni gang bar byas nas rnam pa thams cad pa nyid byed //
analyzed: 'di yi 'od zer rnams kyi gnyi ga'i lus ni gang bar byas nas rnam pa thams cad pa nyid byed //
translated: Having filled both bodies with the light rays of this, one should make them all aspects.

original: gal te 'di ni grub par ma gyur rdo rje nor bu la ni yang dag gnas pa bza' bar bya //
analyzed: gal te 'di ni grub par ma gyur rdo rje nor bu la ni yang dag gnas pa bza' bar bya //
translated: If this is not accomplished, one should eat the vajra jewel, which is well placed.

original: shes rab kyi ni chos 'byung gnas la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs ni bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ni chos 'byung gnas la mtha' dag rgyal ba'i rigs ni bsrung ba'i don du dgod par bya //
translated: In the abode of the lotus of wisdom, one should place the entire family of the Victor for the sake of protection.

original: shes rab ldan pa la'o de nas gcig pu la ste slar yang gsung ni rab gsungs sangs rgyas sku //
analyzed: shes rab ldan pa la'o de nas gcig pu la ste slar yang gsung ni rab gsungs sangs rgyas sku //
translated: Then, to the wise one alone, the Buddha body, the speech was again well spoken.

original: gang su 'di ni nyams la mngon par dga' byed g-yon can de ni rdo rje can gyis gsod par byed //
analyzed: gang su 'di ni nyams la mngon par dga' byed g-yon can de ni rdo rje can gyis gsod par byed //
translated: Whoever delights in the practice of this, the deceitful one, is killed by the vajra holder.

original: srid pa gsum gyis bdag pos drag po'i las kyi rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyis bdag pos drag po'i las kyi rang bzhin du ma'i sngags rnams rab tu gsungs pa gang //
translated: The lord of the three worlds has well proclaimed the many mantras of the nature of fierce action.

original: de dag thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed srog chags rnams la nam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bdud kyi phyogs nyams 'jigs pa skyed byed srog chags rnams la nam yang ma yin no //
translated: None of them ever causes fear or destruction to beings, the side of Mara.

original: gang zhig dran pa rnams kyi byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa //
analyzed: gang zhig dran pa rnams kyi byed po g-yul gyi yul la dga' zhing gsod byed gzhan yang mu stegs pa //
translated: The creator of memories, who delights in the field of battle and kills, and also the tirthikas,

original: de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de dag sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: de rnams la ni mchog gi rgyal sras rnams kyis srog chags bsrung ba'i don du de dag sbyar bar bya //
translated: for the sake of protecting beings, the supreme sons of the victors apply those to them.

original: mkha' 'gro rdo rje sngon rnams phyugs kyi skye bo gsod la sangs rgyas @159b pa yis gsol pa gdab mi bya //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro rdo rje sngon rnams phyugs kyi skye bo gsod la sangs rgyas @159b pa yis gsol pa gdab mi bya //
translated: The dakinis, the vajra holders, the butchers, the killers, the Buddha does not request.

original: sems can rnams ni bsrung ba'i don du srid pa gsum gyi bla mas 'jig rten khams su spros pa ste //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni bsrung ba'i don du srid pa gsum gyi bla mas 'jig rten khams su spros pa ste //
translated: For the sake of protecting sentient beings, the gurus of the three worlds emanate into the world.

original: de phyir de rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su srung bar byed cing sgrub pa po la sdang bar byed //
analyzed: de phyir de rnams nyin zhag so so'i dus su srung bar byed cing sgrub pa po la sdang bar byed //
translated: Therefore, they protect [sentient beings] at each moment of the day, and they hate the practitioner.

original: bsgrub bya dag ni las kyi mthu yis shi bar gyur na 'di ni sgrub pa po yi bdud yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dag ni las kyi mthu yis shi bar gyur na 'di ni sgrub pa po yi bdud yin no //
translated: If the one to be accomplished dies by the power of karma, this is a mƒÅra for the practitioner.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi sems ni kun nas mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis pran tshegs rig pa la rjes chags //
analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi sems ni kun nas mi dge'i 'bras bu'i dbang gis pran tshegs rig pa la rjes chags //
translated: The minds of people are attached to the knowledge of hardship by the power of the result of nonvirtue.

original: rig pa 'di yis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag skad cig gis ni bdag gi dbang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa 'di yis srid pa gsum po mtha' dag skad cig gis ni bdag gi dbang du byed pa'o //
translated: By this knowledge, the entire three worlds are brought under one‚Äôs control in an instant.

original: zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags sems kyis ye shes sbyin pa rnam par spangs nas dmyal bar rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: zhes pa'i bsam pa brkam chags sems kyis ye shes sbyin pa rnam par spangs nas dmyal bar rab tu 'jug /
translated: With a greedy mind, having abandoned the gift of wisdom, one enters into hell.

original: rgyab tu rdzas dang rang gi khyim thab gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur kye ma ngan pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: rgyab tu rdzas dang rang gi khyim thab gzhan gyi dbang 'gyur kye ma ngan pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug /
translated: One‚Äôs wealth and one‚Äôs husband are under the control of another. Alas! One enters into evil dharmas.

original: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste chos kyi skur gyur pa //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin thabs kyang min pa 'di ni lhan cig skyes pa'i sku ste chos kyi skur gyur pa //
translated: This is the innate body, the dharmakƒÅya.

original: shes rab tu thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes dang ni rnam shes dbye ba las //
analyzed: shes rab tu thabs kyi rang bzhin nges par mun pa dang bral ye shes dang ni rnam shes dbye ba las //
translated: Wisdom and method, free from darkness, are the gnosis and consciousness that arise from the differentiation of wisdom and method.

original: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po //
analyzed: 'di ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste sgra brnyan lta bu sems can du ma'i don ni byed pa po //
translated: This is the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya, the one who benefits many sentient beings like an echo.

original: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du slar yang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du slar yang 'di ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pa'i sku ru 'gyur //
translated: Again, for the sake of ripening sentient beings, this becomes the nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya of the buddhas.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' gcig pu 'di ni dus mtha'i sprin dang mchungs pa he ru ka ni byung bar gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' gcig pu 'di ni dus mtha'i sprin dang mchungs pa he ru ka ni byung bar gyur //
translated: This sole Vajrasattva is the Heruka who arises like the cloud at the end of time.

original: gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don te de yang dam tshig rgyal ba rmongs pa rnams ni bde ba'i don //
analyzed: gdug pa rnams ni smin pa'i don te de yang dam tshig rgyal ba rmongs pa rnams ni bde ba'i don //
translated: For the sake of ripening the wicked, he is also the pledge, the conqueror who confounds the ignorant.

original: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa rnams kyi de @160a *//
analyzed: rin chen dbang po sdug bsngal ldan pa rnams kyi de @160a *//
translated: For the sake of those who suffer, he is the lord of jewels.

original: yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad //
analyzed: yang pad 'dzin chags can rnams kyi chags pa'i slad //
translated: He is also the lotus holder for the sake of the passion of the passionate.

original: bgegs rnams dag ni gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri don yod grub par byung bar gyur //
analyzed: bgegs rnams dag ni gzhom pa'i don du phyag gi padma ral gri don yod grub par byung bar gyur //
translated: For the purpose of destroying the obstructors, Amoghasiddhi arose as the sword-lotus in his hand.

original: zhe sdang las ni sna tshogs yum gang dus mtha'i rtse mo can mtshungs de ni mkha' 'gro mar byung gyur //
analyzed: zhe sdang las ni sna tshogs yum gang dus mtha'i rtse mo can mtshungs de ni mkha' 'gro mar byung gyur //
translated: From hatred arose Vajravarahi, who is the same as the peak of the end of time, and she arose as the dakini.

original: gti mug dag las spyan ma zhes bya mchog gi snying rje m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal rgyu las so; ;chags las de ni gos dkar zhes bya mtha' dag yon tan gter te sgrol ma yang ni phrag dog las //
analyzed: gti mug dag las spyan ma zhes bya mchog gi snying rje m'a ma k'i ni nga rgyal rgyu las so; ;chags las de ni gos dkar zhes bya mtha' dag yon tan gter te sgrol ma yang ni phrag dog las //
translated: From delusion arose Locana, who is the supreme compassion of Mamaki, who is from pride, and from attachment she is called PƒÅ·πá·∏çaravƒÅsinƒ´, who is a treasure of all good qualities, and also TƒÅrƒÅ arose from jealousy.

original: sna tshogs can gzugs can gnyis po 'di dag yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad du yang byung bar gyur //
analyzed: sna tshogs can gzugs can gnyis po 'di dag yul dang yul can gzhan rnams thams cad du yang byung bar gyur //
translated: These two, who have various forms, arose as all the other objects and subjects.

original: phung po lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs pa brtse ba yis //
analyzed: phung po lnga yi rang bzhin rnams kyis rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga rnams la bzhugs pa brtse ba yis //
translated: Out of love, they reside in the bhagas of the Vajra Queens, who are the nature of the five aggregates.

original: nges pa rnam par ma bsgrubs bsod nams min pa bsags pa'i sems can rnams ni smin pa'i don du ste //
analyzed: nges pa rnam par ma bsgrubs bsod nams min pa bsags pa'i sems can rnams ni smin pa'i don du ste //
translated: For the purpose of ripening sentient beings who have accumulated demerits because they have not accomplished the ascertainment of reality,

original: gtsang ma'i gnas la sogs par bcom ldan gang zhig rnam par bzhugs pa nyan thos rnams kyi slad du'o //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas la sogs par bcom ldan gang zhig rnam par bzhugs pa nyan thos rnams kyi slad du'o //
translated: For the sake of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, the Blessed One abides in the Pure Abodes, and so on.

original: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog la nges pa can rnams mchog la dgos pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog la nges pa can rnams mchog la dgos pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of the supreme goal, those who are certain in the supreme state that is based on the syllable eva·πÉ.

original: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dus kun tu //
analyzed: sems can rnams ni smin pa'i slad du sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi dbye ba rnams kyis dus kun tu //
translated: For the sake of ripening sentient beings, the one with vajra body, speech, and mind always abides

original: nges par rdo rje can gyi bzhugs pa rnam gsum phyi dang nang dang gzhan du yang ni rab tu 'gyur //
analyzed: nges par rdo rje can gyi bzhugs pa rnam gsum phyi dang nang dang gzhan du yang ni rab tu 'gyur //
translated: in the three states of outer, inner, and other.

original: phyi rol sna tshogs phyogs su 'gyur te mchog gi lus la @160b srog gi rlung ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol sna tshogs phyogs su 'gyur te mchog gi lus la @160b srog gi rlung ni rab tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: In the outer world, in the various directions, the life-force wind moves in the supreme body.

original: khyab bdag gi ni sa sogs dkyil 'khor dag la rab gyur gang de rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la //
analyzed: khyab bdag gi ni sa sogs dkyil 'khor dag la rab gyur gang de rdo rje btsun mo'i bha ga la //
translated: In the ma·πá·∏çalas of earth and so on, the all-pervading lord is present. That is the bhaga of VajradhƒÅtvƒ´≈õvarƒ´.

original: sgra la sogs la gang zhig rang sems 'gro ste yul med pa yang gzhan ni da bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: sgra la sogs la gang zhig rang sems 'gro ste yul med pa yang gzhan ni da bzhin kho na'o //
translated: In sound and so on, one's own mind moves. The other is just like that, even without an object.

original: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog tu bde ba'i gnas la sku gsung thugs ni zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ae wam yi ge la gnas mchog tu bde ba'i gnas la sku gsung thugs ni zhugs pa'o //
translated: He who is established in the syllable EVAM, in the place of supreme bliss, is entered into Body, Speech, and Mind.

original: gcig pu rdo rje can ni dbye ba gsum ste yul dang yul can khams rnams kyis kyang bskor ba'o //
analyzed: gcig pu rdo rje can ni dbye ba gsum ste yul dang yul can khams rnams kyis kyang bskor ba'o //
translated: The One with the Vajra is threefold, surrounded by the objects, the subject, and the elements.

original: dus gsum gnas gsum du zhugs srid pa gsum du'ang gnas pa sems can du ma'i don gyi slad du'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gnas gsum du zhugs srid pa gsum du'ang gnas pa sems can du ma'i don gyi slad du'o //
translated: He is entered into the three times and the three places, and abides in the three existences, for the sake of the welfare of many beings.

original: rgyud rnams dag las 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes gsungs pa gang de 'di ltar bdag gis shes pa ste //
analyzed: rgyud rnams dag las 'di skad bdag gis thos zhes gsungs pa gang de 'di ltar bdag gis shes pa ste //
translated: In the tantras, it is said, Thus have I heard. This is known to be like this:

original: rdo rje can ni zla ba zhu las rod rje gang zhig spyi mgrin snying pa'i chu skyes lte gsar dang // bud med rnams kyi bha gar de ni thig le grol ba gsum gyis mchog gi padma la gnas pa //
analyzed: rdo rje can ni zla ba zhu las rod rje gang zhig spyi mgrin snying pa'i chu skyes lte gsar dang // bud med rnams kyi bha gar de ni thig le grol ba gsum gyis mchog gi padma la gnas pa //
translated: The One with the Vajra, from the melted moon, is the vajra, which is on the lotuses of the forehead, throat, heart, navel, and the bhaga of women, abiding in the supreme lotus through the three liberations of the bindu.

original: de 'dir sangs rgyas zhing du rab tu zhugs pa bcom ldan 'das su rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya //
analyzed: de 'dir sangs rgyas zhing du rab tu zhugs pa bcom ldan 'das su rnal 'byor rnams kyis rig par bya //
translated: Here, the yogis know him to be the BhagavƒÅn, who has entered into the buddhafield.

original: skye ba snga ma rang gi snying gis bskyed pa'i zhi dang chags pa la sogs dngos po rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: skye ba snga ma rang gi snying gis bskyed pa'i zhi dang chags pa la sogs dngos po rnams kyi ni //
translated: The various things, such as peace and passion, which are generated by the heart of one‚Äôs own previous birth,

original: bag chags stobs kyis 'khor lor gnas pa gcig ni du mar mthong ste smon lam yon tan dbang gis so //
analyzed: bag chags stobs kyis 'khor lor gnas pa gcig ni du mar mthong ste smon lam yon tan dbang gis so //
translated: are seen as one by the power of habitual tendencies, due to the power of the qualities of aspiration.

original: don gcig du ma'i skad ni rang rang dngos po rnams kyis srog chags rnams kyi snying la rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: don gcig du ma'i skad ni rang rang dngos po rnams kyis srog chags rnams kyi snying la rab tu 'jug /
translated: The single meaning in many languages enters the hearts of living beings by means of their individual things.

original: gnas can rnams kyi bsod nams slad du 'khor lo la gnas bsod snyoms la ni rnam par rgyu ru gshegs /
analyzed: gnas can rnams kyi bsod nams slad du 'khor lo la gnas bsod snyoms la ni rnam par rgyu ru gshegs /
translated: For the sake of the merit of those who have abodes, he goes out on his alms round, dwelling in the wheel.

original: @161a *// dud 'gro yi dvags lha min rnams dang lto 'phye lha dang mi ni 'phags pa bod la sogs rnams la //
analyzed: @161a *// dud 'gro yi dvags lha min rnams dang lto 'phye lha dang mi ni 'phags pa bod la sogs rnams la //
translated: For animals, ghosts, demigods, mahoragas, gods, humans, and noble ones such as Tibetans,

original: byung dang 'byung 'gyur da ltar byung ba rnam pa gsum dang rtag tu bden ba'i chos ni gsung byed cing //
analyzed: byung dang 'byung 'gyur da ltar byung ba rnam pa gsum dang rtag tu bden ba'i chos ni gsung byed cing //
translated: he always speaks the true Dharma, which is threefold: past, future, and present.

original: rang rang skad gzhan dag gis srid pa gsum po ma tshang med pa lam la yang dag 'god byed pa //
analyzed: rang rang skad gzhan dag gis srid pa gsum po ma tshang med pa lam la yang dag 'god byed pa //
translated: By means of his own and other languages, he perfectly establishes the three existences in the path, without exception.

original: 'di ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung ste lha yi skad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bde mnyam 'bras bu ster ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung ste lha yi skad kyang ma yin no //
translated: This is the speech of the Omniscient One, which bestows the fruit of the equality of happiness, and is not the speech of the gods.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi'ang rtogs bya min pa dpag med yon tan dang ldan sangs rgyas sprul pa sgyu ma ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi'ang rtogs bya min pa dpag med yon tan dang ldan sangs rgyas sprul pa sgyu ma ni //
translated: The magical emanation of the Buddha, which has immeasurable good qualities, is not even the object of knowledge of the Buddhas.

original: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdag nyid ston par byed de brgya byin gzhu ni ji bzhin nyid du'o //
analyzed: srid pa gsum gyi gnas su bdag nyid ston par byed de brgya byin gzhu ni ji bzhin nyid du'o //
translated: It displays itself in the abodes of the three worlds, just like the bow of Indra.

original: sna tshogs dngos rnams kyis phye rgyal ba dang bcas lha mi rnams kyi rang rang sems la rab bzhugs pa //
analyzed: sna tshogs dngos rnams kyis phye rgyal ba dang bcas lha mi rnams kyi rang rang sems la rab bzhugs pa //
translated: The various things, which abide in the minds of the gods and men, are the Conquerors.

original: 'di ni ma skyes chos te chu la nam mkha' bzhin du 'dir ni skye bar 'khrul pa ster ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma skyes chos te chu la nam mkha' bzhin du 'dir ni skye bar 'khrul pa ster ba'o //
translated: This is the unproduced dharma, which, like the sky in water, grants the error of production here.

original: rgyal ba'i sku yi rdo rje yul dang yul can rnams kyi bgrod bya min pa rnams pa thams cad pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sku yi rdo rje yul dang yul can rnams kyi bgrod bya min pa rnams pa thams cad pa //
translated: The vajra body of the Conqueror, which is not the object of the objects and the subject, is in all its aspects.

original: gsung gi rdo rje sems can thams cad rang snying skad rnams dag gis chos ni go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi rdo rje sems can thams cad rang snying skad rnams dag gis chos ni go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The vajra speech of the Conqueror is the understanding of the dharma by all sentient beings with their own languages.

original: rdo rje can gyi thugs kyi rdo rje sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin mtha' dag sa la gnas //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyi thugs kyi rdo rje sems can rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin mtha' dag sa la gnas //
translated: is the nature of the mind of all sentient beings.üîΩThe vajra of wisdom is that which holds all things,

original: dri med nor bu lta bu dngos po rnams kyi 'dzin byed gang yin de nyid ye shes rdo rje'o //
analyzed: dri med nor bu lta bu dngos po rnams kyi 'dzin byed gang yin de nyid ye shes rdo rje'o //
translated: which are like stainless jewels.üîΩThe six perfections, such as generosity, and the four,

original: sbyin pa la sogs bde mnyam 'bras ster drug dang bzhi rnams nus ma bcu po de dag rnams su gsungs //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs bde mnyam 'bras ster drug dang bzhi rnams nus ma bcu po de dag rnams su gsungs //
translated: which are said to be the ten powers, bestow the fruit of the bliss of equality.üîΩThe ten methods of those are the ten aspects of the supreme mind,

original: de dag rnams kyi thabs ni @161b dag ba mchog gi rnam bcu sems kyis gang ba'i bum pa de dag rnams //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyi thabs ni @161b dag ba mchog gi rnam bcu sems kyis gang ba'i bum pa de dag rnams //
translated: which are the vases that are filled.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs nyams pa 'dod pa zhes dang 'phrog byed rdo rje'i tshogs ni ljon pa la sogs rnams //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs nyams pa 'dod pa zhes dang 'phrog byed rdo rje'i tshogs ni ljon pa la sogs rnams //
translated: The desire to destroy the afflictions and mƒÅras, the vajra hosts that steal,üîΩthe trees, and so on, are the six emptinesses, the six mudras.

original: phyag rgyu drug rnams stong pa drug ste srid gsum skyed par byed pa ye shes rnam shes gcig pu'o //
analyzed: phyag rgyu drug rnams stong pa drug ste srid gsum skyed par byed pa ye shes rnam shes gcig pu'o //
translated: The single consciousness of wisdom that generates the three existencesüîΩis the wheel, the universal purity of the three existences.

original: 'khor lo srid gsum kun nas dang ba zhes pa bde ba rin chen 'di yi chags pa nyid dag ni //
